texts.es:
El Trio es un grupo muy unido conformado por personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Gloria Genoveva S. Mejía quien vende productos de la Avon marca reconocida en Nicaragua. Estos productos tienen mucha demanda por  la  población.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Mayra del Socorro García quien tiene un puesto de recargas telefónicas y Gema Iveth U. S. vende tortillas. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para mejorarlos y fortalecerlos.
texts.en:
El Trio is a very united group made up of hard working people. One of them is Mrs Gloria Genoveva S. Mejía who sells Avon products, a brand that is well known in Nicaragua. These products are in great demand by the population. Her fellow group members are Mayra del Socorro García, who has a stand for recharging telephones, and Gema Iveth U. S. who sells tortillas. They will invest their loans in their businesses to make improvements and strengthen them.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Fatou N. est âgée de 36 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants et a aussi la charge de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 4 ans et demi et a eu 9 expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle va acheter une paire de bœufs pour les engraisser pendant 4 ou 5 mois et les revend sur pied. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer financièrement à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Fatou N. is 36 years old, married and mother of four children. She also takes care of two other children. She has been a member of the NGOHE ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group for 4 ½ years and had nine previous experiences with credit loans. Her activity is to fatten cattle, and she will buy a pair of oxen to be fattened for four to five months, after which she will sell them on the hoof. Her earnings will allow her to participate in dealing with family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr: Mane D. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis mars 2002 et a bénéficié de 17 prêts qu'elle a remboursés régulièrement. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter 3 bœufs et des aliments de bétail afin d'engraisser les animaux et les revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe financièrement à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mane D. is 46 years old, married and mother of six children, all still under her care. She has been a member of the NGOHE ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group since March 2002 and has been granted 17 previous loans that she has regularly reimbursed. Her new loan will allow her to buy three oxen and cattle feed to fatten the animals and sell them after four to five months. She participates financially in improving the family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

Vaqif K., 42, has a veterinary drug store in a small village near Agsu. He is married and has three children, who are the meaning of his life. His drug store is very popular in his village because most of the local people are involved in livestock breeding. Vaqif says the most popular products are vaccines for cows and sheep. He applied for a loan of 1600 AZN because he would like to expand his business.

Khatira H., 38, sells jewelry and cosmetics in her small shop. She is married and has two adorable daughters. When her husband lost his job, Khatira started selling different kinds of goods. Now she is the only source of income for her family.  Owing to her easygoing character, she has gained respect among her clientele. Khatira applied for 1600 AZN to purchase more cosmetics and jewelry to sell and increase her profit. Your generosity will be very helpful.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Lidia es soltera, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Lidia vende salchipapas de manera ambulatoria en una calle transitada, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, papa y la compra de una nueva carreta.
El sueños de Lidia es construir su casa.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank "Anabella.' She is single, 48 years old, and has 6 children. Lidia is a street vendor who sells salchipapas (typical Peruvian meal including a hot dog and fried potatoes) from a vending cart each night. Lidia needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles to use to purchase cooking oil, potatoes and to buy a new cart. Lidia dreams of building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes and a new vending cart

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.es:
Basilisa es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Basilisa es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos, Basilisa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, que luego vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad. Además junto a su esposo tienen un recreo en su casa.
Basilisa necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada, papa seca y haba.
Los sueños de Basilisa es mejorar su recreo y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilisa is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She is 52 years old, married and has 6 children. Basilisa travels to different outdoor markets in the region where she buys cereals that she then sells in the wholesale markets in the city. She often takes a break with her husband at their house. Basilisa needs a loan of PEN 2500 that she will invest in the purchase of wheat, barley, potatoes and dry beans. Her dreams are to improve her time off and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase wheat, barley, potatoes and dry beans.

texts.en: Nurlan K. is a 26-year-old enthusiastic man who sells audio and video systems and DVDs. Nurlan is married and has a little son who means everything to him. Nurlan started his business four years ago and since that time, he has increased his range of goods. Since DVD and CD systems have become very popular among local people over the past 5 years, Nurlan wishes to expand his business. His store generates the only source of income for his family. Nurlan applied for a loan of 1600 AZN in order to purchase more goods for his store.

loans.name: Zenovia

texts.es:
Zenovia es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Zenovia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Zenovia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Zenovia necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gas, arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Zenovia son tener mas capital, comprar un carro para que trabaje su esposo e implementar con mas vitrinas su negocio.
texts.en:
Zenovia is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She is 30 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. Zenovia has a store in her house where she sells vegetables, meat, and groceries; an activity that she performs every day. Zenovia needs a loan of PEN 2500 that she will invest in the purchase of gas, rice, and sugar. Her dreams are to have more capital to buy a car so that her husband can work and to install more counters in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase gas, rice, and sugar.

texts.es:
Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Alejandrina es casada, tiene 64 años y 7 hijos, Alejandrina junto a su esposo tienen un foto estudio en donD. brindan servicios D. filmaciones, fotografía, revelados, venta D. cámaras, rollos.
Alejandrina necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. materiales fotográficos.
El sueños D. Alejandrina es comprar un laboratorio minidigital.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the Anabella Community Bank. She is 64 years old, is married and has 7 children. Together with her husband, Alejandrina has a photo studio where they offer film and digital photo services and sell cameras and rolls of film. Alejandrina needs a loan of PEN 3000 that she will invest in the purchase of photographic materials. Her dream is to buy a mini-digital laboratory.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Lucy es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Lucy tiene un restaurante llamado Chiquito, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de un personal. Además lucy tiene una tienda de abarrotes.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azucar.
Los sueños de Lucy es construir su casa y que su ultima hija culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is married, 54 years old, and has 3 children. Lucy has a restaurant called "Chiquito" in a rented location. She works in the restaurant every day along with an employee. In addition, Lucy has a grocery store. Lucy needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar. Lucy dreams of building her own home and having her youngest daughter complete her education.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Marisol es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Marisol es soltera, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Marisol tiene una tienda en la ciudad de Huancayo en donde vende abarrotes en general y otros productos. Además Marisol vende ropa, zapatos al por mayor en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Marisol necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatillas.
Los sueños de Marisol son tener casa propia, y tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Marisol is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is single, 38 years old, and has 3 children. Marisol has a store in the city of Huancayo where she sells groceries and other general merchandise. In addition, she sells clothing and shoes wholesale in the city of Ayacucho. Marisol needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles which she will invest in the purchase of sneakers. Marisol dreams of having her own home, and having her own place for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Plan For Real Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Plan For Real' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,400,000 from Kiva lenders for the second time. With the help of their previous Kiva loan, these entrepreneurs were able to expand their businesses. They made more profit and consequently improved their living conditions.

Aminata S. on the left in the picture is the leader of this group. The 24-year-old was born in Waterloo, is married to a businessman, and they have two children. One of Aminata’s children is in class 4 and the other is in Junior Secondary School III. For more than 10 years now, Aminata has been selling soft drinks, stout, beer and canned drinks. With her share of this loan, she will buy crates of drinks to add to her current stock.

loans.use: buy crates of drinks to add to her current stock

texts.es:
Rebeca es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Rebeca es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 1 hija, Rebeca tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende condimentos que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Rebeca necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de orégano.
Los sueños de Rebeca tener casa propia y tener una tienda de condimentos por mayor.
texts.en:
Rebeca is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is 28 years old, and has a partner and a daughter. She has a stall in the market "12 de Abril" where she sells spices and seasonings that she prepares herself, an activity that she carries out each day. Rebeca needs a loan of 600 Peruvian soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of oregano. Rebeca dreams of having her own home and having a store where she sells spices and seasonings wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.

Victoria es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Victoria tiene un salón de belleza llamado Virna, en la última semana Victoria traslado su negocio a su casa, además Victoria vende golosinas y bebidas.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vitrinas para ampliar su negocio.

Los sueños de Victoria son techar su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is single, 25 years old and has a daughter. Victoria has a beauty salon called Virna; during the last week Victoria moved the business into her house. In addition, she sells sweets and drinks. Victoria needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to purchase glass display cases to expand her business. Victoria dreams of putting a new roof on her house and providing a good education to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy glass display cases to expand her business

loans.name: Plan For Real Ii Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Plan For Real II' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 1,800,000 from Kiva lenders.

Daniel K. pictured in the middle is the leader of this group. The 33-year-old was born in Binkolo village in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. One of his children is attending primary school and the other is in secondary school. For two years now, Daniel has been selling ice cream; before that, he was a school teacher. With his share of the loan (SLL 800,000), Daniel will buy ice cream and also invest in a new business. He will buy cartons of fish.

loans.use: Buys cartons of fish to start a new business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella.
Maria es soltera, tiene 60 años y 1 hijo, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra papa, cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
El sueño de Maria es tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank "Anabella." She is single, 60 years old, and has a son. Maria travels to the different markets in the region where she sells groceries and buys potatoes and cereals, which she later sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Maria needs a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and noodles. Maria dreams of having a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and noodles.

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Hold Tight group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 4,200,000 from Kiva lenders. 

Hawa W. (pictured in the front) is the leader of this group. Hawa is 47 years of age. She was born in Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. She is married to a village headman and the two of them have three children together. All three of their children are still school-going. Hawa is a pig farmer; she will use this loan to buy 10 additional pigs. Hawa has been a pig farmer for 6 years now.

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL "LOS UNIDOS D. MOTUPE"

Ely es tesorera D. L. alcancía comunal "LOS UNIDOS D. MOTUPE", grupo que trabaja con EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD desD. hace 2 años.

Hace muchos años Ely comenzó su vida laboral, vendiendo "marcianos", helados D. hielo con nectar D. fruta y tambien vendiendo cerveza, luego conoció el negocio D. L. venta D. desayunos, así, con el afán D. querer conseguir más dinero para cubrir sus gastos familiares, abrió su negocio D. L. venta D. desayunos ambulantes, negocio que se realiza en un pequeño kiosko estacionado en una avenidad o calle muy transitada en tempranas horas, donD. venD. quinua, leche, cafe, etc junto con panes con huevon o con queso o con palta, etc. En L. actualidad comparte los gastos D. L. casa y D. sus 2 hijos con su pareja, ambos sueñan terminar D. construir su casa para así tener un negocio en casa.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Los Unidos D. Motupe" Ely is the treasurer of the communal bank "Los Unidos D. Motupe," a group that has worked with EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD for 2 years. Ely started her work life many years ago selling "marcianos," iced desserts maD. with fruit nectar, and beer. Later she became acquainted with the business of selling breakfasts, so with the desire to make more money to cover the household expenses she began to work as a street vendor selling breakfasts. She carries out this activity from a small kiosk located in a street that is very busy during the early hours, where she sells quinoa, milk, coffee, etc. along with bread with eggs or with cheese or with avocado, etc. She now shares with her partner the expenses of the home and of their 2 children. They both dream of finishing the construction on their home, so that they can have a business in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Young Traders Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Young Traders' group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 2,400,000 from Kiva lenders for the second time. With the help of their previous Kiva loan, these entrepreneurs were able to expand their businesses, made more profit and consequently improved their living conditions.

On the left in the photo is Ibraham P. who is the leader of this group. Ibraham is age 36. He was born in Freetown, is married to a businesswoman, and they have 3 children together. Two of their children are in primary school and one is still very young. Ibraham started business 2 years ago. He sells market food – rice, oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), tomatoes, etc. With his share of this loan, Ibraham will buy rice, oil, Maggi, and tomatoes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, Maggi cubes and tomatoes wholesale

texts.es:
Genaro, tiene 65 años, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Genero se dedica a la agricultura siembra papas, cebolla, maíz y cebolla de china. Genero actualmente vive solo en su domicilio su esposa y sus hijos viven en la ciudad de Lima, Genero se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como cortar leña,  cocinar,  limpiar la casa y dar de comer a los animales. Genero requiere el préstamo para comprar leña y ganado.   
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Genaro, 65, is married and has five children. Genaro lives by himself; his wife and children live in Lima. Genaro farms potatoes, onion, corn and scallions. He rises very early in the morning to do his household chores like, chopping firewood, cooking, cleaning his house and feeding his animals. Genaro needs funds to buy firewood and cattle. He is grateful for the opportunity he has been given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta in Cusco department; Pucyura is 40 minutes from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Irene M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Waterloo, a small town where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the second loan this group of teachers is applying for from Kiva lenders through SMT. Their previous SMT/Kiva loan has made a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Irene M. C. (back row, 2nd from right) is the head teacher at the school. She was born in Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. She is age 50, married with 4 children. Two of her children are now grown-ups, one is in college, and the other is in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III). She has been a head teacher at this school for over 6 years now. 

Irene wants to expand her business by investing this loan in it. She sells cigarettes, sugar, soft and hard drinks, rice, milk, cocoa, butter, Ovaltine and so on. With the loan, she will buy these items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy cigarettes, sugar, drinks, rice, milk, cocoa, butter, Ovaltine, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wintson's Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Waterloo, a small town where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the second loan this group of teachers is seeking for from Kiva lenders through SMT. Their previous SMT/Kiva loan has made a significant impact in the lives of these borrowers.

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, comes to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Mrs. Winston A.  (third from right) is the head teacher at the school. She was born in Hastings, 20 miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is age 55, a widow with two children. Both of her children are in Senior Secondary School (SSS). She has been a teacher for 34 years now. Mrs. Winston will use her share of the loan to buy house-building materials – cement, sand, etc.-- to start constructing a house consisting of two bedrooms and a parlor.

loans.use: Buy house-building material – cement, sand, etc--to start constructing a house

loans.name: Join Hands Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Join Hands” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Kadiatu D., pictured in the middle, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 49-year-old sells cigarettes, sweets, lollipops, cheese, milk, sugar, butter, etc. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days. She is seeking from Kiva lenders a loan of SLL 400,000 in order to buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current ones. 

Kadiatu D. was born in one of the several villages that make up the Sanda community, near Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. She now lives in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch, together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – one in secondary school, two in primary school, and the other is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Buy cigarettes, sweets, lollipops, cheese, milk, sugar, butter, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new tires and cement.

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sorbeh” group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. Mariatu M., pictured on the left, is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 40-year-old sells sugar, cigarettes, sweets, biscuits, mints, water, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 5 – 6 years now. She and her colleagues are seeking from Kiva lenders a loan of SLL 3,300,000 in order to invest in their businesses. Mariatu will use her share of the loan, SLL 800,000, to buy the above-mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current stock. 

Mariatu M. was born in Waterloo, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. She is married with 5 children. Her husband is a security guard and three of her children are attending secondary school, while two are adults.

loans.use: Buy sugar, cigarettes, sweets, biscuits, mints, water, etc. wholesale

texts.en: Sophie B. is 27 years old, married and the mother of four children. She lives in the region of Diourbel, Senegal, and has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for eight years. She produces peanut oil, which is an important ingredient of Senegalese cuisine. This loan allows her to buy peanuts to transform into oil. The revenues from this activity help her cover her children's school and medical expenses.

loans.name: House Wives Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “House Wives” group from Makeni. Isatu C. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She sells 'gara lappers' (locally dyed cloth, sometimes with fabricated designs), shoes, and bars of soap. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She and her colleagues are seeking from Kiva lenders a loan of SLL 4,000,000 in order to invest in their businesses. Isatu C. will use her share of SLL 800,000 to buy shoes, gara lapper-making materials, and soaps in order to improve her business. 

Isatu C. was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The 30-year-old is married with four children. Her husband is a businessman and all four of her children are attending primary school.

loans.use: Buy shoes, gara lapper-making materials, and soaps in order to improve her business

loans.name: Zhullin (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Zhullin se encuentra formado en la ciudad de Azogues en la región centro sur del país,  esta ciudad se caracterizada por la arquitectura  de sus iglesias como  la que se encuentra en la cima de una montaña y la belleza de la ciudad se han convertido en los principales atractivos turísticos,  su gente luchadora  siempre está en busca de días mejores para sus familias al igual que nuestras socias y nos lo demuestran con el esfuerzo diario que realizan en cada uno de sus trabajos.

La señora María López tiene 44 años vive en la comunidad de Zhullin en la ciudad de Azogues, concibió cinco hijos que se encuentran entre 25 y 15 años de edad, sus primeros cuatro hijos ya son casados,  tres de ellos viven en la ciudad de Quito, su hija de 18 años tambien casada  vive en su casa y comparte con ella no sólo el techo sino también los gastos del hogar mientras que su ultima hija aún es estudiante de secundaria.

Nuestra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante donde demuestra su rica sazón, también faena  chanchos los días jueves y sábados para atraer más clientela, lleva 15 años realizando sin descanso esta actividad, su horario es extendido pues inicia a las 06h00 y concluye a las 22H00 porque en el mismo local esta una pequeña tienda propiedad de su hija.

Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con  la fundación y con  el préstamo solicitado va a comprar chanchos, colas, cerveza, choclos, arroz, azúcar, etc. para abastecer su negocios.

Su meta es  tener una tienda bien surtida para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Rosa C. tiene 58 años es otra de las socia del banco comunal Zhullin, vive en su casa propia con dos hijos aun solteros de los siete que concibió  pues los otros ya son casados y viven independientes y tambien con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura 

Nuestra socia se dedica  a la cría de pollos, cuyes,  siendo esta labor inculcada por sus padres, sus animales los vende cuando tiene algun apuro  económico, se enteró de la institución y sus beneficios gracias a un promotor de crédito y  éste es su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el nuevo crédito que reciba va a comprar  cuyes y gallina para incrementar su criadero.

Su sueño es poder conservar su salud para seguir trabajando y así salir  adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
The Zhullin communal bank is in the city of Azogues in the central part of the country. This city is renowned for the architecture of its churches, like the one that is located on top of a mountain and the city’s beauty, which have become its main tourist attractions. Its residents are tenacious folk that always seek better days for their families, just like our members do, and they prove this with the daily efforts they put into their work. María López, 44, lives in the Zhullin neighborhood of Azogues. He has 5 children who are between 25 and 15 years of age. Her first four children are already married; three of them live in Quito. Her 18-year-old daughter is also married and lives with her, sharing not only the roof over their heads but also household expenses. Her youngest daughter is still in secondary school. Our member has a small restaurant where she shows off her delicious cooking. She also butchers pigs Thursdays and Saturdays to attract more customers. She has been working thus for 15 years non-stop. Her work day is extended; she starts at 6 am and ends at 10 pm because her daughter has a small store in the same locale. This is her second loan cycle with the foundation and will use these funds to buy pigs, soft-drinks, beer, corn, rice, sugar, etc. to stock her businesses. Her goal is to have a well-stocked store to provide good customer service. Rosa C., 58, is another member of the Zhullin communal bank. She lives in her own home with her two, unmarried sons and her husband, who is a farmer. She has a total of 7 children but the others are married and live independently. Rosa raises chickens and guinea pigs. She learned these skills from her parents. When she has an unexpected financial need, she sells her animals. She found out about the institution and its benefits thanks to a credit promoter. This is her second loan cycle in her communal bank. She will use this new loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens to increase the size of her nursery. Her dream is to stay healthy and continue working to get ahead with her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, soft-drinks, beer, corn, rice, sugar, etc. for her dishes in the restaurant and to stock her store; to buy guinea pigs and chickens to increase the size of her nursery.

loans.name: Tabatasu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tabatasu' group from Makeni. Katrine K. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, beans, firewood, etc. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She and her colleagues are seeking from Kiva enders a loan of SLL 2,100,000 in order to invest in their businesses. Katrine will use her share of SLL 700,000 to buy palm oil, rice, beans, firewood, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.  

Katrine K. was born in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. The 29-year-old is married with 3 children. Her husband is a driver and two of her children are attending primary school; the youngest is not of school-going age.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, beans, firewood, etc., in large quantity

loans.name: El Esfuerzo De San Felipe Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Esfuerzo de San Felipe, porque es el nombre del lugar donde fue constituido y comentan las integrantes, será la unión de esfuerzos. Está ubicado en la comunidad de San Felipe Coamango, Municipio de Chapa de Mota, en el Estado de México, en México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicita un crédito a CrediComún. 

Zenaida L. González es el la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 26 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es ama de casa y comerciante, tiene en total 4 hijos.  Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos que inició hace 2 años y a la crianza de pollos y guajolotes. Solicita el préstamo para surtirse de cosméticos y perfumes que pondrá a la venta.

Zenaida C. E. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 47 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es campesina y ama de casa, tiene en total 7 hijos 3 mujeres y 4 varones, todos casados.  Ella se dedica a la engorda de becerros que inició hace 8 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento y pastura para engordar los becerros que actualmente tiene y una vez que estos estén listos, venderlos y comprar mas para seguirlos engordando y continuar con el negocio. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente motivada y apoyada porque para ella es una nueva puerta abierta.   Quiere este crédito para engordar sus becerros y hacer crecer su negocio, ella siempre se ha dedicado a la crianza de animales y considera ha sido muy buen negocio ya que las ganancias de unos le han dado para otros pues ha podido comprar pollos y guajolotes que la han sacado de apuros y además siempre hay algo disponible para que no falte la comida en su hogar, asimismo ha comprado algunos burros que utiliza para la carga ya que sin ellos sería un trabajo pesado. También ha tenido la oportunidad de invertir en su casita y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Espera 	que su patrimonio siga creciendo para que llegada una edad, en la que ella y su esposo ya no puedan trabajar tengan un guardadito con el cual puedan vivir dignamente.

Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
-	Ana Rosario López C. (Venta de servilletas y bordados)
-	Rigoberta López C. (Crianza de pollos)
-	Josefina García Alcántara (Venta de zapato por catalogo)
-	Asunción Alcántara C. (Venta de comida)
-	Rosalba Velázquez C. (Veta de Ropa)
-	Ysidra Z.  M. (Venta de Ropa)
-	Ana Cristina C. B. (Venta de trastes)
-	Adriana López C. (Venta de Manualidades)
texts.en:
This group is called “El Esfuerzo de San Felipe” (San Felipe’s Effort) because that’s the name of the place it was formed and the members state that it will be their union of efforts. It is located in the Felipe Coamango community, Chapa de Mota municipality, Estado de México, México. It has 10 members and this is their first loan request to CrediComún. Zenaida L. González, 26, is group president. She finished 6th grade and is a housewife and a merchant. She has 4 children. She has sold cosmetics for the last 2 years; she also raises chickens and turkeys. She is asking for funds to stock up on cosmetics and perfumes to sell. Zenaida C. E., 47, is a group member. She finished 6th grade, is a housewife and farmer. She has 7 children; 3 girls and 4 boys, all of whom are married. She has raised calves for the last 8 years. She is asking for funds to buy feed and pasturage for the calves she already has and, once they reach proper weight, sell them and buy new ones to raise and continue with the business. At the moment of asking for this loan, she feels motivated and supported because she’s a new open door. She wants this loan to fatten up her calves and help her business to grow. She has always raised animals and considers this to be a profitable business because she has made profits from them that have made it possible for her to buy chickens and turkeys, which have been life savers sometimes and they have always been a sure source of nourishment for her family so that food has never been lacking. Similarly, she has bought donkeys that she uses to transport cargo because, without them, the work would be much too heavy. In addition, she has been able to invest in home improvements thus improving her quality of life. She hopes that her equity will continue to grow so that someday, when she and her husband are no longer able to work, they will have a bit of savings put away to live with dignity. The other members of the group are: - Ana Rosario López C. (Sale of napkins and embroidery) - Rigoberta López C. (Raises chickens) - Josefina García Alcántara (Catalogue shoe sales) - Asunción Alcántara C. (Sells prepared meals) - Rosalba Velázquez C. (Clothing sales) - Ysidra Z. M. (Clothing sales) - Ana Cristina C. B. (Sale of cooking utensils) - Adriana López C. (Handicrafts sales)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

Marie Louise Dié Y. is a 58-year-old married woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for 13 years and has always paid back her loans on time. Madame Y. raises cattle, a very common activity in her region since there is an important agricultural market in nearby Bambey. With this loan, she will buy young cattle to raise. The earnings from this activity allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: LUIS TIENE 22 AÑOS DE EDAD, EL ES UN CLIENTE CON BUEN COMPORTAMIENTO DE PAGO CON TFC FINANCIERA, SE DEDICA AL TRANSPORTE HACE YA DOS AÑOS, EL VIVE EN CASA DE LOS ABUELOS DE SU CONYUGE, TIENE  UN MENOR HIJO DE 02 AÑOS DE EDAD, LUIS SUEÑA CON TENER SU CASA PROPIA Y DARLE A SU HIJO LO MEJOR POR ELLO TRABAJO DIARIAMENTE PARA PODER CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE LA MANUTENCION DEL MENOR, EL SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE UNA MOTOTAXI, SE LE PROPONE EL CRÉDITO POR CONTAR CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS PERSONALES, VOLUNTAD Y CAPACIDAD DE PAGO.
texts.en:
Luis, 22, is a TFC Financiera client who has behaved well with respect to his repayment obligations. For the past 2 years he has provided public transportation services. He lives in his spouse's granparents' home and has a two-year-old son. Luis dreams with having his own house and providing the best for his son. He works daily to support his child. He is asking for funds to buy a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo). The loan is offered thanks to his good personal references, his good will and capacity to repay.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a mototaxi (three-wheel vehicle used to transport passengers and cargo).

loans.name: Violetas X Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama violetas por que las clientas se identifican con esta flor por bonitas, está ubicado en la comunidad de casa blanca en el estado de puebla pué, en México, el grupo está conformado por 11 mujeres, es la segunda vez que solicitan crédito.

La presidenta del grupo se llama Victoria M. Z., tiene 41 años, estudió hasta la secundaria se dedica a la venta de zapatos por catalogo, tiene una hija que depende de ella de 5 años, su esposo es mecánico desde hace 6 años.
Sus clientas opinan que doña Vicky es una mujer que le gusta salir a delante y que es una mujer emprendedora e independiente por buscar una mejor vida para su familia, su meta en la vida es poder darle una buena educación a su hija para que no sufra de las carencias que ella ha pasado.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar un lote de zapatos  y así surtir los pedidos que tiene hechos.
La Señora Flora C. M. tiene 21 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos de dos y tres años, su esposo se dedica a la construcción y ella estudio solo hasta la primaria se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales caseros desde hace 3 años. Ella aprendió a hacer los tamales por receta de su abuela poniendo el sazón familiar. Solicita el préstamo para comprar un triciclo que le permita trasladarse con su tamalera y así llegar a ofrecer su producto más lejos, sus clientas la conocen como una mujer joven y emprendedora al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por la confianza que le brindaron sus compañeras de grupo a pesar de ser tan joven.

El éxito para ella significa darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que no sufran las carencias que ella tuvo de niña.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son:

JUANA FLORES V. T. - VENDE COSMETICOS
BEATRIZ DIANA G. S. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
ANA MIRIAM G. A. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
ROSAURA H. G. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
MARIA ANTONIETA J. M. - VENTA DE COSMETICOS
MARIA DEL CARMEN L. J. - VENTA DE ANTOJITOS MEJICANOS
SUYAPA M. O. - VENTA DE PLATA
JOSEFINA R. QUIZAMON - VENTA DE ZAPATO
MARTINA N. C. - VENTA DE ZAPATO
texts.en:
This group is called “Violetas” (Violets) because the members identify with these beautiful flowers. It is located in the Casa Blanca community, Puebla, México. It is composed of 11 women and this is their second loan request. Victoria M. Z., 41, is the group president. She finished middle school and is in catalogue shoe sales. She has a 5-year-old daughter that depends on her and her husband has been a mechanic for 6 years. Her customers are of the opinion that Vicky is a woman who likes to get ahead; she is an independent, enterprising woman who seeks a better life for her family; her goal in life is to provide a good education for her daughter so that she won’t suffer through the needs she, herself, has endured in the past. She is requesting funds to buy a block of shoes to fill her pending orders. Flora C. M., 21, is married and has two children, who are 2 and 3 years old. Her husband is a construction worker. She only finished elementary school and has been making home-made tamales to sell for the last 3 years. She learned how to make tamales following her grandmother’s recipe so they have a homey flavor. She wants funds to buy a tricycle (three-wheel delivery cart) that will make it possible for her to transport her product from where she makes the tamales to sales locations that are farther away. Her customers know her as being a young, enterprising woman who, at the moment of asking for this loan, is happy about the trust that was placed on her by her fellow group members despite her youth. Success, for her, is providing a better education for her children so that they won’t suffer through the same needs she did as a child. The other group members are: JUANA FLORES V. T. – Sells cosmetics BEATRIZ DIANA G. S. – Sells cosmetics ANA MIRIAM G. A. - Sells cosmetics ROSAURA H. G. - Sells cosmetics MARIA ANTONIETA J. M. - Sells cosmetics MARIA DEL CARMEN L. J. – Sells typical Mexican fast-food SUYAPA M. O. – Sells silver JOSEFINA R. QUIZAMON – Shoe sales MARTINA N. C. - Shoe sales

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tricycle  (three-wheel delivery cart)

texts.es: El señor IVAN vive en la localidad de San José a 25 Km. De la ciudad de Santa Cruz, esta casado y tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. EL domicilio donde vive actualmente es donde su hermana, ya que el no cuenta con casa propia, su actividad es de transporte de pasajeros en su taxi, tiene contratos y trabaja todo el dia ya que desea comprarse un casita, su esposa es ama de casa por lo tanto el solo mantiene la casa, es una persona responsable dinamica y trabajadora. El crédito solicitado es para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo que es su fuente de trabajo. Esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Ivan lives in the town of San José, 25 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. He is married and has two school-age children. The residence where he currently lives is where his sister lives since he does not have his own house. His activity is transporting passengers in his taxi. He has contracts and works all day as he wants to buy his own house. His wife stays at home and he alone supports the family. He is a responsible, dynamic and hard-working person. The loan he requests is for the maintenance of his vehicle which is his source of work. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing their trust by granting him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Paying for seeds and field labor

texts.en:
Awa S. is a 34-year-old woman from the region of Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of three children.

Madame S. raises pigs which she sells in the grand agricultural market of nearby Bambey. The revenues generated by this activity allow her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Madame S. has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NGASCOP for six years and has always paid back her loans on time. With this loan, she will buy piglets to raise.

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CARLOTA HA INGRESADO A LA INSTITUCION EMPRENDER EN FECHA 09 DE 07 DEL AÑO 2007, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA QUE TRABAJA MAS DE 3 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE, ELLA TIENE DOS ACTIVIDADES, SU ACTIVIDAD PRINCIPAL ES LA VENTA DE LICORES Y SU SEGUNDA ACTIVIDAD ES LA  ADMINISTRACION DE SU MOVILIDAD, ES UNA PERSONA MUY EMPRENDEDORA Y DEDICADA A SU FAMILIA QUIEN HACE ESTUDIAR A SUS TRES HIJOS QUE AÚN SON PEQUEÑOS Y DESEA QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN EN EL FUTURO PROFESIONALES Y EN LO POSTERIOR SU DESEO MAXIMO ES AYUDAR A SU MAMA Y HERMANOS QUE TAMBIEN NECESITAN DE SU APOYO ES  UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE VIENDO POR EL BIENESTAR DE SUS SERES QUERIDOS. EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA PARA LA COMPRA DE LICORES Y TAMBIEN PARA EL MANTENIMIENTO DE SU MOVILIDAD, ESTA AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Carlota joined the institution on July 9, 2007. She is an long-time client who has been working for approximately three years. She is involved in two activities. The first is sale of liquor and her second is managing her vehicle. She is very entrepreneurial, dedicated to her family, and she makes her three children study. They are still very young, but she would like them to have professional careers someday. Her second priority is to help her mother and brothers, who also need her support. She is very responsible and hard working and always looking out for her loved-ones' well being. She will use the money from this loan to buy liquor and to help maintain her vehicle. She is grateful to "Emprender" and to Kiva for the trust given to her in helping her get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es: Julio César C. P. de 45 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive él solo en casa propia, esto debido a que su esposa y su única hija viven en Los Estados Unidos. Julio posee una tienda en la cual comercializa alimentos enlatados, pan, embutidos, bebidas y muchos otros productos que son de primera necesidad tanto alimenticias como para hacer los quehaceres del hogar. Desde hace 4 años y medio que el posee su propio negocio, el cual le ha permitido contar con todo lo necesario para seguir adelante. Julio solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder surtir la tienda, con todos los productos que sean necesarios para poder incrementar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee, Julio desea poder agrandarlo y de esta manera poder crecer tanto como persona así como propietario de un negocio, el cual ha sido muy rentable, ya que no posee mucha competencia en el lugar.
texts.en:
Julio César is 45 years old and resides in the municipality of San Martín, San Salvador department. He lives alone in his own house, owing to the fact that his wife and only daughter live in the United States. Julio has a store in which he sells canned goods, bread, sausage, drinks and many other products of primary necessity, as well as household products. During the 4 1/2 years that he has had his own store, it has allowed him to have all that he needs to forge ahead. Julio is soliciting a loan to stock his store with the products necessary to expand sales. This is his only source of income. Julio wants to expand the store, and in this way to grow as a person and as the proprietor of an enterprise that has been very profitable due to the lack of competition in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS OF PRIMARY NECESSITY TO SELL

texts.es: Wilfredo es un señor que está casado, tiene tres hijos de 19-13 y 12 años de edad respectivamente, todos sus hijos están a su cargo y estudiando. La casa donde vive Wilfredo y su familia es casa propia pero todavía no tiene la documentación y solo cuenta con un plano aprobado. Wilfredo se dedica a trabajar en su taxi y presta también algunas horas como servicio de seguridad en su zona. Existe mucha competencia en el servicio de taxis, no obstante el incremento de la población en  el oriente del país ha aumentado la demanda de pasajeros. El crédito fue para capital de trabajo es decir para la reparación y mejoramiento del vehículo. Wilfredo es un cliente que paga oportunamente sus amortizaciones; siendo este su cuarto crédito en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is married and has three children, who are 19, 13, and 12 years old respectively. All of his children are in school and under his care. The house that Wilfredo and his family reside in is theirs but he still hasn't formalized the documentation and only has an approved building plan. Wilfredo provides public transportation services with his taxi; he also works as a part-time security guard in his neighborhood. There is a lot of competition in the taxi business. However, population increase in the eastern part of the country has increased passenger demand. He will use the funds for maintenance and repair of his vehicle. Wilfredo is a client who repays on time; this is his 4th loan with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl  vive en la localidad de Santa Rita distante a 2 km del municipio de el Torno, su actividad principal es la de servicio de moto taxista.
Es soltero con muchas ganas de superación por lo que también se dedica a la cría de gallos de riña,  pelea de gallos (una pelea de gallos o riña de gallos es un combate que se lleva a cabo entre dos gallos de una misma raza de aves denominada "aves finas de combate", propiciados por el ser humano para su disfrute.
El origen de estas peleas está en Asia. En china ya se celebraban hace 2.500 años y es posible que mil años antes se hicieran en la india. En la antigua roma eran usadas para adquirir valentía. Posteriormente, esta práctica fue llevada a América por los conquistadores españoles. Sus deseos es poder formar su propio hogar con casa propia).
El Sr. Raúl con el dinero del credito comprara repuestos para su motocicleta, es una persona responsable y dinámica y esta muy agradecida con Emprender  y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Raul lives in the town of Santa Rita two kilometers from the municipality of Torno. His principal job is working as a taxi driver. He is single and his desire to improve his life is evident because he also raises gamecocks. Cockfighting, which is a combat between two roosters of the same species also known as "fine birds of combat", was created by humans for their enjoyment. The origin of these fights was in Asia. They began in China 2,500 years ago, and it is possible that 1,000 years before that cockfighting existed in India. In Ancient Rome gamecocks were used to inspire courage. Later, this practice was brought to the Americas by the Spanish Conquistadors. Raul great hope is to have his own house. With the loan money Raul will buy spare parts for his taxi. He is a responsible and dynamic person, and he is very thankful for the trust Emprender and Kiva have shown by awarding him with a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Neivi Esmeralda M. B. de 23 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para una empresa privada y su hija de 2 años y medio. Neivi posee un puesto en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo comercializa ropa interior femenina, galletas, papel higiénico y obsequios como arreglos con globos y dulces. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de poder incrementar sus ventas, brindándoles mayor variedad a sus clientes, los cuales puedan llegar confiadamente donde ella sabiendo que encontrarán lo que desean. Es por esta razón por la cual Neivi solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder contar con más mercadería de manera que pueda contar con mucha mas variedad de productos de los que cuenta ahora, esto la beneficiara mucho y le permitirá mejorar la estabilidad económica de su hogar.
texts.en:
Neivi Esmeralda M. B., 23, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with her husand, who works for a private firm, and their 2-and-a-half-year-old daughter. Neivi has a stall where she sells such things as: men's, women's and children's clothing, women's underwear, cooking, toilet paper, gifts like balloon arrangements and candy. She does all this with the goal in mind to increase her sales offering a greater variety of goods to her customers so that they will come to her sure that they will find what they are looking for. Neivi is seeking funds from Integral to buy more stock items so that she can have a wider variety of goods available than what she has now; this will be of great benefit to her and will allow her to improve her home's economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Nicolasa Antonia G. U. de 54 años de edad, reside en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su hija de 24 años de edad, la cual trabaja arduamente para poder ayudarle a su madre con todos los gastos del hogar, razón por la cual trabaja en un banco.  Nicolasa posee una venta de productos plásticos como canastas, masetas en diferentes tamaños, recipientes para colocar comida, recipientes grandes para colocar agua los cuales en El Salvador son llamados “guacales”, así mismo comercializa hoyas y cacerolas. Su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal de Cojutepeque, lugar en el cual cuenta con muchos clientes. es por esto que Nicolasa desea poder aumentar sus productos, sobre todo para la Semana Santa, en la cual las personas se encuentran de vacaciones y realizan diferentes viajes tanto al interior como al exterior del país, lo que provoca un incremento en las ventas de Nicolasa debido a que se venden mucho los depósitos plásticos para colocar la comida, es por esta razón que ella desea estar equipada con todo lo necesario para obtener mejores ventas en este mes de abril. Ella es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, la cual se apoya junto a su hija para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nicolasa Antonia G. U., 54, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department with her 24-year-old daughter, who works hard as a bank employee to help her mother out with household expenses. Nicolasa sells plastic items like: baskets, different size flower pots, food recipients, large plastic container for water that in El Salvador are called "guacales." She also sells pots and pans. Her business is located in Cojutepeque's municipal market, a place that attracts many customers. For this reason, Nicolasa wants to increase her stock, especially for Holy Week, in which people are on vacation and travel both to the interior of the country and abroad, which brings about an increase in sales because people need a lot of plastic food containers. She wants to be well prepared and equipped with everything she might need so that her sales will be the best possible during April. She is a cheerful, hard-working woman who attempts to get ahead in life with her daughter's help.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Catalina tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Juan con quien tiene 3 hijos. Su vivienda es propia y viven allí desde hace unos 8 años. También viven con ellos su cuñada y a veces su suegra que vienen por temporadas a visitarlos. Catalina tiene su negocio de Restaurant donde sirve unos riquísimos platos típicos de Cochabamba los cuales son muy apetecidos por los habitantes de la zona que también son de esa región del país. El negocio lo tienen desde que se fueron a vivir en la zona con lo que han ampliado y mejorado su vivienda. Por su zona no tienen competencia ya que están ubicados por el kilometro 14 de una avenida muy transitada y a pesar de ello tienen mucha clientela fija. El crédito lo necesita para la compra de sillas, mesas y más fardos de cerveza ya que su negocio ha crecido y necesita estos implementos para atender mejor a su clientela. Catalina es una excelente cliente, responsable y con mucha antigüedad con Agrocapital. También trabaja con en otras entidades financieras donde también demuestra su responsabilidad en sus pagos. Se hace notar que en la foto aparecen 2 de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Catalina is 44 years old. She is married to Juan and they have 3 children. They have their own home and have lived there for eight years. Her sister-in-law lives with them also, and sometimes her mother-in-law when she comes to visit. Catalina has a restaurant where she serves delicious dishes typical of Cohabamba. The dishes are enjoyed by the people within the zone. They’ve had this business since they went to live in the zone and it has allowed them to expand and improve their home. They have no competition, as they are located on the 14th kilometer of a well travelled main street and they also have steady customers. They need this loan in order to buy chairs, tables, and more cases of beer. Their business has grown and they need these items to better serve their customers. Catalina is an excellent client. She has been responsible and a client of Agrocapital for some time. She has also worked with other financial institutions and has also demonstrated responsibility with her payments. Her two daughters appear in the photograph with her.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Rafael Arcángel

texts.es: Rafael Arcángel B. de 36 años de edad, reside en Lourdes Colón, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, y junto a sus dos hijas menores de edad, las cuales son estudiantes de la escuela  nacional del lugar. Rafael se dedica a la venta de bicicletas, y así mismo a la reparación de estas, debido a que posee mucha experiencia en la reparación de estas, cuenta con muchos clientes, así mismo cuenta con la facilidad de estar ubicado en calle principal, lo cual le permite ser visualizado por casi todas las personas que van de paso. Rafael solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda incrementar el número de bicicletas que tiene a la venta, así mismo comprar más repuestos y todo lo necesario para repararlas. Para Rafael es de mucha importancia poder mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que es gracias a este como el puede contar con el dinero necesario para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Rafael Arcángel B., 36, lives in Lourdes Colón, La Libertad department, with his wife, who is a housewife, and his two, minor daughters, who are students in the local public school. Rafael sells and repairs bicycles; he has a lot of experience in bicycle repair and has a lot of customers. He also has the advantage of being located on the main street which makes it possible for him to be seen by almost all the people who pass by there. Rafael is asking for funds to increase his bicycle stock as well as to buy replacement parts and supplies needed for bicycle repair. For Rafael, it is very important to improve his business' condition because it is thanks to it that he can have the funds necessary to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bicycles and bicycle replacement parts.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela es una señora que está Casada, tiene 25 años de edad y también tiene con su esposo un hijito de dos años de edad, actualmente alquila no cuenta con un domicilio propio así es que la familia alquila una casita para vivir, con el crédito Gabriela y su esposo se compraron un lote de terreno para construir su vivienda. Hace bastante tiempo ella trabaja como secretaria de una Coop.de Transporte de la provincia, actualmente la han trasladado a la ciudad, paralelamente ella comercia con cosméticos negocio que le da buenos resultados generándole un ingreso extra. En su trabajo tiene un ingreso seguro, el negocio de cosméticos hay bastante competencia, pero ella tiene la ventaja que le vende a los mismos socios de la cooperativa en la que trabaja. El crédito se compró un lote de terreno para construir su vivienda. Gabriela es una buena persona que ha cumplido hasta la fecha con sus pagos correspondientes.
texts.en:
Gabriela is 25 years old and married; she and her husband also have a little two-year-old son. She currently rents and does not have a home of her own; the family rents a little house to live in. With the loan, Gabriela and her husband bought a plot of land to build their home. Starting quite a while ago, Gabriela has worked as a secretary for a transportation cooperative in her province. Recently, they have transferred her to the city. Parallel to this, she also sells cosmetics, and this business is going well and generating extra income for her. From her work she has a steady income; there is plenty of competition in the cosmetics business, but she has the advantage of selling to the members of the cooperative where she works. The loan was used to buy a plot of land to build their home. Gabriela is a good person who has made all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a lot and paying debt

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: Lorena G. A. de 24 años de edad, reside en Sacacoyo, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado de una empresa privada, y junto a su pequeña hija de 5 meses de vida. Lorena posee su propia panadería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar el pan y posteriormente comercializar tanto en su casa, lugar en el cual esta ubicada la panadería, como a sus clientes, a los cuales debe ir a repartir el pan. Cuenta con el beneficio de poseer muchos clientes los que hacen pedido en grandes cantidades y que son fieles a su negocio. Lorena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina por mayor para poder obtenerla más barata, así como también manteca, azúcar, miel, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son muy importantes para la realización del pan. A pesar que salir adelante con su negocio ha sido bastante difícil, ella ha sabido mantenerse firme con el deseo de crecer como micro empresaria y así brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Lorena G. A., 24, lives in Sacacoyo, located in the La Libertad department. She lives with her husband, who works as an employee for a private company, and with her small daughter who is 5 months old. Lorena has her own bakery, where she is responsible for making the bread and later selling it. She sells some of the bread from her home, where the bakery is located, and she also takes the bread to distribute to some of her customers. She has the advantage of having many customers who put in orders for large quantities, and who are loyal to her business. Lorena requests a loan which she will use to buy flour at wholesale so that she can get it at a lower cost, as well as butter, sugar, honey, yeast and other products that are very important for making bread. Although developing her business has been fairly difficult, she has stood strong with the desire to grow as a small businesswoman and in this way provide a better future for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make bread

texts.es: Lorena del Carmen L. D. C. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el pequeño pueblo D. Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como motorista del transporte público y junto a sus tres hijos D. 11, 8 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedica a estudiar. Lorena posee una venta D. carne D. res, en la cual cada domingo por la mañana ella se encarga D. comprar las reses que posteriormente comercializa durante toda la semana, cuenta con muchos clientes fijos, los cuales la prefieren por la calidad D. la carne que ella venD., así mismo por todos los años que posee D. tener este negocio, lo cual la ha hecho muy conocida. Lorena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar dos reses más cada semana, para poder aumentar su productos y en consecuencia sus ventas. Debido a que ella cuenta con muy buenas ventas es por lo que desea obtener el préstamo gracias a integral y contar con todo lo necesario para poder crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lorena is 39 years old and lives in the small village Cojutepeque, located in the Cuscatlán department. She lives with her husband, who works as a driver for the public transport, and her three children, ages 11, 8, and 7. All three attend school full time. Lorena sells beef. Every Sunday morning she buys the meat that she will portion out sell throughout that week. She has many steady customers who like buying from her because of the quality of meet that she sells. She has had this business for many years and she is well known. She is requesting this loan in order to buy two more heads of cattle each week, in order to increase her inventory and subsequent sales. She already makes many sales, so she is asking for this loan in order to have everything she needs to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

texts.es: Marcelina es una señora que cuenta con 34 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años, actualmente se cambio de vivienda a una familiar, su entorno familiar es muy unido ya que tanto la madre como los hijos realizan la venta a diario juntos. Marcelina tiene bastante experiencia en el negocio, se dedica a la venta de bijouteria (joyería de fantasía), tiene dos puestos uno por el correo de la ciudad y otro cerca de una facultad (por la universidad) En su primer puesto tiene muy poca  competencia ya que son solo tres a cuatro puestos que se dedican a la bijouteria, en el puesto de la facultad simplemente NO tiene competencia ya que es la  única vendedora. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería es decir para comprar bijouteria variada. Sobre su historial en Agrocapital tuvo algunos retrasos pero justificados por la misma Marcelina, ahora en otras entidades financieras al igual que en la nuestra demuestra puntualidad en sus pagos, esto lo demostró con sus boletas de pago.
texts.en:
Marcelina is a 34-year-old woman with 2 children, aged 9 and 5. She has recently moved in with another family member. Her family is very united, since both the mother and the children work together every day to sell their merchandise. Marcelina sells costume jewelry, and she has quite a lot of experience in this business. She has two sales locations, one by the city's post office and the other near a department of the university. Her first sales stand has very little competition, since there are only three or four stands selling jewelry. At her stand near the university, she simply has NO competition at all, since she is the only vendor. The aim of this loan is to purchase merchandise -- that is, to buy a variety of costume jewelry. Regarding her history with Agrocapital, she has had a few delays, but these have been justifiably explained by Marcelina, and now she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments with other financial entities as well as ours, as she has shown with her payment receipts.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Isabel es una señora que tiene 30 años de edad, vive en alquiler en la casa de sus padres y  tiene dos hijos, mismos que son de total dependencia de ella. Isabel se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos, ropa y calzados  y sus principales clientes están principalmente en las  ferias de la ciudad.
La competencia es alta en el rubro al cual se dedica, pero cuenta con clientela  que demanda sus productos, principalmente por los precios a los cuales oferta sus productos.
Con el crédito incrementara su capital de operaciones, principalmente para la compra de ropa, ya que tiene buena demanda en la actualidad.
Este es el cuarto crédito  al que accede Isabel y es recomendada por los padres, quienes garantizan personalmente todos los créditos que obtuvo en Agrocapital,  habiéndose observado buen cumplimiento de pago.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 30-year old woman who rents a room in her parents’ house. She has two children who are totally dependent on her. Her job is selling cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, and most of her customers come to the city’s markets where she has a stall. Competition is high in this line of work, but Isabel has regular customers who seek her products, mostly because of the good prices she offers. With this loan she will increase her working capital allowing her to buy more clothing for which there is a high demand at the moment. This is Isabel’s fourth loan. She was recommended by her parents who personally guarantee all the loans that she has had from Kiva partner, Agrocapital. They have seen that she has always made her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Ignacio tiene 50 años de edad, está casado y cuenta con 6 hijos que son menores de edad, tiene una vivienda propia. Ignacio es empleado de la Alcaldía Municipal de la localidad donde vive lleva 3 años trabajando en esta actividad, además que tiene un moto taxi que lo hace trabajar, del cual recibe una renta diaria. En cuanto al servicio de moto taxi, tiene muy poca competencia, por lo que son pocos los que se dedican a esta actividad en la localidad donde vive. Y como empleado fijo ya le hicieron renovación de contrato 2 gestiones. El crédito es para comprar una segunda moto la que hará trabajar también como moto taxi, esta moto la va a manejar su hijo quién la trabajará por una renta diaria de Bs. 30.-. Esta operación es la tercera de Ignacio en la institución y tuvo un buen comportamiento en todas sus cuotas anteriores.
texts.en:
50-year old Ignacio is married, has six children, and lives in his own house. He has worked for three years in the municipal office in the town where he lives. He also owns a motor-cycle taxi which he rents out, and from which he gets a daily income. With regard to his taxi business, there is little competition as few people take up this line of work in the town where he lives. His contract at the municipal office has been renewed twice. The loan will be used to buy a second motor-cycle, also to be used as a taxi, and driven by his son who will rent it from him for Bs. 30 per day. This is Ignacio’s third loan with this organization, and he has always been responsible about making his repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Reinelda es soltera y tiene un hijo de 17 años, ambos viven en el lugar donde Reinelda trabaja. Reinelda trabaja como cuidadora de una quinta en el mismo lugar realiza todo tipo de costuras bordados y otros, su amiga que es la codeudora del crédito es portera de un colegio y vende todo tipo de refrigerios y dulces en los recreos, ambas costuran y bordan en el mismo lugar. La competencia es media en su trabajo pero por la antigüedad que tienen y la experiencia ambas son bien cotizadas para sus costuras y bordados. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo en la compra de telas  y otros para efectuar las costuras de uniformes y otros. Esta será su cuarta operación juntas con una buena puntualidad de pago.
texts.en:
Reinelda is single and has a 17-year old son. They live in the place where Reinelda works. She is the caretaker at a farm, and also does all kind of sewing and embroidery in this same place. She and her friend are taking out the loan together. Her friend is a caretaker at a school and sells refreshments and candy at recess. They both do sewing and embroidery. There is some competition in this field of work, but because they have been doing it for a long time and have lots of experience, they are sought after for their work. The loan will be used to buy material and other items for making uniforms etc. This will be their fourth venture together, and they have always been punctual with their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Ángela B. de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento. Es viuda con 5 hijos de 29, 32, 27, 24, 16 años. 

Debido a la falta de ingresos y la desesperante idea de tener su propio negocio Ángela inicio vendiendo ropa a sus vecinos. Ya tiene un año como comerciante informal en los sectores de Guayaquil.   

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 10h00 hasta las 18h00 todos los días, vendiendo camisas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc. Al salir a vender la ropa ella siente la inseguridad del sector y esto le es de inconveniente para su negocio. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar ropa y artículos para la temporada playera. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y clientes establecidos.
texts.en:
Ángela is 58 years old and lives in a cement home within a Peruvian zone in the Guayaquil perimeter. She is a widow and has 5 children, ages 29, 32, 27, 24, and 16. Her lack of income and desperation motivated her to start her own business selling clothing to her neighbors. She has been doing this for one year in different parts of Guayaquil. Now she works every day from 10:00 am to 6:00 pm, selling shirts, pants, undergarments, etc. When she goes out to sell, she can feel the area’s insecurity and this is bad for her business. She wants to use the money from this loan to buy clothing and articles for the beach season. She hopes to one day have her own permanent location and regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Natanael Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA  NATANAEL, EN HONOR AL SANTO PATRON DEL PUEBLO   “SAN BARTOLO” CONOCIDO EN NAHUATL  COMO NATANAEL.

ESTA HUBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SAN BARTOLO COHUECAN EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MEXICO, MUY CERCA DE LOS LÍMITES CON EL ESTADO DE MORELOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 12 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN.

EVA S. V. ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO.TIENE 31 AÑOS Y SOLO ESTUDIO LA PRIMARIA, ES ALFARERA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS (1 MUJER DE 10 AÑOS Y DOS VARONES DE 16 Y 5 AÑOS. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE ALFARERIA DESDE LOS 11 AÑOS Y YA LLEVA 20 AÑOS DEDICANDOSE A LA ALFARERIA, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR,  SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA, COMO EL BARRO, LEÑA, GRIETA Y COLORANTES.  SU SUEÑO ES QUE SUS HIJOS SEAN PROFESIONISTAS Y QUE TENGAN UNA MEJOR  VIVIENDA, YA QUE  HACE  ALGUNOS AÑOS SU TECHO ERA DE LAMINA DE CARTON Y AHORA ES DE CONCRETO GRACIAS A LAS GANANCIAS DE SU NEGOCIO LA HA MEJORANDO.

EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS SON:

DULCE MARIA A. G. VENDE PAN
MARIA TOMASA G. G. VENDEN PAN
MARIA TERESA M. V.  SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
CLAUDIA A. D.  SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
FLORENCIA V. P. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
CARMELA M. R. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
CRISPINA E. L. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
JOSEFINA P. O. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
GUILLERMINA A. A. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
MARIA ISABEL P. V. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
MARIA CLAUDIA D. G. SE DEDICA A LA ALFARERIA
texts.en:
This group's name is Natanael, in honor of the patron saint of their town, "San Bartolo," known in Nahuatl as Natanael. The group is located in the community of San Bartolo Cohuecan in the state of Pueblo, Mexico. It is very close to the border with the state of Morelos. The group is made up of 12 members, and this is the first time they are requesting a loan from Credicomun. Eva S. V. is the treasurer of the group. She is 31 years old and has only had an elementary level education. She is a potter and has 3 children, (a 10-year old daughter, a sixteen-year old son and a 5-year old son). She started making her living making pottery when she was 11 years old and has been doing so for 20 years; it is a family tradition. She is requesting the loan to purchase the raw materials she uses, like mud, wood, coloring agents and other supplies. Her dream is that her children become professionals and have a better dwelling, since a few years ago their ceiling was made of sheets of cardboard. It is now made of concrete; thanks to the earnings from her business, they have improved it. The names of the members of the group are: Dulce Maria A. G. sells bread. Maria Tomasa G. G. sells bread. Maria Teresa M. Velazques makes her living making pottery. Claudia A. D. makes her living making pottery. Florencia V. P. makes her living making pottery. Carmela M. R. makes her living making pottery. Crispina Espana L. makes her living making pottery. Josefina P. O. makes her living making pottery. Guillermina A. A. makes her living making pottery. Maria Isabel P. Vazques makies her living making pottery. Maria Claudia D. G. makes her living making pottery.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like mud, wood, dyes and other supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es: Rosa Idalia M. G. de 30 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Paz, lugar en el cual vive junto a su suegra, su cuñado y tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales dependen por completo de ella, quienes son menores de edad, y se dedican a estudiar. Debido a la falta de empleo, Rosa decidió iniciar su negocio, en el cual pudiera obtener el dinero necesario para sostener a sus hijos, es por esto que ella posee una tortillería en la cual se encarga de elaborar las tortillas de lunes a domingo a cada mediodía, así mismo los días sábados y domingos por la noche se encarga de elaborar deliciosas pupusas, las cuales son muy bien comercializadas, ya que cuenta con una amplia demanda de sus productos, por el delicioso sabor que poseen. Con todo el deseo de seguir adelante y brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos, Rosa solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar la materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas y las pupusas, tales como: maíz, queso, frijoles, y otros más.
texts.en:
Rosa Idalia Mancia Gomez is 30 years old and lives in the region of La Paz together with her mother-in-law, brother-in-law, and three young children who completely depend on her and go to school. Owing to a lack of employment, Rosa decided to start her business in order to obtain the money necessary to sustain her children. For this reason Rosa owns a tortilla store where she makes tortillas Monday to Sunday until midday, and on Saturday and Sunday nights she makes delicious stuffed tortillas which sell very well now that there is a lot of demand for her products given their delicious flavor.

Due to a strong desire to get ahead and to provide everything necessary to her children, Rosa asks Integral for a loan with which she will be able to buy premium ingredients to make tortillas and stuffed tortillas, materials such as corn, cheese, beans, and others.
