This is the eighth loan Julio has had through MFP, and he knows that the loan funds will help him a lot to develop his work. In his communal bank, he is a happy member who always helps carry out the meetings. With the $725 he has requested, he will purchase fertilizer and insecticides, wanting his fields to be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Jussely tiene 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roger de 27 años y su hija de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de choclos, papas, alverjas, etc, en las chacras que heredó de sus padres. Ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para que al llegar la temporada de cosechar sus productos sean grandes y pueda venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide qué es lo mejor para sus cultivos. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que la mayoría de veces le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. Para más adelante, espera tener un puesto en el mercado, ya que está segura que así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Jussely con MFP y sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y está muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus compañeros. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semilla de alverja, ya que este producto está teniendo bastante demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jussely is 25 years old and a very hard-working young mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband Roger, who is 27, and her daughter, who is 5. They are the motive for all her efforts. The activity she dedicates herself to is cultivation of corn, potatoes, peas, etc., on the farms she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day so that when harvest season comes, her products will be mature and she can sell them in the wholesale market at Tarma. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in carrying out her labor, since she decides what is best for her crops. Jussely has been doing this for 8 years and the task she considers most difficult is transporting her products to market. Most of the time, it is very difficult to find a cart driver that is willing to do it. In the future, she hopes to have a post in the market. She is sure that this will improve her economic income. This is Jussely's 7th loan with MFP and she knows that she has to be punctual in her payments, as she was with her previous loans. In her communal bank she is known for her solidarity and she's very committed to her companions' development. With the 700 New Sols requested she will buy pea seeds, since this product is experiencing plenty of market demand.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Xiomara Mercedes tiene 41 años, ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita financiamientos. La actividad económica de Xiomara es la venta de mercadería en general, hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que su actividad, le ha brindado la experiencia de trabajar y administrar muy bien su dinero para invertir en materia prima. Los propósitos de ella son de seguir adelante con su negocio ya que todo lo que tiene actualmente le ha costado mucho esfuerzo y no lo perdería. Es por eso que solicito ayuda a Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son de establecer una pequeña tienda en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Xiomara Mercedes, 41, has worked with Fundación León 2000 for a long time, and this is not the first time she has requested a loan. Her business is selling general merchandise, which she has been doing more than 11 years, a business that has provided her with the experience of working hard and managing her money so she can buy the raw materials she needs. She plans to continue with her business, since she has invested a lot of hard work and does not want to lose it. This is why she is requesting the help of Fundación León 2000 with the goal of purchasing additional stock for her business. She would like to establish a little shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Marcelina tiene 54 años, es una mujer que a lo largo D. su vida ha trabajado mucho por sobresalir. Actualmente su esposo, Senobio D. 54 años, trabaja en un hotel D. la ciudad D. Lima, pero cada fin D. semana o días libres regresa para estar con su familia. Ellos tienen 3 hijos, quienes son el principal motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos.

Los floridos campos que posee Marcelina son fruto D. su arduo y perseverante trabajo, todas las mañanas, desD. muy temprano, trabaja en el cuidado y riego D. sus flores. Ella cultiva todo tipo D. flores, pero su preferida es el gladiolo, ya que es la que más se venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad Lima, que es donD. lleva a vender sus flores, y muchas veces se encuentra con su esposo y juntos retornan a su pueblo.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es regar sus flores y lo hace con mucho cariño; lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus flores hasta la ciudad D. Lima, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea tener una tienda D. flores en la capital, ya que actualmente sólo venD. al por mayor.

Este es el segundo préstamo D. Marcelina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Por otro lado, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en las reuniones D. su grupo. Los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra D. abono y aserrín para mejorar las tierras D. su chacra.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 54 years old. She is a woman who, throughout her life, has had to work very hard to get ahead. Her husband, 54 year old Senobio, works in a hotel in the city of Lima. Every week end or on his days off he comes back to be with his family. They have three children, and they are the primary motivation for all of their efforts. The flowering fields that Marcelina owns are the fruit of her arduous and perseverant work. She works every morning. She starts very early, and she works taking care of and watering her flowers. She grows all types of flowers, but her favorite is the gladiola because that is what sells the most in the markets in the city of Lima. That is where she takes her flowers to sell. Many times she meets her husband, and they return to their town together. What she likes most about her work is watering her flowers, and she does it with a lot of love. She has been doing this for 20 years. The most difficult part is transporting her flowers to the city of Lima because she has to do that very carefully. In time, she wants to have a flower store in the capital. Currently she only sells wholesale. This is Marcelina’s second loan with MFP. She is prepared to make her payments punctually. In her communal bank she is a very responsible member. She is always up to date on the agreements they come to in the group meetings. She will use the requested 800 PEN to buy fertilizer and sawdust to improve the land on her farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Erica

texts.es:
Erica forma parte del Banco Comunal “JUNTOS A TRABAJAR” de la Asociación Arariwa, es natural de Quillabamba, tiene 30 años y es conviviente. Erica tiene dos hijos y ellos son: Ruth de 7 años y Junior de 4 años. Erica es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y se las ingenio para hacer su propio negocio de venta de verduras. 

Erica nos cuenta que lleva sus verduras de la ciudad del Cusco a otras ciudades como por ejemplo a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, Quillabamba y a la zona minera de Puerto Maldonado. La socia viaja los domingos en las noches al campamento minero de Puerto Maldonado para estar los días lunes, martes y miércoles en la feria del campamento donde ahí vende sus productos y los días jueves lleva sus productos a vender a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado. Erica al regreso a la ciudad del Cusco de Puerto Maldonado no regresa con las manos vacías si no trae consigo productos como pallares, fréjoles, lentejas y soya y los vende en las ciudades del Cusco o Quillabamba.  Su esposo es chofer y maneja su camión donde llevan sus productos como por ejemplo zanahorias, cebollas, papas, etc. Erica requiere el préstamo para comprar menestras como por ejemplo pallares, fréjoles y lentejas. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Erica is part of the Arariwa Association Communal Bank 'Working Together'. She is from Quillabamba, 30 years old, and lives with her partner. Erica has two children: Ruth who is 7 and Junior, 4 years old. Erica is a hard working, enterprising mother who helps her family get ahead, thinking of them as she started her own business selling vegetables. Erica tells us that she takes her vegetables from the city of Cusco to other cities, for example the city of Puerto Maldonado, Quillabamba, and the mining zone of Puerto Maldonado. This community bank member travels on Sunday at night to the mining camp of Puerto Maldonado in order to be there on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, in the market near the camp where she sells her products. On Thursday she takes her produce to sell in the city of Puerto Maldonado. Erica, on returning to the city of Cusco from Puerto Maldonado, does not return with empty hands. She brings products like butter beans, black beans, lentils, and soy beans and sells them in the cities of Cusco and Quillabamba. Her husband is in charge of driving the truck where they carry their products, such as carrots, onions, potatoes, etc. Erica needs a loan to buy more supplies such as butter beans, black beans, and lentils. This member is grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and so has committed to comply with the payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Erica requests the loan to buy supplies such as butter beans, black beans and lentils.

loans.name: Segundo Dolores

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus cinco hijos en el sector Cruce los Becos, una zona rural y agrícola del distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace diez años tiene instalada una pequeña bodega en su vivienda, en ella Segundo ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad. El nos comenta que su negocio nació ante la necesidad de contar con un ingreso adicional que le permitiera sacar adelante a su familia, ya que también se dedica a la agricultura y esta actividad no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

El negocio es de utilidad para los vecinos de la zona, ya que el sector en donde vive queda alejado del pueblo y, aunque hay mobilidad, la economía de los pobladores no les permite hacer viajes todos los dias. Segundo desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar su servicio, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo propuesto.

Segundo es un hombre honorable y muy estimado en la zona donde vive, actualmente tiene el cargo de Teniente Gobernador de la zona, que es una autoridad que representa a sus vecinos ante las autoridades del distrito. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 44-year-old married man who lives with his wife and two of his five children in the Cruce los Becos sector, a rural and agricultural area of the Mórrope district in the province of Lambayeque, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been running a small general store from home for 10 years, selling basic need items. Segundo states that his business was born out of the need to obtain an extra income to help his family get ahead, as he also works in agriculture. However, he does not have a steady income from the latter.

This business is very useful to the people in the area because it is far away from the city, and although there is transportation, the townspeople do not have the means to make trips into the city every single day. Segundo would like to expand his business so that he can improve customer service, which is why he is requesting a 2,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help him reach his goal.

Segundo is a very honorable and esteemed man in the area. He is currently the Lieutenant Governor in the area, which means that he is an official who represents his neighbors before all the authorities in the district. He has previously worked with our institute, and has demonstrated to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic need items to expand business

texts.es:
Justina tiene 54 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobre salir en la vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sotelo D. 55 años y lo que más desean es tener una vejez tranquila.

Su tienda D. abarrotes es una D. las más visitadas en la ciudad D. Tarma, desD. muy temprano por la mañana abre su bodega en espera D. sus clientes. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a todas las personas con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 27 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, hará ampliar su tienda y la llenará D. más mercadería para ofrecer una mejor variedad D. productos.

Este es el primer préstamo D. Justina con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que según manifiesta, la responsabilidad es muy importante para ella. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda D. abarrotes.
texts.en:
Justina is a 54-year-old woman who has always worked very arduously to get ahead in life. She and her husband, Sotelo (age 55), live in their own home, and what they want most is to have a tranquil old age.

Her general store is one of the most frequented in the city of Tarma. She opens her store very early in the morning, eagerly awaiting her customers. She is a very cheerful and attentive seller who always receives everyone with a smile and is willing to help them shop.

What she likes most about her job is being able to converse with her customers. She has been in business for 27 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is having to stay in her store all day long without being able to leave. In the future, she would like to expand her store and fill it with more goods so that she can offer her customers a wider selection of products.

This is Justina's first loan with MFP. However, she is willing to make her payments punctually, stating that responsibility is very important to her. With the 1,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more products so that she can better stock her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Tery's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Tery D. sells personal home products (plastic ware) such as lunch boxes, pails, basins, etc., in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Tery has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Tery joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Tery is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income. Tery is the leader of a two member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Pineapple 1". About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sanka Yuri Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Collpani es un centro que se encuentra en la periferie de la ciudad de El Alto, llegando de esta forma a las personas que más lo necesitan.
Dentro de este centro se encuentra la asociación comunal  Sanka Yuri, compuesta por 14 personas, 13 socias y un socio varón (en la foto falta la señora Lucía G.).
Con respecto a sus negocios está la venta de Jugos, atención de pensión, venta de salchipapas, venta de mantas de vicuña, elaboración de alcancías, artesanía en cuero, venta de libros y plomería.
La presidenta, Alicia H. de 42 años de edad, casada con tres hijos se dedica a la atención de una pensión con el apoyo de su hermana.  Este es su sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, su primer crédito fue de Bs. 1000.- y lo destinó a la compra de ollas, platos, cocina.   En esta oportunidad su solicitud es por Bs. 1500.- para la compra de un Televisor y Videos para vender, de esa forma aprovechar el espacio de la pensión y la presencia de los clientes.
Cuando se le consulta sobre lo que le gusta más de Pro Mujer, ella responde “la amistad con las compañeras
texts.en:
The Collpani Regional Headquarters is located on the outskirts of the city of El Alto, making it much easier to reach for the people who need its services the most.

Within this center is the Sanka Yuri Communal Bank, which is comprised of 14 people--13 of whom are women, and 1 of whom is a man (Ms. Lucia G. is not pictured here). Regarding their types of businesses, the members sell juices, run a small restaurant, sell salchipapas (South American street food made with pan-fried sausages and fries), sell vicuña fiber blankets, make piggy banks, sell books, make leather handicrafts, or provide plumbing services.

The group president, Alicia H., is a 42-year-old married mother with 3 children who runs a small restaurant with the help of her sister. This is her sixth loan cycle in Pro Mujer. She used her first loan in the amount of 1,000.00 BOB to purchase pots, plates, and a stove. This time, she is requesting a 1,500.00 BOB loan to purchase a television set and DVD's to sell, thus making the most of her business space and her patrons.

When asked what she likes the most about Pro Mujer, she replied, "My friendship with my group members."

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a T.V. set and DVD´s

texts.es:
Mari tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre; vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jeremías de 24 años, quien trabaja como obrero en una mina de la zona, y con sus dos menores hijos, a los cuales desea dar una buena educación.

La siembra de papa, choclo y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica. Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para hacerlas más fértiles y que así sus cultivos sean más abundantes y tenga más productos para llevar a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden malograr sus sembríos. Lleva 18 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que tiene que llevarlos con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea tener un puesto de ventas fijo.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Mari con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo su grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, también abono e insecticidas para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Mari is a 33-year-old woman who is very unassuming and cheerful. She lives in her own house with her husband, Jeremías (age 24), who works as a miner in the area, and their 2 under age children, to whom she wishes to give a good education.

She grows potatoes, corn and peas for a living. Every day, she wakes up very early in the morning to make her crop fields more fertile so that they can be more abundant and she can have more produce to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma.

What she likes most about her job is protecting her fields from any pests that can spoil the crops. She has been in business for 18 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is transporting her produce to the market because she has to do so with much care. In the future, she would like to have her own permanent produce stand.

This is Mari's sixth loan from MFP, and she is ready and willing to repay her loan punctually. She is very committed to the development of her group at her communal bank. With the 3,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed, fertilizer, and insecticide for her crop fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Marlene tiene 37 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora. Por el momento, vive independientemente en la casa de su madre, junto a su esposo Andrés de 40 años, quien trabaja como obrero en una mina, y con sus 2 hijos, a quienes desea dar una buena educación.

El arduo trabajo que realiza en sus chacras ha logrado que sus cultivos sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos; lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, puesto que el transporte es muy escaso. Para más adelante, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista, donde pueda vender ella misma sus cultivos.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Marlene con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de gladiolos (flores) y de alverja, también abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Marlene is a 37-year-old hardworking and loving mother. At the moment, she is living in her mother's home with her husband, Andrés (age 40), who works as a miner, and their 2 children, to whom she wishes to provide a good education.

The arduous work she does on her farms have helped her fields to be very abundant and productive. She sells her produce at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she gets good profits from her faithful customers.

What she likes most about her job is having to protect her crops from any invading pests. She has been in business for 25 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is having to transport her produce to the market since she transportation is so scarce. In the future, she would like to have her own produce stand at the wholesale market, where she can sell her produce herself.

This is Marlene's third loan with MFP. She is ready and willing to make her payments punctually. She is a very joyful and supportive member of her communal bank. With the 1,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase gladiola seeds, pea seed, and fertilizer for her crop fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Paula tiene 61 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de costura. Este no es el primer financiamiento que ella ha realizado con Fundación León 2000, pues estos han sido de gran apoyo. Pues ella es una persona muy ejemplar que disfruta su negocio y además que siempre ha trabajado, ella tiene muchos clientes por lo que tiene una diversidad de encargos, por lo que está muy acostumbrada a realizar este tipo de trabajos. Es por este motivo que ella solicita este financiamiento que es destinado para capital de trabajo como agujas, tijeras, hilos, tela, zipper y botones. Su deseo es mantener activo su negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Paula is a 61-year-old woman who provides sewing services for a living. This is not her first loan from Fundación León 2000 as it has greatly supported her. She is an exemplary woman who loves her business. Furthermore, she has always worked. She has many customers who put in a variety of orders, so she is accustomed to all types of sewing jobs. She is requesting this loan as working capital in order to purchase needles, scissors, thread, fabric, zippers and buttons. Her wish is to be able to keep her business afloat as it is her sole means of earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 33 años y su pequeña hija Rosali, con quien posa alegremente en la foto.

Desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es una labor que ha estado en su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella aprendió esta actividad de sus padres y ahora tiene sus propios sembríos, en los cuales tiene papa, choclos y alverjas, los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus campos, ya que así tendrá productos para vender dentro de 6 meses. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos. 
Con el tiempo, desea tener un puesto de ventas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, con el cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. 

Este es el sexto préstamo de Mercedes con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso y poco a poco podrá mejorar su calidad de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable y siempre está pendiente de sus pagos. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que este producto tiene gran demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 33-year-old unassuming and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Hector (age 33), and their young daughter Rosali, with whom she is so cheerfully posing in this photo.

At a very young age, she learned how to cultivate the land because her family has been in agriculture for many generations. She learned this skill from her parents, and now she has her own crop fields where she grows potatoes, corn, and peas. She sells her produce at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she likes most about her job is planting the seeds because she knows that she will have produce within 6 months. She has been in business for 10 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is having to protect her crops from any invading pests. In the future, she would like to have her own produce stand at the city's wholesale market, so that she can increase her income.

This is Mercedes' sixth loan with MFP. She feels that the loan money will be of great benefit to her because little by little, it will help her improve her quality of life. She is a very responsible client who is always current with her payments at the communal bank. With the 1,500.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed because peas are in high demand at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Evangeline's Group

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the town of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga in the Misamis Occidental province. She is 49 years old. Evangeline is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of the fellow group member if the other is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pineapple 1.

Evangeline is married and has three school-aged children. To earn a living, Evangeline owns and operates a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling clothes and slippers to local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Evangeline from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing products to sell.

texts.es:
Nilda tiene 35 años, es una madre familia muy sencilla y amorosa. Hace 11 años que vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Martín de 37 y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea dar una mejor calidad de vida.

En el poblado de “Patay” se encuentran los cultivos de Nilda, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que sus papas, choclos, zanahorias y alverjas,son muy bien cotizados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha en forma ambulante.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, ya que siente que los meses invertidos en le cuidados de sus cultivos dan los frutos esperados. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar sus tierras e incrementar su producción.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Nilda con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y está dispuesta a serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está bromeando con sus compañeras de grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas para mejorar productividad de su chacra.
texts.en:
Nilda is a 35-year-old humble and loving mother. She has been living with her husband Martin (age 37) and their two beloved children--to whom she wishes to give a better quality of life--in a rented home for 11 years.

Nilda's crop fields are located in the Patay settlement. Her produce is very good, which is why her potatoes, corn, carrots, and peas are very sought-after at the city's wholesale market, where she sells her crops as a street vendor.

What she likes most about her job is harvesting because she feels as if the months that she invested in caring for her crops give the eagerly awaited fruits of her labor. She has been in agriculture for 20 years, and she thinks that the most difficult thing for her is protecting her crops from any invading pests. In the future, she hopes to expand her fields and increase production.

This is Nilda's eighth loan with MFP. She has always been very punctual in making her repayments and is willing to continue with this behavior. She is a very joyful communal bank member who is always joking around with her fellow group members. With the 2,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase pea seed, fertilizer and insecticide to improve her small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: La señora Rosa Francisca posee un negocio que es una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, realiza sus compras de contado y sus ventas son al crédito y de contado. Las compras las efectúa en el mercado oriental y a camiones repartidores. Ella inicio de una manera muy sencilla pues tenía muy capital lo que le impedía comprar  una amplia variedad de productos. Es por este motivo  la señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio  ya que se aproxima la temporada en donde vende más. Ella sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa Francisca runs her own in-home general store. She accepts both cash and credit. She obtains her goods from the oriental market and from supply trucks. She started out with a simple business because she did not have that much capital, which impeded her from offering a wide selection of products. For this reason, she is now requesting a new loan, which will be invested in her business because her busy season is approaching. She dreams of improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

Teofila P., from the town of Poblaciion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, is the 45-year-old leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, each is responsible for paying back the loan of the other if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Pineapple 1.

Teofila, who is married and has one grown child, owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income comes primarily from selling soft drinks to the local community members. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teofila is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Fanny Virginia

texts.es:
Fanny C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive a unos 10 minutos a las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia  Baños en la comunidad de Huizhill, se caracteriza por la belleza de sus parajes naturales andinos,  sus bosques y su cercanía al centro turístico  Baños le han ubicado como una de las localidades mas visitadas principalmente por turistas extranjeros.

Fanny tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera vive en casa de sus padres donde ayuda a su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar, estudia derecho en la Universidad Estatal de Cuenca y hace seis meses en sus ratos libres trabaja  como consultora de belleza de la linea de productos de belleza Yanbal, su papá es  sastre de profesión.

  Ella es una de las socias mas jóvenes de éste banco y éste es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y espera incrementar su negocio, con el dinero que recibirá va adquirir perfumes, cremas, tratamietnos, y cosmeticos en general para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su meta es incrementar cada dia mas su negocio y surtirlo con varios productos para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Fanny C. is a member of the Mujeres de Combate Microfinance Institute. She lives some 10 minutes away from the city of Cuenca, in the Baños parish of the Huizhill community, which is renowned for its beauteous Andean landscapes, its forests, and its proximity to the Baños tourist spot. It is one of the most visited places in the country, mainly by foreigners.

Fanny is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents, helping her mother with the household chores. She is studying law at the Universidad Estatal de Cuenca. Six months ago, she started working as a Yanbal beauty consultant during her spare time. Her father is a tailor.

She is one of the youngest group members in this bank, and she is requesting her first loan with the hopes of expanding her business. With the loan money, she will obtain fragrances, lotions, facial treatments, and several other cosmetics in order to fill her customers' orders.

Her goal is to increase business every day and stock up on various products for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal fragrances, facial treatments, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa Nila

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive junto a ellos en el distrito de La Victoria, uno de los distritos más poblados de la región, ubicado a cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rosa es profesora de profesión y desde muy joven se sintió comprometida con la educación de los niños, fue asi que aprovechó una iniciativa del gobierno a nivel nacional e instaló en su vivienda un centro especializado en educación de niños de dos a cinco años de edad llamado PRONOEI. 

Los PRONOEI son entidades educativas que actúan financiadas por las municipalidades y los padres de familia, su publico objetivo son los niños que provienen de familias de escasos recursos y en ellos se brinda los conocimientos y herramientas necesarios para desarrollar en los niños su capacidad de aprendizaje.

El PRONOEI de Rosa no sólo les brinda conocimientos académicos, sino que también tiene contratados a dos profesores, uno de música y uno de danza. Ella desea mejorar la cobertura de atención de sus niños ampliando el aula que tiene y además desea mejorar los baños, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer responsable y muy estimada por los padres que dia a dia le confian el cuidado de sus menores hijos, ella es muy feliz haciendo lo que hace y ama a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 45 years old, separated, and has two dependent children. They live in the District of La Victoria, which is one of the most populated districts in the region and located five minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosa is a teacher by profession. Since she was a young woman, she felt committed to educating children. Five years ago, she took advantage of a national government initiative and opened a center in her home specializing in the education of children between the ages of 2-5 called PRONOEI.

“PRONOEI” are educational facilities that are financed by the municipalities and the parents. They target children who come from families with limited resources and provide the knowledge and necessary tools to help them in their capacity to learn. Not only does Rosa’s school teach academic skills, but she also has on staff a music teacher and a dance teacher. She wants to improve the attention she provides to the children by expanding her classroom. Rosa also wants to repair the bathrooms. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN.

Rosa is a responsible woman who is well-respected by the parents who trust her day after day to look after their children. She is very happy with what she has accomplished and loves her job.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand a classroom & repair the bathrooms

loans.name: Fanny Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Fanny Meja vive en la comunidad de Huizhill en la parroquia  Baños a las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca, esta parroquia se caracterizada por su gastronomía típica que es sancocho, papas con cuy,  sus aguas termales y sus bosques que se han convertido en el principal atractivo turistico. 

Doña Fanny es sastre y lleva 35 años trabajando en esta profesión aprendió en un curso de corte y confección y ahora realiza unos finos ternos, trabaja sin tener un horario fijo y más cuando tiene obras que entregar, laborando todos los días.

Este es su segundo ciclo en la fundación, nos comenta que los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en su negocio para la confección de sus prendas de vestir, en su vida personal se encuentra casada y tiene 53 años de edad, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos su primer hijo de 30  y el segundo hijo de 26 años de edad son casados y viven independientemente con sus familias, su última hija que se encuentra de  18 años de edad estudia en la universidad de Cuenca, su esposo es sastre también de profesión, gracias a su trabajo como pareja han logrado construir su vivienda propia.

Con su nuevo crédito solicotado va a comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones, encajes y otras materias primas para sus confecciones y seguir trabajando en su pequeño taller. Su meta es  acabar su casa  que aún le falta algunos acabados internos.
texts.en:
Sra. Fanny M. lives in the community of Huizhill in Baños Parish, which is outside of the city of Cuenca. This parish is known for its traditional cuisine, such as “sancocho” (a popular soup in Latin America) and potatoes with guinea pig. Its thermal springs and forests have turned this place into one of the main tourist attractions.

Doña Fanny is a tailor and has been working in this profession for 35 years. She learned through a sewing course and now turns out some of the finest suits. Fanny does not work on a set schedule. Whenever there are more orders that have to be delivered, she works every day.

This is her second loan with the Foundation. She says that her clothing manufacturing business has greatly benefited from these loans. Regarding her personal life, she 53 years old and married. Her relationship has resulted in three children. The first two children are ages 30 and 26, and are married and live independently with their families. Their youngest daughter is 18 years old and is studying at the University of Cuenca. Fanny’s husband is also a tailor by profession. As a result of working together, they have been able to build their own home.

With this new loan she has requested, Fanny will buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, lace, and other materials needed to make garments and keep her working in her small workshop. Her goal is to complete her house because the only things lacking are some of the internal finishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, lace, and other materials

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora  María G. vive en a unos 10 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, en la comunidad de Huizhill en la parroquia  Baños, localidad muy reconocida por sus aguas termales curativas que son aprovechadas en  las piscinas y baños termales que se realizan los visitantes de éste hermoso lugar del Ecuador.

Nuestra socia se encuentra de 55 años de edad de estado civil casada, fruto de esta unión  ha procreado 5 hijos que no recuerda las edades de cada uno de ellos pero nos comenta que ya todos son casados y viven de manera independiente, su esposo no trabaja por lo que le ayuda en su negocio.

María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, tiene un local de venta de todo tipo de ropa en la Feria Libre lleva  20 años con este negocio y le va bien,  su horario de trabajo  es de 8 a.m. a 6 p.m. de lunes a sábados y el domingo labora el medio día. 

Nos comenta que este es su segundo ciclo en la fundación anteriormente ya formó parte del banco pero se retiro por motivos personales y ahora esta integrando nuevamente este gran grupo de mujeres emprendedoras, con el nuevo crédito solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR comprará  casacas, camisas, blusas, pantalones etc. para abastecer su local con mercaderia para toda la familia.

Su sueño es dejar de trabajar ya que siente el peso de sus años  le gustaría descansar y disfrutar un poco mas de lo que le reste de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. María G. lives approximately ten minutes outside of the city of Cuenca, in the community of Huizhill in Baños Parish. The area is known for its healing warm waters that fill the swimming pools and thermal springs. This has attracted visitors to this beautiful place in Ecuador.

María is 55 years old and married. Her relationship has resulted in five children, but she no longer remembers the ages of each one. She says all of them are married and live independently. Her husband does not work, so he helps with her business.

María is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres de Combate” (Women in Combat). She has a vending location at the Open Fair where she sells all types of clothing. María has been in this business for 20 years and has done well. Her work schedule is from 8am to 6pm, Monday through Saturday. On Sundays, she works half a day.

María says that in her second loan cycle with the Foundation, she was part of the Communal Bank but had to withdraw because of personal reasons. Now she is reintegrating with ths great group of women entrepreneurs. With the new loan she is requesting from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy jackets, shirts, blouses, pants, and other items to restock her location with merchandise for the entire family. Her dream is to stop working because she already feels the weight of her years, so she would like to relax and enjoy what little remains of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jackets, shirts, blouses, pants, and other items

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in the Siem Reap province in Cambodia. Mrs. L. is a modest villager who earns her daily income by working as an internal staff member for a pure-water company. She is married and has three children who attend the local school. Her husband is a military policeman in the village. The family lives in a house that frequently cracks during heavy rains. Mrs. L. has tried to repair her old house, but the repairs are never completed and her house continues to crack. Therefore, Mrs. L. has requested a loan to allow her to continue mending her old house.

There are three other borrowers in her loan group. Kon S. will also use her loan to pay for house repairs. Toeuy B. sells porridge in the village, and she has requested the loan to help her improve her porridge trade. Kroch Y. is a merchant who would like the loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To continue mending her old house.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Mr. Sophat H. has been a wooden house builder for almost three years. He operates the business in other provinces far away from his house. Sophat is requesting his first loan of $600 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting. 

Sophat, age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Savun Yeun, 38, have been married since 1995 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of the children is in high school, two others are in primary school and another one stays at home. Mrs. Savun Yeun has been selling groceries for almost ten years. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Sophat is not in the photo; his wife was available instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Sichhoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sichhoeun K. (in the picture), 31, and her husband, Mr. Chin Chen, 42, live along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They just have a young son. The family has two lines of business: (1) is raising pigs, and (2) is producing rice wine. Sichhoeun hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of US $300 to purchase additional piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em P. is a 50-year-old married woman and mother. (She is not shown in the picture; her husband is shown instead.) Em P. has been earning a profit daily by selling a variety of vegetables in the market for years. By doing this, she has been able to help with the responsibilities for her family. Em P. has given birth to six children: four are married and live away and the other two are teenagers. Both of them are employed: her daughter is a clothes seller and her son works in construction. Her husband is a local farmer in the village. 

Recently her daughter has sold near all her clothes and she wants to acquire more inventory but she doesn’t have enough cash to resupply. Thus, Em P. is requesting a loan for her daughter to buy more clothes for her store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for a daughter's store

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mr. Phea P., aged 29 and his wife, Mrs. Sokhem Leab, also 29, live in a small village along National Road Number three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2002 and have three children — one son and two daughters. 
 
Phea has been a construction worker in his village for eight years. In addition, Phea hopes to supplement his income by adding a new trailer to attach to his motorcycle remoque taxi. Phea is asking for his first loan of $400 to purchase a trailer.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for his motorcycle remoque taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a bicycle for the children to get to school

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha T., 44, and her husband, Mr. Phally Pheng, 45, have been married since 1986 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home, one works in garment factory, and the others attend school. The family lives along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Chantha has been a rice farmer for 30 years, and her husband has been an ice-cream seller for seven years. Chantha doesn’t have the capital to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticide to maintain her rice farm so she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $300 to buy them.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

loans.name: Juliena

texts.en: Juliena C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 32 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Juliena owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Juliena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Juliena is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase some piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice for her husband to mill for re-selling

texts.en:
Mr. Savat K. is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Keang Chhorn (they are pictured together), is 42 years old. They have been married since 1981 and have eight children: 3 sons and 5 daughters. Three of their children are married and live in separate homes, one is a garment factory worker and the other four attend school. The family lives along National Road Number One, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Savat has been growing mushrooms for two months while his wife has been producing rice wine for ten years. Savat hopes to expand his mushroom farm so he is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to use for this purpose.

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mrs. Tit D. owns and operates a small store to sell café to her neighbors who live in the village. She is age 51, a married woman, and the good mother of six children. Tit D. was married many years ago to Sokha, age 50, who is a motorcycle taxi driver. Two of her children are married and have already started new homes, and the remaining four are single. To help with the responsibilities of the family, two daughters work sewing clothes in a garment factory. She is a low-income citizen living in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Tit D.'s café shop is too small and limits her clients. She would like to seek a loan on Kiva through HKL’s project. She will be using her loan to help upgrade to a larger shop. The rest of the loan will be used to buy accessories for her café enterprise.

loans.use: To upgrade to a larger size shop and buy accessories

loans.name: Anacita

texts.en:
Anacita O. is from the village of  Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 52 and married with three adult children. Anacita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling food and other products. Anacita has had her business for over three years and makes approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Anacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Anacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Anacita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Anacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. 
Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong D. is 36. He owns a motorbike that he uses to provide a taxi service which earns approximately $5 per day to meet his family’s daily living expenses. In addition, he owns a pond where he breeds fish to sell. He also provides fish to his wife to sell in the market. The couple has two school-aged children. Kong D. will use the Kiva loan to build a hedge around his fish pond.

loans.use: To build a hedge around his fish-breeding pond

loans.name: Mr. Srey Nuon Village Bank Group

texts.en: This loan group consists of 20 people. Mrs. Srey N. is the group leader in this village, Srae Boeng in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Her husband, Mr. Bunthoeun Chhoeng, is a soldier who does not earn enough to support the family that consists of two children, one a student in the local school, and the other a five-year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed for growing crops

loans.name: Uok

texts.en: Mrs. Uok M. is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in Ta Preah village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is asking for a loan from AMK to buy two oxen to plow her farm. Her husband is a laborer who can only make a small contribution to his family's support. They have two children, both students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy two oxen to plow her field

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old. Marites is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business making & selling specialty food products like tocino, longganiza and more in the local community. Marites has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marites joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marites from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tempek Tengah Melaya 1 Group

texts.en: Gusti Ayu P. M. (0) is a 42-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Jembrana, Bali. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tempek Tengah Melaya 1 (MUK-0010). Gusti Ayu is married and has one school-aged child. She owns and operates a general store, selling food products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities. In 2010, Gusti Ayu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her first from MUK. Gusti Ayu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her child’s tuition fees. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here. ***************************************************** GUSTI AYU P. MERTA (0) merupakan 42 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA-JEMBRANA-BALI. GUSTI AYU adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 4 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah TEMPEK TENGAH MELAYA 1 (MUK-0010). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan di tengah masyarakat setempat. GUSTI AYU sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, GUSTI AYU menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, GUSTI AYU bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. GUSTI AYU meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari. Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir. Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Aeth

texts.en: Mrs. Aeth U. is 48 years old and a villager who lives in Trapeang Snao village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a one-hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living for her family. Her husband, Mr. Koa Kem, is a construction worker who can make a small salary to support his family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to improve their family's living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Aeth U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to breed. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's living conditions.  Mrs. Aeth U. is a mother of three children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Choy

texts.en: Mr. Choy S. is 59 years old and a villager who lives in Ta Preah village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living for his family. His wife, Ms. Pharn Horm, is a fruit seller who can earn a small income to support her family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses, they still don't earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mr. Choy S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. He will use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and pig food for pig breeding. With this loan, he hopes to increase his income to improve his family's living conditions. This family has four children. One of the children is a farmer, two are seamstresses, and the last one is a student in the local school who also helps the parent's business. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow and piglets for breeding

texts.en:
This is a small group loan, which is jointly requested by four low-profit people who live in a commune in the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. S. has been promoted to be a group leader by the members. S. and her husband help each other in order to feed four children who are attending school. There is one more who is married and working. They both pursue their daily revenue by working as porters in the busy local market and they are always hired by people to carry their fish. This couple has been engaged in this job for nine years, typically earning $5 per day. The family’s house is too old and breaking down, and their living condition has been affected. Because of this, S. decided to borrow a loan of $150 to allow her to mend her old house. The other three borrowers are:
Mrs. S., who requests a loan to buy more grocery items to continue to sell;
Mrs. T., who is taking out her money to help her to increase the financial capital of her fish paste trade; and 
Mrs. C., who is looking for a loan to mend her old house.

loans.name: Panca Kerti 1 Group

texts.en:
Ni Putu W. (0) is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Sombang, Jembrana, Bali. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Panca Kerti 1 (MUK-0008).

Ni Putu is widowed and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a new loan of 2,250,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 1st from MUK.

Ni Putu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


Note to Kiva Lenders:  
This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender.

This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.
 
To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Panca Kerti 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan W. is a 55 year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Jembrana, Bali. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Panca Kerti 2 (MUK-0009).

Ni Wayan is married and has three adult children. She owns and operates a business selling religious items, primarily selling flowers and other votive offerings to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Wayan joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials. The loan will be her 1st from MUK.

Ni Wayan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


Note to Kiva Lenders:  
This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender.

This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.
 
To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here.

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir.

Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make prayer/worship materials

loans.name: Rammyuel

texts.en:
Rammyuel O. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. He is 29 years old. Rammyuel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rammyuel owns & operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Rammyuel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rammyuel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rammyuel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rammyuel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rolene

texts.en:
Rolene C. is a business-minded woman who hopes and dreams that someday her business will not only be selling fish but through the loan she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI that she will be able to purchase her own motor boat for a fishing business. Her husband will be the one to manage the business and for him to have his own business to manage too. Proceeds from their business will help Rolene achieve her aspiration of graduating her two children (4 and 14 years old) from college. 

Despite the many trials in life that Rolene had been through, even in her membership in ASHI and the relationship of her group members, she remains strong, active and determined to reach her dreams.

For a microfinance that uses Grameen methodology, ASHI being the first practitioner in the field saw how these poor women mothers work hard to earn money for the cash flow of her family and to provide her children a better life. Because micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly in their villages and in the doorstep of their house, together with the loan handed over to them is giving them hope that someday they will “rise above poverty” (direct translation of Ahon Sa Hirap, in English).

loans.use: To purchase a motorboat for fishing.

texts.en:
Hussein R., age 31, is married. He sells video cassettes, which  business  he started three years ago. He opens his shop from 7 am to 9pm daily and he is able to make monthly profits of about $110.

This will be Hussein’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to build a small house and increase his video cassette stock. He has paid back the loan successfully. He hopes for a new loan to increase his stock.

Hussein will share this loan with his subgroup, Gongolamboto One Group, which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture Hussein is
in a blue shirt behind a man in white.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn O. is a 53-year-old businesswoman who has been a member of ASHI since 2004. She enjoys playing various roles being a woman. But apart from being a child who supports her parents, a supportive housewife and a loving mother to her 16-year-old child and grandmother to her six-year-old grandchild, what challenges her most is her role being a poor woman wanting to rise from poverty. Her membership in ASHI and the opportunity of getting a loan from that institution makes her feel hopeful that someday her dreams will come true.

Despite her busy schedule in managing and growing her small canteen, which was put up through the loans she received from ASHI, Merlyn makes sure that she can always attend ASHI’s weekly center meeting where she pays her weekly amortization, meeting her group members as well as the rest of the members of ASHI in their center. This is because Merlyn treasures the opportunity she has able to obtain because of ASHI. Now that ASHI has partnered with Kiva, Merlyn’s hope of expanding her business is strengthened. She is requesting a much larger loan to grow her canteen. Through the profits of her business, she wishes to support the education of her child and grandchild who live with her, until they graduate from college.  

For a microfinance that uses Grameen methodology, ASHI being the first practitioner in the field saw how these poor women mothers work hard to earn money for the cash flow of her family and to provide her children a better life. Because micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly in their villages and in the doorstep of their house, together with the loan handed over to them is giving them hope that someday they will “rise above poverty” (direct translation of Ahon Sa Hirap, in English).

loans.use: To purchase ingredients, utensils, and inventory for her canteen.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is one of the very good members of ASHI in San Jose, a province of Antique. She was able to purchase a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for her husband to manage and earn his daily income. The vehicle is for hire and is one of the common means of transporting people around the town and around the province. Just like with other unemployed men in town, this has become the main business of Gloria’s husband. It is the main source of income for Gloria’s family to support their needs, especially the education of her only 14-year-old child who is presently in high school. 

Because the motorcycle needs to be maintained (the strength of its engine is already depreciating after it was bought several years ago), Gloria is requesting a loan from Kiva through ASHI to be spent for reconditioning the motorcycle as well as its sidecar to be able to attract more passengers. This means that some spare parts have to be changed and the engine has to be cleaned.

loans.use: To recondition their motorcycle and sidecar

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom M. is 28 years-old and a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Cham Sin, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Mom M. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox for plowing. Aside from farming, Mr. Cham Sin collects palm juice and earns a small income to support the household. Mrs. Mom M. is a mother of two children, one of who is seamstress in the garment factory, while the other one is attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox for plowing.

texts.en: Mr. Chea T. is 58 years-old and a villager who lives in Tonle village in Takeo province. He and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. At present, they own only one ox to support their farming, therefore Mr. Chea T. would like to purchase another ox for plowing his rice field.
