In addition to farming, he collects palm juice which makes a small income to support his family. This couple has three children who are all seamstresses in the garment factory. His wife is on the right in the picture.

Rania is a 36-year-old divorced woman. After she divorced, she moved back to her parents' house and started working as a beautician from her home. She works as a hairdresser and also does manicures, pedicures and other beauty services. Her business allows her to help with the household expenses. 

Today, Rania is requesting to borrow $1,000 to expand her home business by adding new services and purchasing more equipment. She wishes to increase her business productivity and income as a result of this loan and to attract new clients.

loans.name: Temepek Tengah Melaya 2 Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut W. (0) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Jembrana, Bali. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Temepek Tengah Melaya 2 (MUK-0011). Ni Ketut is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 150,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Ni Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her first from MUK. Ni Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here. ***************************************************** NI KETUT WIDIASTUTI (0) merupakan 53 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA-JEMBRANA-BALI. NI KETUT adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 4 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah TEMPEK TENGAH MELAYA 2 (MUK-0011). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. NI KETUT sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI KETUT menghasilkan sekitar 150,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, NI KETUT bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. NI KETUT meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari. Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir. Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

texts.en:
Ghorra is a 39-year-old married woman and mother of two young children. In 2005, she opened a small clothing and accessories shop based in her home and began buying women's clothing.  She has become well known with a large number of clients. She also began, as with most home-based businesses, to help her husband with the family income. 

Today, Ghorra is requesting to borrow $ 1,000 to purchase more merchandise for her business and specifically to add to her selection of women’s clothes to help her increase her business productivity and income.

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Sim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. M. S. is the village bank president for a group loan offered by Kiva partner AMK located in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province and consisting of 17 people. With the loans, the members plan to purchase equipment, supplies and other items to support a variety of purposes.

Mrs. M. S. is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Vuthy Chhorn, is a construction worker and receives a small salary to support his family. 
Mrs. M. S. is requesting a loan of 800,000 Riels frO. AMK to buy fruit (mangos, tangerines, etc.) for resale. With her new business, she hopes to increase her income and improve the family lifestyle.  Mrs. M. S. is 38 years-old and a mother of four children who are all students in the local school.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthoeun Om Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthoeun O. is 42 years-old and the village bank president for a group loan which includes nine people in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province. The members of the group loan plan to buy supplies, equipment and other items for various purposes.
 
Mrs. Chanthoeun O. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to grow crops. Her husband, Mr. Sor Phorn  Nhim, is a laborer who earns a small income to support the famiL. living. In order to increase their income and improve the famiL. lifestyle, Mrs. Chanthoeun O. is asking for a loan to buy a furnace for cremation. This couple has a child who is attending in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a furnace for cremation.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: Mr. Chat T. is a Cambodian fisherman on the local river in the province of Siem Reap for more than four years. His wife helps him support their family by selling the fish in the market. This couple assists each other in order to ensure their two kids complete high school. Recently some fishing accessories were broken and therefore the fishing process is frequently interrupted.  This affects the income. Chat T. hopes to either buy new tools or repair the broken tools though a Kiva loan. (Chat T. was busy fishing when the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.name: Mrs. Theavy Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Theavy H. is a 35 year-old married woman who lives in Boeng Leach village in Takeo province. She is a village bank president for a group loan which consists of 14 people and is offered by Kiva partner AMK. The members of the loan will use it to support a variety of purposes. 

Mrs. Theavy H. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. C. Sopheap Phin, is a laborer who earns a small salary to support the family. Although they try to work hard with their different businesses they still earn insufficient income to improve their lifestyle. Therefore, Mrs. Theavy H. is asking for a loan to purchase chickens and ducks for breeding. This couple has two children who are both attending the local school.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a 50 year-old woman who dreams of having four out of her five children graduate from college. Through the profits from her peanut and cashew selling business she was able to support the education of her 20 year-old eldest child until college.  However she got married and was unable to finish the course she had chosen. Presently two of her children are going to college, one is still in high school and the youngest in elementary school. Therefore, Estelita wants her business to grow to be able to increase her profits and support her children’s education. She also wishes to build her own house someday and to have a better life. 

In order for her dreams to become a reality, she is requesting from Kiva through ASHI a larger loan which will be used to increase the volume of her sales. Cashew nuts and peanuts she sells are displayed in the municipal market where a lot of people can see and buy.

Ahon sa Hirap Inc., or ASHI, has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen methodology to credit delivery to the bottom poor in the Philippines.  ASHI, as the first practitioner in the field, saw how these poor women and mothers work hard to earn money for the income of their family and to provide their children a better life. Since the micro-credit ASHI is extending to these women is delivered directly in their villages and on the doorsteps of their houses, together with the loans they are also given the hope that someday they will “rise above poverty” (translation of Ahon Sa Hirap, in English.)

loans.use: To purcahse large volumes of peanuts and cashews.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn to make gruel

texts.en: Mrs. Leng H. is a 56-year-old fisher. She has been fishing with her husband along the Tunle Sap River for years. By doing this, the couple earns profit of at least $6 per day which they use to support their family. Leng H. is a good mother who takes care of three children and another is already married and is living independently. In the past, Leng H. has always hired a villager’s boat in order to fish. Right now she wants to reduce the hiring fees by taking out a loan to buy her own boat and other necessary equipment for her fishing operation.

Rasha is a 30-year-old married woman who has one young child. She has been working in a mini-market for the past ten years and in February 2009, she decided to open a small mini-market as her own business. She sells all type of food products, detergents, dairy products, drinks, etc.

Today, Rasha is requesting $1,000 to purchase additional merchandise to improve her business operation because she intends to grow her business in the coming months.

Laurence is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been working as a baker for the past ten years. After this long experience, she decided to open a small snack and bakery in her town to earn additional money for her family. She became well-known for the delicious food products she offers to her clients, especially her Lebanese bread.

Today, Laurence is requesting $1,000 to buy additional merchandise like flour, oil, dairy products, etc., to increase her sales and so her income, and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna M. was born in 1957 and lives with her family in Bargushat village, Kapan area. She has six children: four daughters and two sons; five of them are already married and live separately from their parents.

Ruzanna works in her village as a club manager and at the same time she, her husband and her elder son, who lives with them, engage in farming. They are mainly busy in dairy produce and meat production.

Ruzanna asks for a 700,000 AMD loan to buy some sheep for her farm, which will help her to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy some sheep for her farm

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 56-year-old married man with two children. He has owned a café since 1998 in his town. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs till they grew up. On their free time, they help their father in the cafe. He offers all kind of coffee in his shop.

Today, Mohamad is requesting $1,000 to purchase a new coffee machine. This will enable him to satisfy the heavy demand of the market and be able to increase his business productivity and therefore his family income.

loans.use: To purchase a new coffee machine

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 33 years old and is married with three children. She is into the sewing of clothes and sales of tailoring materials. She makes different styles for her costumers. With the profit from the business, she assists her husband in taking good care of her family.

Lucy hopes to expand her business by buying more tailoring materials to sell. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela K. is a widow and she lives in Sevan with her daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Her son lives and works in Russia.

For about eight years Anzhela worked as a brigade-leader, then as a shop assistant, after which she was engaged in cloth trading. Now she is renting a small shop, where she sells food.

Anzhela has been a client of “Nor Horizon” for many years, but this loan is the first to support her new business. With the profits from her business, she provides her family needs. She requests a 1,100,000 AMD loan to increase the confectionery assortment of her shop.

loans.use: To increase the confectionery assortment of her shop

loans.name: Nadira

texts.en:
Nadira is a widow, 53 years old, who is living with her three children. She runs a tailoring business from her home and works hard to be able to raise her children. Her oldest daughter helps her with the family income.

Today, Nadira is requesting $1,000 to expand her business by purchasing a new sewing machine. She says that she will be able to increase her productivity and income as a result of the loan. She specifically notes that she has been able to deliver her services faster and make more products because of the new machine.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

texts.fr: Monsieur Gadio K. marié âgé de 54 ans est le premier membre d’U-IMCEC Bambey, la nouvelle caisse d’IMCEC mise en place en 2009. Il est commerçant et vend des cordes et accessoires de charrettes et bâches. C’est une activité qu’il fait depuis 10 ans  pour s’activer pendant la saison sèche.  Selon lui, l’activité marche bien car elle est très liée à la zone avec  les troupeaux charrettes. Il sollicite, cependant, un crédit de 100 000 FCFA pour acheter des cordes afin de développer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mr. Gadio K. is 54 years old and married. He is the first member of the Bambey branch of U-IMCEC, which opened in 2009. He is a merchant who sells ropes and accessories for carts and tarpaulins. He began this business ten years ago to develop an activity during the dry season. According to him, the business is doing well because it is located in an area with large numbers of herds and carts. He is requesting however a loan for 100,000 FCFA to buy ropes so that he can further develop his business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

texts.ru:
Айткурбанова Райхан проживает в селе Араван. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. В данное время она живет только со своим мужем, так как, дочери замужем и проживают отдельно. А единственный сын находится в России на заработках. Она сама работает в сельской школе уборщицей, ее муж является имамом в сельской мечети. Кроме этого работает строителем в селе. У них есть свое маленькое хозяйство состящее из 1 дойной коровы с теленком, а также 7 овец. Кредит запрашивается для покупки и откорма 2 овец. 

Тохтахан 49 лет. Она замужем и мать 3 детей. Как и многие жители села Араван она занимается выращиванием домашнего скота, в основном МРС. Ее супруг также работает строителем, и скоро планирует уехать на заработки в Москву. Кредит будет использован для закупа овец, которые в дальнейшем будут отправлены на пастбище.  

Барнохон, 32, замужем. Ее супруг также является строителем. Сама же активно занимается животноводством а также производством молока и молочных продуктов. В этом году они планируют арендовать землю и посадить там хлопчатник. Кредит запрашивается для закупа семян хлопчатника. 

Саляхон 34 года. Она мать 4 детей: по 2 дочери и сына. Все дети, кроме самого младшего учаться в средней школе. Она занимается готовкой еды для местных сотрудников школ и больниц. Еда реализуется в местной столовой-чайхане. Кроме этого дома у нее имеется живность. Кредит будет использован для закупа 1 телки для откорма. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Rayhan A. lives in the Aravan village. She is married and has 3 children. Currently, she lives only with her husband because the daughters are married and live separately. Her only son works in Russia. Rayhan works as a janitor at a local school, and her husband is an imam at the village mosque. Besides this, he is a construction worker in the village. They have a small household, consisting of 1 dairy cow with a calf and also 7 sheep. They are requesting this loan for the purchase and feeding of 2 sheep. Tohtahan is 49 years old. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. Just like many citizens of Aravan, she is involved in raising domestic livestock, primarily small livestock. Her husband is also a construction worker, who plans to go to Moscow for work soon. The loan will be used for the purchase of sheep, which will subsequently be sent to a pasture. Barnohon is 32 years old and married. Her husband is also a construction worker. She is actively involved in animal husbandry and also milk and dairy products production. This year, they plan to lease land and plant cotton there. The loan will be used for the purchase of cotton seeds. Salyahon is 34 years old. She is a mother of 4 children: 2 daughters and 2 sons. All of the children, except for the youngest one, attend a secondary school. Salyahon is involved in preparing food for the local school and hospital workers. The food is sold at the local teahouse café. Besides this business, Salyahon has livestock at home. The loan will be used for the purchase of 1 calf for feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ngagne D. est un homme marié et père de 6 enfants dont les âges varient entre 2 mois et 20 ans. Sa principale activité est le commerce. Il gère une boutique depuis qu’il a quitté la Mauritanie en 1990. En fait, Monsieur D. fait parti des sénégalais qui ont réussi à regagner le Sénégal lors des tristes événements Sénégalo-mauritanien de 1989 amenant même chaque pays a rapatrié ses ressortissants, grâce à un pont aérien offert par l'Algérie et le Maroc. 
C’est ainsi que de son retour, Monsieur D. qui avait laissé tous ses biens en Mauritanie se lança dans le commerce. Il demande, cependant, un prêt de 500 000 FCFA pour renforcer son commerce. Il compte s’approvisionner en marchandises alimentaires (riz, sucre, thé, huile….etc).  Avec les bénéfices qu’il espère tirer de ce financement, Monsieur Ngagne D. veut aménager une autre boutique à Sao un village pas très loin de Notto.
texts.en:
Mr. Ngagne D. is a married man, father of six children whose ages vary between two months and twenty years. His main activity is commerce. He runs a store since he left Mauritania in 1990. In fact, Mr. D. is one of many Senegalese who managed to return to Senegal during the painful events of 1989 affecting Senegal and Mauritania. Each country had to repatriate its national citizens, thanks to an airlift organised by Algeria and Morocco. This is how Mr. D., who had left all his belongings in Mauritania, started his commercial venture. He is requesting however a loan for 500,000 FCFA to strengthen his business. He will stock up on food products (rice, sugar, tea, vegetable oil, etc.). With the earnings he hopes to achieve through this investment, Mr. Ngagne D. wants to set up another store in Sao, a village not far from Notto.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 18 and 24 years. She has been in business for twelve years and sells sarongs and clothing in Benin City. With her profit and her husband's take home pay they care for their family needs like payment of the children’s school fees, feeding, clothing, etc.

Gloria hopes to expand her business with the loan she is expecting from Kiva lenders. She is requesting a loan of NGN 150,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says a big thanks to all lenders for their great support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a single woman, 23 years old. She has worked at home-based clothing sales since 2006 to earn income to be able to pay her academic school fees. She also sells women’s accessories. She is known by the neighbors and she has a good number of clients.

Today, Riham is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy more clothes and accessories to offer the new collection to her customers and make a good profit. And she plans to expand her business in the future to open a formal clothes store.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and accessories to sell

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel G. is 48 years old and he lives in Tsovagyugh village, Sevan area, with his wife and a son.

For about five years Samvel worked in soft drink production; for the last seventeen years he has been engaged in cattle breeding. With the profits from his stock farming, he provides for his family needs and increases the number of his cows. His wife and his son help him in his business.

Samvel needs a 1,100,000 AMD loan to buy fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy fodder for his farm animals

texts.fr: Madame Ndèye Fatou S. âgée de 55 ans est mariée mère de 3 enfants.  Elle est commerçante de divers produits (encens, …) et avicultrice de poulets de chair depuis 10 ans un métier qu’elle maitrise très bien. En fait, elle compte acheter 200 poussins, 22 sacs d’aliments et des vaccins et vitamines pour les poussins. C’est ainsi, qu’elle sollicite auprès de l’U-IMCEC un prêt de 320 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
Ndèye Fatou S. is 55 years old and a married mother of three. She is a merchant of many different products (incense, etc.) and is also a poultry farmer, selling broiled chicken. After 10 years, she has mastered her profession. In fact, she intends to purchase 200 chicks, 22 grocery bags, and some vaccines and vitamins for the chicks, thus she seeks a loan of 320,000 FCFA from U-IMCEC.

Translated from French by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Williams

texts.en:
Williams is a businessman who runs a road transport business in Benin City. He lives with his family in Benin City as well. He has been in the transportation business for over thirty-five years and with it he makes his living.

With the business, Williams is able to provide for his family’s financial needs and also to repay his LAPO loan. His wife also provides support in taking good care of the home.

However, Williams’ bus is not in good shape and he wants to put it back into shape to enable him to continue with his transportation business. He is requesting the loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase spare parts to fix up his bus. He expresses great thanks to all Kiva lenders and to LAPO micro-finance.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix his bus

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 24-year-old social lady who is married to a businessman. She has been running a wholesale shop for two years and has two employees to assist her in the business. She also does farming to increase her income and dreams of building rental houses in the future.

Rose has requested a loan of Kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add to her stock of maize flour and rice.

loans.use: To add to her stock of maize flour and rice

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pricilar

texts.en:
Pricilar is a 37-year-old lady and the single mother of two. She has been running a salon for thirteen years. She was previously employed as a shop attendant before she started this business.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Pricilar has been able to borrow one loan of Kes 50,000. She hopes to buy new hairdo machines and to open up a modern beauty shop in the future.

Pricilar has requested a loan of Kes 75,000 to buy a hairdryer, hair products and to renovate her business premises.

loans.use: To purchase a hairdryer, hair products and to renovate her salon

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Benin City with her husband, a driver for a road transportation company in Benin. She is a good helpmate to her husband due to her role in the home. 
Esther owns a grocery store where she sells all sorts of grocery items. She wants to stock her shop with more goods as this will attract more customers to her shop and boost her profits. Therefore she is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. Esther will repay her loan at its due date. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

texts.en:
Sami is a 60-year-old married man and father of one child. He is an experienced fisherman and has worked in this business for over 13 years. He owns a fish cart to present his products to customers. His products are in great demand because he sells fresh fish and has a good reputation.
Today, he is asking to borrow $800 USD to buy more fish. In this way, he hopes to increase his productivity and profits and maintain a strong reputation in his business. He will buy from a fish market we work with in an area specializing in fishing.

loans.name: Inas

texts.en:
Inas has worked as a hairdresser for the past 12 years. She opened a home-based business in 2000 to help her husband in raising their three young children. She has a special room at home which she has prepared to receive her clients.
Today, Inas is requesting a loan of $1,000 USD to buy additional supplies such as beauty products, hair colors and hair accessories. She also wants to add new services to attract more clients and make a good income for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies such as beauty products, hair colors and hair accessories

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Nora Elizabeth M. D. R. D. 35 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijas D. 13 y 10 años D. edad, las cuales son estudiantes D. la escuela D. Ilopango, y que dependen por completo D. Nora, ya que ella es madre soltera y no recibe ningún tipo D. ayuda económica. Nora se dedica a la venta D. detergentes tanto en polvo como líquidos, y así mismo lejías para blanquear la ropa. Ella comercializa sus productos D. casa en casa, lo cual le ha resultado muy factible, razón por la que ya desD. hace 6 años se dedica a la misma actividad. Nora solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder comprar detergente, lejías, y papel higiénico, ya que este último posee mucha demanda pero debido a que ella invierte casi todas sus ganancias en los gastos del hogar, le queda muy poco para invertir en el negocio y se le ha hecho muy difícil el poder comprar estos productos por mayor. Es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, ya que cuenta con el deseo D. poder mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus hijas, obteniendo el dinero necesario para invertir más en el negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Nora Elizabeth M. D. R. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Illopango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her two daughters, ages 13 and 10, who are students at the school in Ilopango and completely dependent on her. Nora is a single mother and does not receive any financial support. She sells detergents in powder and liquid form, as well as bleach for whitening clothes. Nora sells her products door to door, which has proven very practical since she has been in this same business for the past six years.

She is requesting a loan because she wants to buy detergents, bleach, and toilet paper. The last product listed is in high demand but because she spends almost all of her earnings on household expenses, she has little money left over to invest in her business. Therefore, it is very difficult for her to buy these products in bulk. This is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral. Nora desires to improve the quality of life for her daughters, obtain the necessary funds to invest more into her business, and generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergents, bleach, and toilet paper to sell

texts.en:
Dora is 52 years old, a widow, and has six children. She comes from Esan in Edo State and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Dora rears and sells pigs to make a living. Her children support her in her work. She started this farm business some years ago and has achieved success.
Dora has been a member of Kiva partner, LAPO, since 2005 and has a good repayment record. With her previous loans from LAPO, she has improved her farm business. She now hopes to expand her farm by buying more pigs. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more pigs for farming. She hope to pay back her loan at the due date. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

texts.es: Vicitacion R. N. de 68 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa la cual trabaja haciendo tortillas, las cuales comercializa en su propia casa y junto a sus 4 hijos de 14, 11, 7, y dos años de edad, de los cuales los tres mayores son estudiantes de la escuela del lugar. Vicitación posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, en el cual se dedica a hacer balcones, puertas y otras cosas más. Él solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar más metal, el cual es la materia prima de su trabajo, y así mismo comprar repuestos para su pick up, el cual utiliza para llevar los pedidos hasta donde sus clientes y elaborar su servicio a domicilio. Vicitación ha sostenido a su familia durante años gracias a este negocio, es por esto que es de mucha importancia poder mejorarlo, y de esta manera poder brindar un servicio más competitivo. Él es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Vicitación R. N. is 68 years old and resides in Ciudad Arce, located in the Department of La Libertad. He lives with his wife who prepares and sells tortillas from the house they own. They have four children (ages 14, 11, 7, and 2), with the three older children attending the local school. Vicitación operates a metal shop where he makes balcony railings, doors, and other items.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more metal, the main material used in his work. He also wants to buy parts for his pickup truck that he uses to deliver orders to his customers, since he provides home delivery service. Vicitación has been able to support his family all these years because of his business. For this reason, it is important that he improve it so that he can provide more competitive service. He is a hardworking and responsible person who wants to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

texts.es: Marta Alicia O. de 43 años de edad, reside en el hermoso pueblo de Izalco, ubicado  en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a su madre de 76 años de edad quien ayuda en el negocio y junto a sus tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican  a trabajar. Marta posee una tortillería, en la cual se encarga de elaborar y vender tortillas, las cuales son muy vendidas, ya que es parte de la dieta diaria de los salvadoreños, la cual se come en los tres tiempos pero sobre todo al mediodía. Ella es madre soltera, quien trabaja en gran manera para sacar adelante a sus hijos, vendiendo de lunes a domingo su producto. Marta solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar maíz en grandes cantidades, así mismo comprar cilindros de gas propano, de manera que pueda contar con mucha materia prima para la elaboración y cocción de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Marta Alicia O. is 43 years old and resides in the beautiful town of Izalco, located in the Department of Sonsonate. She lives with her 76 year old mother, who helps her with her business, and her three dependent children who dedicate themselves to their work. Marta has a “tortillería” where she is responsible for preparing and selling tortillas, which sell very well because they are part of the everyday diet of Salvadorans. Tortillas are served at all three meals, but mostly consumed at lunch. Marta is a single mother who works with great effort so that her children can get ahead. She sells her products Monday through Sunday.

Marta is requesting a loan to purchase corn in large quantities. At the same time, she will buy canisters of propane so that she will have enough materials on hand for making and cooking the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

Zahraa is a 20-year-old married woman and the mother of one young child. She has been working as a beautician for the past three years. This is her third loan from Kiva and she is very grateful for her previous two loans because her business productivity and income have both increased as a result.
Zahraa chose to repay her second loan several months early, and is now requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to add to her savings to buy a car. This will facilitate her business travel to clients' houses, as she also offers her services in customer's homes at their request.

texts.es: Julia Maritza M. J. de 30 años de edad, reside en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, los cuales depende por completo de Julia, ya que ella es madre soltera y no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda por parte de otras personas. Ella trabaja elaborando trapeadores, los cuales posteriormente sale a vender por las calles de Soyapango y que también comercializa en su propio hogar. Julia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de tela para poder elaborar los trapeadores y así mismo poder vender mayor cantidad de estos. Ella es una persona que trabaja mucho por el bienestar de su familia, es por esta razón que solicita dicho préstamo a Integral, con el deseo de poder mejorar su negocio, y de esta manera obtener mejores ventas las cuales se reflejen en su hogar, obteniendo una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella pero principalmente para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julia Maritza M. J. is 30 years old and resides in Soyapango, located in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her two dependent children, ages 5 and 2. Julia is a single mother and does not receive any type of help from other people. She manufactures mops and sells them later on the streets of Soyapango and also from her own home.

Julia is requesting a loan so that she can buy cloth in large quantities for making mops so that she can sell them in bulk. She is a person who works extremely hard for the welfare of her family, which is why she is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral. Julia desires to improve her business so that she can generate better sales to be reflected in her home and obtain a better quality of life for herself, but mainly for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El comité Santo Domingo es un comité que trabaja  en su cuarto ciclo, cada ciclo pasan con mucho esfuerzo pero con éxitos.
En este se pueD. hablar D. la Sra. Rocio V. con 38 años D. edad , tiene 4 hijos, tiene ventas D. frutas en su casa, la compra lo realiza en el mercado D. abasto a temprana horas( aproximadamente a las 4 A.M)  .Es una Sra. muy guapa , con la actividad que realiza ayuda al marido con L. gastos D. la casa y L. estudios D. L. hijos.   
Tiene una casa pequeña que desea ampliar para poder ampliar su negocio.
El crédito fue utilizado para la compra D. frutas y verduras para venta, el crédito es muy útil para la familia ya que mediante ella pueD. abastecerse D. sus mercaderías.
texts.en:
The Santo Domingo Committee is working on its fourth loan cycle. They invest more effort into each cycle that passes, but with success.

In this instance we can talk about Sra. Rocio V.. She is 38 years old, has four children, and sells fruit from her house. Rocio acquires her produce at the farmers market in the early morning hours (around 4am). She is a beautiful woman who, through her business, helps her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education. She lives in a small house, so she wants to expand it so that she can also grow her business.

Her loan will be used to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. It will be useful to her family since she will be able to obtain more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité “ Oñondivepa” tiene antigüedad de 1 año de formación y trabajó con la Fundación  Paraguaya durante este periodo. El comité se encuentra conformada por mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras de un barrio muy humilde de la ciudad, pero todas tienen la esperanza de seguir trabajando y sacar a sus familias de la mejor manera posible.
Recurrieron al préstamo para seguir mejorando la actividad que cada una realiza de manera independiente.
La señora Jorgelina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas en general y también vende en horas de la mañana algunos alimentos como empanadas, sandwiches, croquetas y otros. Su negocio forma es la principal fuente de ingreso ya que su marido no tiene trabajo constante y es jornalero.
Doña Jorgelina comenta que toda la familia ayuda para el mantenimiento del negocio, y esta muy contenta por que con  crédito de la Fundación puede ir cargando mercaderías y mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Oñondivepa" Committee just had its one year anniversary and has been working with Fundación Paraguaya during this period. The Committee is comprised of determined hardworking women who live in a modest neighborhood of the city. They all hope to continue working and succeeding for their families in the best way possible. They have resorted to loans in order to continue improving each of their businesses which they manage independently.

Sra. Jorgelina is one of the Committee members. She sells mainly beverages, but in the mornings, she also sells food such as empanadas, sandwiches, croquettes, and other items. Her business is her main source of income since her husband does not have steady work as a laborer. Doña Jorgelina says her entire family helps manage the business and she is very happy with the loan from Fundación Paraguaya because she will be able to buy merchandise and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages such as sodas, wine, and liquor

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 42-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has been working as a farmer raising cattle for the past 12 years. He learned this occupation from his father. In 2004, he opened his own cattle farm and started producing dairy products such as milk, yoghurt, cheese and labneh, a special Lebanese food product. He delivers his products to the food market and also directly on customer request.
Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $800 USD to buy a special milk machine in order to improve his services and increase the liquidity of his business.

loans.use: To buy a special milk machine

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 1 Group

texts.en:
Miledy is the coordinator of her group, Amor y Amistad (Love and Friendship), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her three children.
Miledy is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling gasoline and motor oil by the roadside (in an area where there is no gas station nearby, this can be vital). She will purchase more gasoline and motor oil and use the profits to invest in food and school supplies for her children as well as saving towards her goal of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more gasoline and motor oil

loans.name: Jibril

texts.en:
Jibril is 35 years old, married and lives with his wife and their four children in Gaza city, Palestine. Two of his four children are now in school, which means a large amount of responsibilities. Jibril was working a construction worker, but now he has decided to be independent and open his own auto-repair garage.

He is hoping that with the loan he is seeking, he will be able to improve the status of the garage. Jibril says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: Improving the status of the garage

loans.name: John Kenagwa

texts.en:
John is a gentleman who is married to a lady called Zepha and they have three children: Teresa, Robert and Hellen. 

John has been in the retail-trade business for seven years and his customers are residents of the place where he also resides.

John joined KADET, a Kiva partner, through existing clients. He has applied for a loan that he intends to use to add stock in his retail shop with things like soap, sugar, cooking fat and other items. He also want to buy a bicycle to assist with transportation as he spends so much money to transport goods. With the extra profits, John will continue to add stock to the business to increase sales. 

John hopes to become a wholesaler in the future and he describes himself as an entrepreneur who is independent and disciplined.

loans.use: To add stock in his retail shop and buy a bicycle

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca F. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy. She is 60 years old. Rebecca is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Rebecca operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Rebecca joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Benedict Mwania

texts.en:
Benedict is married to Gladys and they have two children, Julietta and Tabitha. He describes himself as humble and hardworking. Benedict has been in the milk distribution business for six years. He distributes milk in the place where he lives and in other estates, and his customers are retailers.
Benedict joined Kiva partner, KADET, through existing clients. He intends to use the loan for which he has applied as working capital to increase sales. He will invest in his milk business in order to buy more milk to supply to other retailers. Benedict hopes to buy a car or motorbike to help in distributing supplies instead of using a bicycle.

loans.use: As working capital to increase sales

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion S. is from the village of Znac, Tampilisan. She is 51 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Concepcion owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Concepcion has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Concepcion joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Concepcion is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nellie's Group

texts.en:
Nellie Q. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nellie Q. Group.
Nellie is 61 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Nellie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nellie has been engaged in her business for over 31 years and earns approximately 4,900 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Nellie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nellie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Teofila Bernido Group

texts.en:
Teofila B. is from the village of Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Teofila is 42 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Teofila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Teofila has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,600 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Teofila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Teofila is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her eleventh from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nuevo Emprendimiento Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas , como empanadas , tortillas, croquetas ,asaditos de carne etc, reciclaje de carton , plastico ,y todo tipo de metales en desuso,entre otras actividades todas  ellas son en su mayoria cabezas de hogar en sintesis las que administran y se encargan de llevar a casa el pan del dia a  dia. 
 Actualmente este comité  se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes  ademas de la responsabilidad en los pagos. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Rosa    
Ruíz que se dedica a la venta de golosinas y todas mercaderías de uso doméstico, ella realiza su compra en Clorinda (ciudad fronteriza de la Argentina) y las vende en colectivos y en su barrio. Desea que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas,  por ello se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos la oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
The members of this committee work at various activities, among which we can highlight selling clothes; selling food such as empanadas, tortillas, croquettes, roast meats, etc; recycling cardboard, plastic, and all types of metals; and other activities. They are all heads of their households and are responsible for putting bread on their tables day in and day out.

Currently, this committee is in its third loan cycle, and they are distinguished by the sense of responsibility and the desire to progress that each of them possesses, in addition to the responsibility for their repayments. We can speak of Rosa who sells candy and domestic supplies. She makes her purchases in Clorinda (a city on the border of Argentina) and sells to collectives in her neighborhood. She hopes that her children are not held back by the same work and education limitations, and so she doubles her efforts to be able to offer her children all opportunities to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, flour, oil, and other supplies

loans.name: Unidos Venceremos 2,3 Group

texts.en:
Martina is the coordinator of her group, Unidos Venceremos (Together we will be victorious), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the Samana peninsuL., a lush, rugged area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children.
Martina is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by traveling to the capital to purchase skirts, jeans, blouses and pants in the main markets and then bringing them back to her community to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her business by purchasing a scooter to help her move her merchandise as well as saving towards having her own store one day (her current business is mobile). Additionally, she plans to invest in her home by remodeling it, and in her family by purchasing necessary medicines. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase blouses, skirts, blue jeans and pants to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery products to stock up her store

loans.name: Raydan

texts.en: Raydan is a 26-year-old single man. He lives with his parents and one brother. In 2007, he opened a phone shop after seeing a need for such services in his region. He sells mobiles phones, phone accessories and rechargeable cards, in addition to offering repair services. Raydan is a very punctual client; he chose to repay his first loan from Kiva early. He is now asking for a new loan of $1,500 in order to purchase the latest phone collections, phone accessories and rechargeable cards to fill his shop. He would like to do this prior to summer when tourism is high, because his area attracts many tourists and he wants to be ready.

loans.use: To purchase the latest phone collections, accessories and rechargeable cards.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth sells groceries, she likes the business and has been in it for about a decade. She itches to expand her business and wants to stock her shop with more goods. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of NGN 170,000 to purchase more groceries to sell in order to increase her income.

Elizabeth is 57 years old, married with 4 children and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. Her youngest child is 25 years old and is doing well in school. With the help of her husband, she hopes to give her children the best education possible. She expresses her appreciation to all Kiva lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián  forma parte del banco comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo”, es soltero y es natural  de la ciudad del cusco. Fabian es profesor titulado y actualmente esta ejerciendo su profesión durante el tiempo escolar en el colegio “56266 de Livitaca” en la provincia de Chumbivilcas del departamento del Cusco. El socio cuando esta de vacaciones por los meses de enero y febrero enseña en una academia pre universitaria “Master” que se encuentra ubicada detrás de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Fabián también se dedica a la venta de carne de ovino en la comunidad de Livitaca a los restaurantes. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fabián requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles para comprar 5 corderos que le costaran comprar aproximadamente entre 80 soles y 100 soles.  Fabián nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es abrir una ferretería y radicar en la ciudad del Cusco.   
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Livitaca es distrito de la provincia de Chumbivilcas del Departamento del Cusco, Chumbivilcas Hermoso distrito alto andino de aguerridos pobladores ubicado a 240 Km., de la ciudad imperial del Cusco).
texts.en:
Fabian belongs to the “Kantu de San Jeronimo” communal bank. He is single, and a native of Cuzco. He has a degree and currently teaches during the school year in Livitaca 56266 high school, in Chumbivilcas province, department of Cuzco. When he is on vacation in January and February, he teaches in a “Master” prep school, located behind San Antonio Abad del Cuzco National University. Fabian also sells sheep meat to restaurants in the Livitaca community. He has been in that business for a year, and has done well, because he has worked very hard. Fabian needs a loan of 500 soles to buy 5 lambs, which will cost between 80 and 100 soles. He tells us that his greatest dream is to open a hardware store and live in Cuzco. He is grateful for the opportunity offered here, and commits to paying back the loan per the schedule. (Livitaca is a district of the Chumbivilcas province, department of Cuzco. Beautiful Chumbivilcas, high Andes, tough inhabitants, located 240 km. from the city of Cuzco.)

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabian needs a loan of 500 soles to buy 5 lambs

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
Este comité se denomina Sagrada Familia, y todas sus integrantes se dedican a una actividad independiente. 
 Actualmente este comité  se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las que integrantes  ademas de la responsabilidad en los pagos.
El caso de la señora Maria Pinto quien se dedica a la profesión de peluquería en un salón que posee en su domicilio, sus clientela lo conforman sus vecinos del barrio donde vive. Ella trabaja con su hija quien la ayuda en el salón cuando puede, especialmente los sábados ya que es el día con mayor trabajo por la cantidad de gente que visita su local.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta con su trabajo y mediante el crédito pudo comprar los accesorios que le faltaban para trabajar mejor especialmente un secador profesional para pelos.
 Todas la integrantes del comité trabajan con la esperanza de  que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas.
texts.en:
This committee is named Sagrada Familia and all of its members have independent activities. Right now, this committee is in its third cycle and the sense of responsibility and the wish to get ahead of each member stands out. They are also responsible with their payments. In the case of Maria Pinto, she is a hair stylist in a salon she has in her home. Her customers are her neighbors from the neighborhood she lives in. She works with her daughter, who helps her in the salon when she can, especially on Saturdays which is when there is the most work with the number of people who visit her locale. She is very content with her job and via a loan was able to purchase the accesories she needed to work, especially a professional hairdryer. All of the members of the committee work with the hope of their children not having to have the same employment and ecucational limitations.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, shampoo, creams, hair oils and a hairdryer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy crates of eggs to stock her business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Margarita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Kantu san Jerónimo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 42 años, es conviviente y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Margarita tiene cuatro hijos de la cuales los cuatro dependen de ella y ellos se llaman, Yesenia, Danilo, Linda y Chaska. Margarita es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de sastrería y así de esta manera sacar profesionales a sus hijos. La socia con mucha pena nos cuenta que tuvo un accidente hace dos años atrás le cayo la maquina de coser que le fracturo el pie pero actualmente se esta rehabilitando. Ya son nueve años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone y al esfuerzo de salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Margarita requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital de negocio  y desea comprar hilos y materiales de costura y tela. Su mayor anhelo de Margarita es tener una tienda de costura mas grande y abrir otra tienda donde pueda vender comestibles.             

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Margarita belongs to the communal bank “Kantu san Jerónimo” in the Arariwa Association. She is 42, in a common-law marriage and lives in the city of Cusco. Margarita has four children and they are all her dependents. They are named: Yesenia, Danilo, Linda and Chaska. Margarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who had the good sense to open her own tailoring business to be able to have her children become professionals. This member tells us sadly that two years ago she had an accident when a sewing machine fell on her and fractured her foot, but she is getting better. She has been working in this business for the past nine years and it has gone very well thanks to her hard work and push to get ahead despite the adversities. Margarita needs a loan to increase her business capital and she wishes to buy thread, sewing materials and cloth. Her biggest dream is to have a bigger tailoring shop and to open a store where she can sell groceries. The member is grateful for the opportunity offered her this way and she promises to make all the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Margaria needs a loan to buy thread, cloth, and materials for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruit to stock her business

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo.El comité se encuentra integrada con mujeres activas y trabajadoras entre ellas esta la  Sra.Fanny R. con 52 años de edad , tiene 3 hijos, de profesión modista confecciona ropas sobre medidas , fabrica lencería finas, la venta lo realiza en locales comerciales, ademas da curso de lencería a las compañeras del comité en su casa .Es una Sra. muy activa con ganas de superarse constantemente.
Agradece por el crédito por mediante la mismo pudo adquirir los materiales de trabajo que le faltaban como telas, hilos, botones y otros accesorios.
texts.en:
This group is in their eight cycle. The group is comprised of active and hard-working women. Among them is Fanny R.. She is 52, and has three children. She is a dressmaker. She makes clothes by direct request, and she makes fine lingerie. She sells them at commercial locations. Also, she teaches a lingerie course in her house to her colleagues in her group. She is a very active lady with the continual desire to improve herself. She is grateful for the loan because she was able to use it to get work materials that she needed. She got things like fabric, thread, buttons, and other accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora MARIA ISABEL V. G. tiene 40 años, vive en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 4to de Secundaria, es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella. María se dedica a confección y venta de sandalias, zapatos y zapatillas para damas y caballero. Para la fabricación de este calzado ella utiliza cuero, cuerina, hilos, plantillas, pegamento, etc. Estos productos los compra al por mayor en una tienda distribuidora del distrito del porvenir porque es allí donde puede comprar a menor costo  y así poder generar mayores ganancias.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró 2 docenas de zapatos.
Con este nuevo crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles fabricará calzado escolar para niñas y niños, en diferentes tallas y modelos. Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas para así poder generar dinero para su hogar y los gastos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María Isabel Visitación García is 40, and she lives in the Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the La Perbola II Communal Bank. She attended school until the fourth year of high school. She is married and has four children. Two of the children are economically dependent upon her. María makes and sells sandals, shoes, and slippers for women and men. To make this footwear she uses leather, synthetic leather, thread, insoles, and glue, etc. She buys these products wholesale in the Porvenir district from a store that distributes goods. That is where she is able to buy at less cost. Therefore, she is able to able to generate greater earnings. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought two dozen shoes. With this new loan for 300 PEN, she will make different sizes and styles of school shoes for girls and boys. She dreams of increasing her sales in order to generate money for her household and her children’s expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school shoes for girls and boys

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.es:
El cliente Aquilino M. L. Vive en la Comarca san Nicolás del municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, uno estudia en la universidad y los otros trabajan en la finca con el cliente.
El cliente cuanta con una propiedad de 62 MZ propia tiene un total de 49 animales entre vacas paridas y horas.
El destino del crédito fue para la compra de melaza para el ganado y parte para el mantenimiento y reparación de la propiedad. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y mejorar la producción de leche el cual le beneficiara obtener mejores ingresos y cambiar el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Aquilino M. L. is a client who lives in the San Nicolás region of the town of Achuapa in the Department of León. He has three dependent children, one is a university student while the others work on his farm.

Aquilino owns property that measures 62 MZ (approximately 108 acres). He has a total of 49 animals which include cows that have just given birth. This loan will be used to buy molasses (animal feed derived from sugar cane) for his cattle. Part of the money will be used to perform maintenance and repairs around his property. This will allow him to keep his farm in good condition and improve his milk production, which will result in better earnings and an improvement in his family’s welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed for his cattle; pay for maintenance & repairs around his farm

loans.name: Maria Felipa

texts.es:
La señora MARIA FELIPA D. J. tiene 56 años, vive en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios superiores hasta 6to de Primaria refiere que sus padres no le facilitaron mas educación porque no tenían recursos económicos, está casada, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia  se dedica a la confección  de peluches y mochilas para niños. Para la confección de los peluches y mochilas ella utiliza insumos como: peluche, tela polar, algodón industrial hilos, blondas, etc. y compra estos productos al por mayor en  el mercado mayorista porque los obtiene a menor costo lo cual le favorece, sus productos los vende en forma ambulatoria.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró material como: tela de peluche, algodón, felpa, cierre, hilos, agujas, lana, etc. 
Con este crédito de  1,000.00 comprará mas material como: telas de algodón , telas de felpa , telas de polar, relleno de algodón , cierre, etc. para que haga mochilas para los niños de Inicial y de Primaria.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas, sus ganancias y poder alquilar un puesto en un mercado o centro comercial en donde exhibir sus mochilas y muñecos para así poder generar mayores ventas e ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Felipa D. J. is 56, and she lives in the Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the La Perbola II Communal Bank. She went to school until the sixth grade. Her parents did not have the economic resources to give her more education. She has six children, and one is economically dependent upon her. She makes stuffed animals and backpacks for children. To make the stuffed animals and backpacks she uses supplies like felt, polar fleece, industrial cotton thread, and silk lace, etc. She buys these products in the wholesale market because she gets them at a favorable lower cost. She sells her products as a traveling vendor. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought material like fabric for stuffed animals, cotton, felt, zippers, thread, pins, and wool, etc. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more material like cotton fabric, felt, polar fleece, cotton filling, and zippers to make backpacks for children in primary and secondary school. She dreams of increasing her sales and her earnings and being able to rent a stand in the market or the commercial center where they display backpacks and stuffed animals. That way she would be able to generate greater sales and income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material like fabric for stuffed animals, cotton, felt, zippers, thread, pins, and wool, etc.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora ROSMERY S. R. tiene 31 años, vive en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, está casada, tiene 2 hijas pequeñas quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Rosmery se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos que trae de la cuidad de Lima. Ella refiere que viaja a Lima cada 2 meses y sobre todo para fechas importantes como: el día del padre, día de la madre, navidad, año nuevo.. porque son las fechas donde puede vender hasta el doble de lo que usualmente vende.
Así mismo ella considera que este negocio es rentable porque puede generar ganancias desde un 50% hasta un 100% y gracias a estas ganancias ella puede generar dinero para el hogar y sobretodo para la crianza y educación de sus hijas.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para comprar cosméticos como: colonias, labiales,, talcos, cremas, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para viajara Lima a comprar uniformes escolares al por mayor, ropa interior y utilices escolares por campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Rosemary is 31 years old and lives in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is married and has 2 young daughters who depend on her for support. Rosemary sells children’s, teens’, and adults’ clothing that she brings in from Lima. She travels to Lima every two months, especially around important dates, such as fathers’ day, mothers’ day, Christmas, and New Year, because it is around these times where her sales increase to as much as double what they normally are. She believes that this business is profitable because she can generate profits between 50% and 100% and thanks to this revenue, she can generate money for her household and above all for raising and providing an education for her daughters. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy cosmetics such as cologne, lipstick, talc, creams, etc. She will use the money from this loan of 500 PEN ($200) to travel to Lima and buy school uniforms, underclothing, and school supplies for the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School uniforms and supplies for resale

loans.name: Maria Remigia

texts.es:
La señora MARIA REMIGIA Q. D. B. tiene 72 años, vive en la provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  es analfabeta y refiere que por falta D. recursos económicos sus padres no le pudieron dar educación y ella tuvo que empezar a trabajar desD. pequeña, está casada, tiene 8 hijos D. los cuales 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. María se dedica a la preparación D. menús y venta D. alimentos en su domicilio durante toda la semana. Para la preparación D. sus menús ella compra sus insumos como: arroz, papas, yucas, menestras, pollo, pescado, verduras, fideos, etc. en le mercado Mayorista porque refiere que allí los encuentra a menor costo lo cual le ayuda a generar mayores ganancias.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró vajilla para empezar a vender su menú y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 1,000.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra  D. productos alimenticios como arroz, papas, verduras, menestras, pollo, pato, menestras, etc. y también comprará  platos y ollas.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y empezar también a vender cenas para así poder generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria is 72 years old and lives in the province of Trujillo, in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the “La Perbola II” Community Bank. This member is illiterate as her parents had limited resources and she had to begin working when she was young. She is married and has eight children. Two of the children are economically dependent upon her. María makes prepared food and sells the food from her house every day of the week. In order to prepare her food she buys ingredients such as rice, potatoes, yucca, soup stock, chicken, fish, vegetables, noodles, etc. in the wholesale market. She finds the least expensive prices in the wholesale market, which helps increase her profit. With her first loan of 300.00 new soles, she bought serving dishes to use to begin selling her food. Now, with the next loan of 1,000.00 new soles, she will buy food products such as rice, potatoes, soup stock, chicken, duck, etc. and she will also buy plates and pots. Her dream is to grow her business and begin to sell dinners. In this way she can increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy rice, potatoes, vegetables, soup stock, chicken, duck, etc. Also, she will buy plates and pots.

loans.name: Yrma

texts.es:
La Sra. Yrma, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Hacia el Futuro II”, del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 58 años y es madre 04 hijos, todos independientes.

Yrma de dedica a la venta de comidas preparadas (Menú) , ubicada en su casa un lugar amplio y acondicionado donde atiende a diario a su clientela . Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, invirtió en comprar pollos en javas, aceite en litros, condimentos para el aderezo de sus preparados y utensilios de cocina, así empezó su pequeño negocio. 

Con el préstamo de S/1,000.00 Nuevos Soles comprará, arroz y azúcar en kilos, aceite en litros, papa, cebolla, zanahoria en kilos, utensilios de cocina, ollas, vasos, platos y cubiertos para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Ella se siente con muchas fuerzas aun a pesar de su edad.

Yrma, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer. Su sueño es tener un Restaurant grande
texts.en:
Mrs. Yrma belongs to the “Women Looking to the Future II” Community Bank in the Tarapoto District, in the Province of San Martín, in the Department of San Martín. She is single, 58 years old and the mother of four children who are all independent. Yrma sells prepared food from her house. Her house is a spacious place with air conditioning. She sells the food each day to her customers. With her first loan of 300.00 new soles she bought chicken, liters of oil, condiments for the adornment of her meals and kitchen utensils. This is how she began her small business. With this loan of 1,000.00 new soles she will buy rice and sugar by the kilo, oil by the liter, potatoes, onions, carrots by the kilo, kitchen utensils, pots, glasses, plates and silverware in order to provide better service to her customers. She has a lot of energy in spite of her age. Yrma is thankful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to flourish as a businessperson and a woman. Her dream is to have a big restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to use in food preparation.

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
L. señora  MANUEL. ISABEL D. L. C. G. tiene 41 años, vive en L. provincia D. Trujillo, departamento L. Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal L. PERBOL. II. L. socia  presenta estudios  hasta 5to D. Secundaria, está casada, tiene 3 hijas quienes depenD. económicamente D. elL.. L. socia  se dedica a L. confección y venta D. calzado para damas como: sandalias, zapatos y zapatillas.
