Para L. confección D. este calzado elL. utiliza insumos como: cuero, cuerina, pantillas, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, zuelas, etc., compra estos productos al por mayor en  el distrito del porvenir y cuando  finalmente tiene listo el calzado viaja a las ciudades D. CHIMBOTE a venderlos, elL. refiere que prefiere vender el calzado fuera D. Trujillo porque actualmente hay mucha competencia y las ventas han bajado.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para L. compra D. materiales como:  para hacer el calzado.  Ahora con su próximo crédito D. 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar cuero, cuerina, pantillas, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, zuelas, etc. y hacer calzado para escolares y también invertirá en L. compra D. útiles escolares como: cuadernos, fólders, cartucheras, plumones, etc.
ElL. sueña con aumentar sus ventas y poder alquilar un local en un centro comercial D. Chimbote para vender su calzado y obtener así mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
MANUEL. ISABEL D. L. C. G. is 41 years old and lives in the province of Trujillo, in the department of L. Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the L. PERBOL. II communal bank. She has been educated through the fifth year of secondary school. She is married and has 3 daughters who are economically dependent on her. Her business is making and selling women's shoes, including dress shoes, casual shoes and sandals. To create these shoes, she uses supplies such as leather, artificial leather, insoles, outsoles, glue, thread, buckles, etc. She buys these products wholesale in El Porvenir district, and when the shoes are finished, she travels to the city of Chimbote to sell them. She reports that she prefers to sell the shoes outsiD. of Trujillo, because currently there is a lot of competition, and sales have decreased. She used her first loan, for 300 Peruvian new soles, to purchase materials for making shoes. Now, with her next loan for 500 new soles, she will purchase leather, artificial leather, insoles, outsoles, glue, thread, buckles, etc., and make shoes for schoolchildren. She will also invest in buying school supplies such as notebooks, folders, pencil boxes, pens, etc. She dreams of increasing her sales and being able to rent a store in a shopping center in Chimbote where she can sell her shoes and thus obtain higher profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing leather, leatherette, insoles, outsoles, glue, thread, buckles, etc. and school supplies such as notebooks, folders, pencil boxes and pens

texts.es:
La señora MARIA CONCEPCION G. V. tiene 41 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios  hasta 3ero de Secundaria, madre soltera y  tiene 3 hijos pequeños quienes depende económicamente de ella. La socia  se dedica a la preparación y venta de pan, empanadas, alfajores, tortas, etc. Para la preparación de sus panes y pasteles ella utiliza insumos como: harina, manteca, pasas, aceite, manteca, etc. y compra estos insumos al por mayor en el mercado mayorista porque refiere que allí los encuentra a menor costo lo cual le beneficia. Finalmente cuando tiene listo los panes y pasteles los lleva en una carretilla a vender de forma ambulatoria.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para comprar harina y leña al por mayor y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de harina, mantequilla, huevos, leña, azúcar impalpable, manteca, etc. al por mayor.
Sueña con tener una panadería bien implementada donde pueda elaborar sus panes en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is 41 years old and lives in the Florencia de Mora district in the Trujillo province, within the La Libertad department and is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank. She has a junior high school education and is the single mother of three young children who depend on her. Maria makes and sells bread, empanadas, alfajores, pastries, etc. and uses ingredients such as flour, lard, raisins, cooking oil, etc to make her breads and pastries. She buys most of her ingredients in the large marketplace because she’s able to find it there at the lowest cost which benefits her. Finally, when she has everything ready, she takes the breads and pastries in a cart and sells them on foot. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to buy flour and firewood and she will use her next loan of 500 PEN ($200) to buy bulk amounts of flour, butter, eggs, firewood, sugar, lard, etc. She hopes to have her own, well stocked, bakery someday, where she can make her breads under better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Susana pertenece al Banco Comunal “Kantu san Jerónimo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 40 años, es soltera y vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Susana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de alquiler de tienda de camping. La socia nos cuenta que el turismo en el Cusco bajo aproximadamente el 80%  por causa de las precipitaciones fluviales que azotaron la ciudad del Cusco trayendo consigo perdidas económicas para el negocio de la socia. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo y al esfuerzo de salir adelante a pesar de las adversidades. Susana requiere el préstamo para la renovación de los equipos de camping y comprar más equipos de camping. Su anhelo de Susana es abrir un albergue turístico para hospedar a turistas extranjeros y nacionales.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our friend Susana is a member of the “Kantu san Jerónimo” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 40 years old, single, and lives in the City of Cusco. Susana is a hard working enterprising woman who came up with the idea of starting her own business of renting out camping gear. She tells us that tourism in Cusco has decreased by approximately 80% because of the torrential rains that hit Cusco, bringing with them economic losses for her business. She has had this business for five years and had been doing very well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work and into her desire to get ahead despite her hardships. Susana needs this loan in order to renovate her camping equipment and buy some new equipment. Her goal is to start a tourist hostel to host visitors and foreign tourists. She is thankful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La señora DIOTILIA A. I. tiene 50 años, vive en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios superiores hasta 5to de Secundaria, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia  se dedica a la confección y venta de calzado para damas como: sandalias, zapatos y zapatillas. Para la confección de este calzado ella utiliza insumos como: cuero, cuerina, plantillas, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, suelas, etc., ella compra estos productos al por mayor en  el distrito del porvenir y cuando  finalmente tiene listo el calzado viaja a las ciudades de CHIMBOTE, HUARAZ, HUARMEY Y CHICLAYO a venderlos, ella refiere que prefiere vender el calzado fuera de Trujillo porque actualmente hay mucha competencia y las ventas han bajado.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para la compra de insumos como: pegamento, plantillas, hilo, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 250.00 nuevos lo utilizará para la compra de plantillas, pegamento, hilos, hebillas, suelas, etc.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas, ahorrar y empezar a fabricar y vender zapatillas.
texts.en:
Diotilia is 50 years old and lives in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is the single mother of three children, one of whom depends on her for support. She manufactures and sells ladies footwear, such as sandals, shoes, and slippers. She uses materials such as leather, insoles, glue, thread, buckles, soles, etc… She buys these items mostly in the “Porvenir” district. When she has made her shoes, she travels to the cities of Chimbote, Huaraz, Huarmey, and Chiclayo to sell. She admits that she prefers to sell away from Trujillo because there is a lot of competition there now and her sales have dropped. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to buy supplies, such as glue, insoles, thread, etc. She will use the money from this loan of 250 PEN ($100) to buy more insoles, glue, thread, buckles, soles, etc. She hopes to increase her sales, save some money, and begin making and selling slippers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo, y todas se encuentran trabajando muy activamente cada una en actividad independiente.
 Podemos hablar de la Sra.Adelina V. con 35 años de edad , tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender por la mañana en la zona de Ñemby, este trabajo lo realiza todas las mañanas, luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su venta. Es una señora muy sacrificada que tiene un dia a dia muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con su familia.
Ella agradece por el crédito ya que mediante ella pudo comprar   los ingredientes que ella utiliza para elaborar sus tortas, como; dulces, harina y otros.
texts.en:
The current group is in its third cycle and all members have been working actively in their businesses. We can speak about Adilina. She is 35 years old and has two children who remain at home while she travels every morning to make her sales in the Nemby zone. She then returns home to fix lunch and ventures out again in the afternoon to continue her sales. This lady makes many daily sacrifices. She has many hard days and then must do household chores when she returns home. She does this in order to get ahead with her family. She is grateful for this loan that allowed her to buy the ingredients, such as sweets, flower and other things that she needs to make her pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La señora MARIA MARLENE R. D. S. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito D. Florencia D. Mora, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to D. Secundaria, es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales 3 dependen económicamente D. ella. María se dedica a la venta D. juguetes y adornos. Ella refiere que inicio su negocio con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos que fue D. 300.00 nuevos soles, viajó a la cuidad D. Lima en donD. compró juguetes como: muñecas, peluches, robots, carritos, vasos, jarras, platos, etc. Posteriormente ella adecuó un espacio en su domicilio para exhibir los juguetes y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 700.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará par ala compra D. otros productso como: vasos, jarras, tasas, platos y juguetes como: muñecas, peluches, robots, carrito.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y obtener asi mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives in the Florencia D. Mora district, in the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is married and has five children, three of whom depend on her for support. Maria sells toys and decorations. She tells us that she started her business with a 300 PEN loan through the “Manuela Ramos Movement.” She travelled to Lima and bought toys such as dolls, stuffed animals, robots, toy cars, glasses, pitchers, plates, etc… She later cleared out a space in her home to display her toys. She will use the money from this loan of 700 PEN ($250) to buy more products such as glasses, pitchers, cups, plates and toys such as dolls, stuffed animals, robots, and toy cars. She hopes to increase her sales and subsequently her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Liz Carol

texts.es:
La señora LIZ CAROL A. A. tiene 27 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, es casada, tiene 2 hijos pequeños quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Liz   se dedica venta de calzado para damas como: sandalias, zapatos y zapatillas. Compra el calzado a su tío para posteriormente llevarlos a vender a CHIMBOTE, HUARMEY Y CHICLAYO, ella refiere que prefiere vender el calzado fuera de Trujillo porque actualmente hay mucha competencia y las ventas han bajado.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró zapatos y zapatillas.
Con este crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles comprará zapatos escolares para niñas y niños, calzado para jóvenes niños y adultos.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas y alquilar un stand en un centro comercial en donde pueda vender  con mas tranquilidad, para lo cual esta trabajando arduamente y ahorrando.
texts.en:
Mrs.Liz Carol A. A. is 27 years old and lives in the Florenica de Mora district, in the Trujillo province, in the department of La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the communal bank "La Perbola II." This member went o school through the fifth grade, is married, and has two young children who depend on Liz economically. She sells women's shoes like: sandals, shoes, and sneakers. She buys shoes from an uncle and then takes them to Chimbote, Huarmey, and Chiclayo to sell. She prefers selling shoes outside of Trujillo because there is currently a lot of competition and sales have gone down. With her first loan of 300.00 soles she bought shoes and sneakers. With this loan of 500.00 soles she will buy school shoes for children, children's shoes, and shoes for adults. She dreams of increasing her sales and renting a stand in a mall where she could sell with greater calm so she is working very hard and saving

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school shoes for kids, children's and adult shoes

texts.es:
La señora  LUCILA PETRONILA G. P. D. D. tiene 50 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 3ero D. secundaria, refiere que no continuó estudios superiores porque se casó muy joven. Tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno, chanchos, huachos, etc. en la chacra que tiene cerca D. su casa; cría este ganado para posteriormente comercializar su carne en el mercado D. moche y también junta agua sucia D. diferentes restaurantes o casas.
Con su primer crédito D. 3000.00 nuevos soles compró chanchos bebes y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 2,100.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra D. chanchos bebes y huachos.
texts.en:
Lucila is 50 years old and lives in the Moche district, in the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the San Borja communal bank and has a junior high school education. She says that she didn’t complete her education because she married young. She has five children, two of whom depend on her for support. [Lucila] raises livestock, such as cattle, hogs, orphaned livestock, etc… in an area near her home. She raises this livestock in order to sell the meat in the Moche marketplace. She also removes dirty water from restaurants and homes. She used the money from her first loan of 3,000 PEN to buy piglets. She will use the money from this loan of 2,100 PEN ($750) to buy more piglets.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Djeneba

texts.fr:
Madame Djeneba Sangaré est une veuve  de 51 ans et mère de 9 enfants qui vit avec ses enfants dans le  quartier Hérémakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Djeneba, pour des raisons sociales ne fréquenta pas l’école moderne, mais plutôt la medersa.
Ménagère, elle ne s'intéressa réellement aux activités génératrices de revenus qu’après le décès de son mari et cela  pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de mener les activités d’achat et de vente d’articles de boutique. Elle apprit cette activité auprès  d’un des  amis son de son feu mari.  Avec une expérience de 5 ans, elle maîtrise bien cette  activité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle intègre le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, des articles divers pour sa boutique.
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et effectue sa vente à une clientèle composée de la population locale, en détail , au comptant et à crédit.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djeneba Sangaré is a 51-year old widow and has nine children. She lives with her children in the Hérémakono Nord district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). For social reasons, Djeneba never went to a modern school, but to a "médersa" (private islamic school which offers a religious education). As a housewife, she became interested in income-generating activities only after her husband died, and then in order to provide for her own needs as well as those of her children. For this reason she decided to run a business selling shop items. She learned this trade with one of her dead husband's friends. Having had five years experience, she now masters the business well. In order to satisfy her sharply increasing customer base better, she has joined the loan programme at Soro Yiriwaso and is on her first individual loan with this company. With the loan she is planning to buy various items for her shop. She stocks up at Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and sells to a customer base of local people, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA. With this profit she plans to expand her shop.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items for her shop

texts.es:
La señora SANDRA JOVANNA A. O. tiene 24 años, vive en el distrito DE  MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 3ero  de Secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 3 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella. Sandra  se dedica por las mañanas a la venta ambulatoria  de mates filtrantes como: manzanillas, anís, te, menta, coca, etc. y en las tardes se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida como salchipapa, salchipollo, tallarines, arroz chaufa, etc. 
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró mates filtrantes como: anís, manzanilla, menta, mate de coca, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de mates filtrantes y de vajilla para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is 24 years old and lives in the De Moche district in the Trujillo province, in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the San Borja communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is married and has a three year-old son who depends on her for support. In the morning Sandra sells herbal teas, such as chamomile, anis, mint, coca, etc. In the evenings she prepares and sells food, such as sausages, salchipollo (chicken sausage and potatoes), pasta dishes, and chicken and rice dishes. She used the money from her first loan of 300 PEN to buy teas. She will use the money from this loan to buy more herbal teas to supply her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA LUISA G. D. O. tiene 57 años, vive en el distrito D. MOCHE, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6TO D. primaria refiere que es D. la sierra y que cuando ella era niña no iban mucho a la escuela por eso sus padre no le dieron mas estudios, es conviviente y tiene 5  hijos ya todos independientes. La socia se dedica a la venta D. vegetales como: zanahoria, tomate, zapallo, papas, etc. en un mercado cerca a su casa y también se dedica a criar patos, ovejas y vacas en la chacra que tiene cerca D. su casa.
Mucho D. los vegetales que María Luisa venD. en el mercado son sembrados y cosechados por ella misma en las chacras que tiene cerca D. su casa. Refiere que este trabajo es fuerte pero que desD. niña esta acostumbrada a trabajar en el campo.
Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró abono para su chacra y ahora con su próximo crédito D. 1,500.00 lo utilizará para la compra D. más abono, fertilizante, para arar la chacra y empezar a sembrar zanahoria, papas, lentejas, etc.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa G. D. O., 57, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She is a member of the San Borja community bank. She has six years of primary school. She tells us that she is from a region of Peru where girls often didn't go to school so her parents didn't give her more schooling. Maria Luisa is partnered and has 5 children, all of whom are now independent. She makes a living selling vegetables--carrots, tomatoes, pumpkins, potatoes, etc.--at a market near her house. She also raises ducks, sheep and cattle on a nearby farm that she owns. Maria Luisa plants and cultivates much of the produce that she sells in the market herself, at the farm. She tells us the work is hard but reminds us that she is a country girl, used to hard work. With her first loan of 300 new soles, Maria Luisa bought fertilizer for her farm. She will use this new loan, for 1,500 new soles, to buy more fertilizer and prepare a new crop of carrots, potatoes, beans, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing virtual credits for the Claro and Movistar cell phone services

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djerry Sidibé est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 4 enfants qui  vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Djerry, en plus de ses activités de comptable dans une société de la place, mène des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la gestion d’une cabine téléphonique. Avec la prolifération de cette activité, il décide  de la diversifier en  y ajoutant l’achat et la vente des poissons fumés. Il s’est initié à cette activité auprès d’un ami.
Pour renforcer son commerce, il décida de prendre un prêt avec son partenaire qui est Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des paniers de  poissons fumés. Il a correctement remboursé son prêt précédent.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali et souvent à Mopti 5ème Région administrative du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement  de femmes.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52.500 FCFA
Ce bénéfice va lui permettre agrandir son entreprise, payer les intérêts du prêt  et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Djerry Sidibé is a married man who is 39 years old and has four children. He lives with his wife and children at home in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). As well as his activity as an accountant in a local company, Djerry also carries out other income-generating activities, notably managing a telephone kiosk. As this business is growing rapidly, he has decided to diversify by buying and selling smoked fish. He has started up this business with a friend. In order to strengthen his business, he decided to take a loan out from his partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to buy baskets of smoked fish. He repaid his previous loan without problem. He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and often in Mopti (the fifth administrative region of Mali). His customer base is made up essentially of women. With this loan he plans to make a monthly profit of 52,500 FCFA. This profit will allow him to expand his company, pay the interest on his loan and provide for his needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Sisinia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Sisinia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 36 años, es casada y vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Sisinia es madre de dos hijos que todavía dependen de ella y sus hijos se llaman Edwin y Eduardo. La socia esta ilusionada pues esta embarazada de cinco meses y ella desea que el bebe se ha mujer. 

Sisinia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que se las ingenio para abrir su propio negocio de venta de comestibles. La socia nos cuenta que acomodo una habitación de su casa para poder expender sus productos. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo y al esfuerzo de sacar profesionales a sus hijos. Sisinia requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, harina y muchas cosas más, ella desea implementar la tienda de abarrotes y tener una variedad de productos. Su anhelo de Sisinia es abrir un súper mercado por su barrio ya que los súper mercados están lejos de su barrio. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Sisinia is a member of the “Kantu de San Jerónimo” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 36 years old and married, and she lives in the city of Cusco. Sisinia is the mother of two sons who are still dependent on her. Their names are Edwin and Eduardo. Sisinia is excited because she is currently five months pregnant, and she hopes the baby will be a girl. Sisinia is a hard-working and enterprising woman who has taken the initiative to start her own business selling food products. She tells us that she prepared a room in her home to serve as a sales area for her products. She has worked at this business for the past two years, and it has gone very well for her, thanks to the dedication she brings to her work and her determination to help her children learn a professional career. Sisinia needs this loan to buy more merchandise, such as sugar, noodles, rice, flour and many more items. She would like to operate a grocery store and offer a variety of products. Sisinia's dream is to open a supermarket in her neighborhood, since the existing supermarkets are far from her area. She is grateful for the opportunity provided to her in this manner, and she is committed to making all of her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, noodles, rice, flour and many other items

loans.name: Francisca Elsa

texts.es:
La señora FRANCISCA ELSA F. C. tiene 57 años, vive en el distrito DE  MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundarias, es soltera y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: labiales, colonias, perfumes, talcos, cremas, etc. Estos productos los vende de forma directa, mediante  catálogo o con producto en mano (stock), ella obtiene los productos mediante una compañía muy reconocida e internacional.
FRANCISCA vende los productos a sus familiares, amistades pero preferentemente a los  trabajadores de las fabricas de alrededor  de Moche quienes son sus clientes mas frecuentes.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró: labiales, colonias, talco, cremas, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos lo utilizará para comprar mas cosméticos como: labiales, colonias, perfumes, talcos, cremas, etc. Para cubrir sus pedidos y aumentar su stock.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas  y mejorar asi sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisca Elsa F. C. is 57 and lives in the Moche District, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She's a member of the San Borja Village Bank. She is single, and has a fifth-year secondary school education. She earns her living selling cosmetics, including lipstick, cologne, perfume, powders, creams, etc. She does direct sales from catalogs and stock on hand. Her products come from a well-known international company. Francisca sells her product to friends and relatives, but prefers selling to the factory workers around Moche, who are her most active clients. Francisca used her first loan, for 300 soles, to buy lipsticks, colognes, powders, creams, etc.. She plans to use her second one, for 500 soles, to buy more product so she can fill outstanding orders and carry more inventory. She dreams of growing sales so she can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, including lipsticks, colognes, perfumes, powders, creams, etc.

loans.name: Karina Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora KARIANA MARILYN C. A. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito DE  MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. La socia presenta estudios hasta 6TO  de Primaria, es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Karina se dedica a la venta de menús (alimentos) que lleva a repartir a los trabajadores de las fábricas cercanas a su casa, también vende gaseosas y cervezas, pero refiere que los días de mayores ventas de la cerveza y gaseosa son los fines de semana (Sábado y Domingo). Para la preparación de sus menús ella compra productos alimenticios como: arroz, menestras, papas, aceite, azúcar, pollo, carne, pato, chancho, etc. En el mercado mayorista que es donde los encuentra a menor precio lo cual le favorece. Las gaseosas y cervezas las solicita a los camiones proveedores que pasan por su casa y las compra al por mayor para que le vendan a menor costo.

Ella decidió iniciar con este negocio ya que cerca de su domicilio nadie vendía gaseosas y cerveza lo cual la benefició, logrando captar rápidamente clientes.
Con su prime crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor y ahora con su próximo crédito de 700.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para la compra de cajas de cerveza y gaseosas al por mayor, mesas y vajillla.
Ella sueña con aumentar sus ventas para generar así mayores ganancias y generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y la educación de sus hijos
texts.en:
Mrs. KARIANA MARILYN C. A. is 28 years old. She lives in the DE MOCHE district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department – Perú. She belongs to the SAN BORJA communal bank. She went to school up to 6th grade of primary school. She is married and she has 2 school age children who depend on her financially. Karina sells meals that she delivers to workers in the factories near her house. She also sells soda and beer, but says that the days she sells the most beer and soda are on weekends (Saturdays and Sundays). To prepare her meals, she buys food products such as: rice, vegetable stews, potatoes, oil, sugar, chicken, beef, duck, pork, etc. In the wholesale market she finds the lowest prices which she prefers. She orders the soda and beer from the supply trucks that go by her house. She buys them wholesale so she can get them at a lower price. She decided to start this buisness since no one near her house sold soda and beer. This benefited her and she gained customers quickly. With her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles she bought cases of beer and soda wholesale. Now, with her next loan of 700.00 nuevos soles, she will buy cases of beer and soda wholesale and tables and dishes. She dreams of increasing her sales in order to have more profit and make more income for her home and her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: SHE WILL BUY CASES OF BEER AND SODA AND TABLES AND DISHES

loans.name: Javier Fausto

texts.es:
Javier forma parte del banco comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo”, es conviviente y es natural  de la ciudad del cusco. Javier es un  joven trabajador y emprendedor que abrió su propio negocio de construcción de carrocerías para camiones.  Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Javier requiere el préstamo de los 1500 soles para comprar madera y fierro. Javier nos cuenta que su anhelo es abrir otro taller de construcción de carrocerías en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la provincia del Cusco.    
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Javier is a member of the "Kantu de San Jerónimo" Village Bank. He's from the city of Cusco and has a common-law wife. He is a very hard-working and enterprising young man, who opened his own truck body building shop. He's been in business for five years now, and things have gone quite well for him, thanks to the determination he brings to his work. Javier needs a loan for 1500 soles to buy wood and iron. He tells us that he dreams of opening another body building shop in the San Jerónimo District in Cusco Province. This member is very grateful for the opportunity given him, and promises to make all of his payments in-full and on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Javier needs a loan for 1500 soles to buy wood and iron.

texts.fr:
Monsieur Médoune D. est un homme marié âgé de 32 ans. C’est après ses études qu’il a choisi le métier de commerçant sous l’influence de son père qui était un grand commerçant. Il compte cependant une expérience de 14 ans dans ce secteur. Monsieur D.  gère sa propre cantine et vend du matériel électronique, des matelas, tapis et divers autres produits.
Membre  d’U-IMCEC depuis 2008, il sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit de 350 000 FCFA pour renforcer son activité. Cet argent va lui permettre de s’approvisionner en matelas destinés à la vente.
texts.en:
Mr. Médoune D. is a married man who is 32 years old. After his studies he chose to be a businessman under the influence of his father who was an important businessman. He has now had 14 years experience in this profession. Mr. D. manages his own cafeteria and sells electronical equipment, mattresses, rugs and various other products. He has been a member of U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans associations) since 2008. He is asking for a second loan of 350,000 FCFA in order to strengthen his business. This money will allow him to stock up on mattresses which he will sell.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Griselda Hesperida

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Griselda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 27 años, es soltera y es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Griselda es una mujer joven, trabajadora, responsable y estudiosa, ella actualmente trabaja en un laboratorio clínico desde las 7 a.m. hasta 1 p.m. y ella por las tardes estudia la carrera profesional de psicología en la Universidad Particular Andina del Cusco y esta cursando el sexto semestre. La socia tiene un negocio familiar con su papa y es fabricación de muebles de madera. La socia requiere el préstamo de los 1200 soles para pagar sus estudios y para invertir en el negocio familiar.      

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Griselda belongs to the Kantu de San Jerónimo Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa. She is 27 years old and single. She is from the city of Cusco. Griselda is a hard-working, responsible, and studious young woman. She currently works in a clinic laboratory from 7 a.m. until 1 p.m. In the afternoons she studies for a professional career in psychology at the Universidad Particular Andina in Cusco. She is in her sixth semester. She has a family business with her father. They make furniture from wood. She needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to pay for her studies and to invest in the family business. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her studies and invest in the family business

loans.name: Vhin Flores Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA VHIN FLORES, EN HONOR A UN MAESTRO DE ESA LOCALIDAD, ERA UN LUCHADOR SOCIAL QUE LOGRO UN IMPORTANTE  DESARROLLO DENTRO DE LA COMUNIDAD, ENTRE SUS CONTRIBUCIONES DESTACAN LA CONSTRUCCION DE UNA SECUNDARIA Y LA ESCUELA NORMAL DE AMILCINGO 

ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE AMILCINGO, TEMOAC  EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS EN MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA CUARTA  VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN.

PETRA N. C. ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO. TIENE 42 AÑOS Y ESTUDIO HASTA LA SECUNDARIA, TIENE 2 HIJOS (1 MUJER DE 9 AÑOS Y UN  VARON DE 14 AÑOS). ELLA SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE DULCES TRADICIONALES DESDE LOS 17 AÑOS, LLEVA 25 AÑOS EN ESTE OFICIO, YA QUE ES UNA TRADICION FAMILIAR.  

SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA PODER COMPRAR MATERIA PRIMA  QUE UTILIZA, COMO SON EL CACAHUATE, TAMARINDO, CAMOTE Y AMARANTO ESTE ULTIMO UTILIZADO YA EN LOS ALIMENTO PARA ASTRONAUTA POR SUS PROPIEDADES NUTRITIVAS.  SU SUEÑO ES COMPRAR UNA VENTANA Y UN PORTON DE FIERRO  PARA SU CASA CON LA GANACIA QUE OBTENGA DE LA VENTA DE SUS DULCES  YA QUE POR EL MOMENTO NO CUENTA CON UNO.

EL NOMBRE DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPOS SON:

ANGELINA ALBERTA O. E., VENDE ZAPATOS
MARICELA  HARNANDEZ N.; ELABORA ARTESANIAS
EDUARDO QUEBEDO G.; VENDE TORTILLAS
YAZMIN R. O., VENDE ROPA Y TELAS
VIVIANA  E. S., VENDE ZAPATOS
FLORIBERTA LUCILA S. S., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
ALFONSA ROSA S. E., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
ELBA LETICIA S. E., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
MONICA YUDITH C.  V., VENDE DULCES TRADICIONALES
texts.en:
This group is called Vhin Flores, in honor of a local teacher who was a social activist that achieved significant development within the community. Among his notable contributions are a middle school, and the Escuela Normal de Amilcingo [Amilcingo School of Pedagogy], located in Amilcingo, Temoac in the State of Morelos, Mexico. The group has 10 members and this is the fourth loan they have requested with CrediComun. Petra N. C. is the group's treasurer. She's forty-two, with a middle school education. She has two children (a girl, 9, and a boy, 14), and has earned her living making traditional sweets since she was seventeen. She's been in business for twenty-five years, and now it's a family tradition. She is requesting a loan so she can buy the ingredients she needs, such as peanuts, tamarind, candied sweet potato, and amaranth, which is still used in food for astronauts because of its nutritive properties. Her dream is to use the profits from her candy business to buy a window for her house, as well as an iron gate since she doesn't have one yet. The other group members are: Angelina Alberta O. E., Sells shoes Maricela Harnandez N., Makes handicrafts Eduardo Quebedo G., Sells tortillas Yazmin R. O., Sells clothing and fabrics Viviana E. S., Sells shoes Floriberta Lucila Sanches S., Sells traditional sweets Alfonsa Rosa S. E., Sells traditional sweets Elba Leticia Sanches E., Sells traditional sweets Monica Yudith C. V., Sells traditional sweets

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients including peanuts, tamarind, candied sweet potato, and amaranth.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.es:
Apolonia es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.
Apolonia es casada, tiene 54 años y 6 hijos, Apolonia venD. golosinas, bebidas, D. manera ambulatoria en una calle céntrica D. la ciudad, para lo cual cuenta con una carreta, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Apolonia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas y golosinas.
El sueño D. Apolonia es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Apolonia is a member of the communal bank Primavera. She is 54 years old, married, and has 6 children. Apolonia sells snacks and drinks as a street vendor in a central city street. For this she has a cart. She does this every day. Apolonia needs a loan of 2000 soles. This money will be invested in purchasing soda and snacks. Apolonia's dream is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of soda and snacks

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.
Maria es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además tiene otra tienda en la casa de su mama que esta administrada por un personal.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Maria es aumentar su negocio y tener tiendas mas grandes.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Primavera communal bank. Maria is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. Maria has a store in her house where she sells general groceries. She also has another store in her mother's house that is run by an employee. Maria needs a 2000 soles loan. The money will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Maria's dreams are to grow her business and have larger stores.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: Rubenia De Jesús tiene 50 años, por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería pues tiene más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues sus inicios fueron muy difíciles porque no tenía el capital de trabajo suficiente para ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos, pues ella tiene muchos clientes que son sus vecinos además la atención que reciben es algo que les atrae mucho. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento con el fin de mantener a sus clientes ya que lo necesita para la compra de materia prima como detergentes, pan, productos para el hogar entre otras cosas. Sueña con transformar su negocio en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Rubenia De Jesús is 50 years old. Her economic activity is a general store she has been working in for 30 years. Staring her business was difficult because she didn't have enough funds to offer a wide variety of products. She has many clients who are neighbors and the attention she offers attracts them. She is requesting a loan to keep her clients that rely on her, buy products such as detergents, bread, and household products, etc. She dreams of transforming her business into a wholesale store.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Primavera.
Maria es casada, tiene 44 años y 3 hijos, Maria vende materiales de construcción como arena, ladrillos, sus ventas los realiza en su casa y también reparte a las obras para lo cual tiene carro propio.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de repuestos de carro.
El sueño de Maria es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the community bank "Primavera" (spring).

Maria is married. She is 44 years old and has three children. Maria sells construction materials such as sand and bricks. She makes sales from her home and also delivers materials to work sites, for which she has her own car.

Maria needs a loan of 2000 PEN, which will be invested in repairs for her car.

Maria's dream is for her children to have careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy bags of dried fish to increase her business

texts.es:
Alida tiene 61 años, es una mujer que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para sobre salir en la vida. Actualmente vive en su casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, Karina y Diego, y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

En el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, se encuentra su puesto donD. venD. cuyes, corderos y cerdos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a preparar comida para eventos o fiestas, ya que es muy buen cocinera y tiene una sazón muy exquisita.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es alimentar a sus animales, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 8 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil, es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera D. clientes. 
Para el futuro, planea instalar una tienda D. abarrotes, con la cual pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el octavo préstamo D. Alida con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará alimento para sus animales menores.
texts.en:
Alida is 61 years old, and she is a woman who has always worked very hard to be outstanding in life. Now she lives in her own house next to her two children, Karina and Diego, and what she most wants is to have a peaceful old age. Her stall is in the largest market of the city of Tarma, where she sells guinea pigs, lambs, and pigs, which have been well fed and cared for. For this reason, she has many customers and her economic income is good. In parallel with this activity, she prepares food for events and parties, since she is a very good cook and uses delicious seasonings. What she likes most about her work is feeding her animals, since she raises them very lovingly. She has been in this business for eight years. She finds that the most difficult part is having to stay at her stall all day waiting for customers. In the future, she plans to set up a grocery story, with which she will be able to improve her economic income. This is Alida's eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments punctually and she is ready to do that. In her community bank, she is a very happy and responsible member. With the 1200 PEN that she is applying for now, she will buy food for her young animals.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Herlinda es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Herlinda es soltera, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Herlinda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa, mantas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Herlinda necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa, cereales.
Los sueños de Herlinda son tener casa propia y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the community bank "Nobleza" (nobility).

Herlinda is single. She is 31 years old and has two children. Herlinda travels to the different markets in the area, where she sells clothing and blankets and she buys grains that she sells in the markets in the city of Ayacucho.

Herlinda needs a loan of 1500 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes and grains.

Herlinda's dreams are to have her own house and to save for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Yolanda es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 3 hijos, Yolanda tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Yolanda necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Yolanda son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y equipar su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the community bank "Nobleza" (nobility).

Yolanda lives with her partner. She is 33 years old and has three children.

Yolanda has a store in her house where she sells groceries, an activity that she carries out every day. Yolanda needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar.

Yolanda's dreams are to offer a good education to her children and to furnish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 34 años, es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 menores hijos, quienes todavía están en la escuela y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, comienza con la venta de sus verduras y alfalfa, su puesto está ubicado en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad; ella es una vendedora muy carismática y persuasiva, motivo por el cual tiene muchos clientes, quienes siempre le compran la mayoría de sus productos.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras de venta, ya que así hace sus días de trabajo más amenos. Lleva 7 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de ventas en espera de clientes. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar su puesto para poder vender más verduras y alfalfa.

Este es el tercer préstamo de Ana con MFP y está segura que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su negocio. En su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus compañeras. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más alfalfa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana, who is 34 years old, is a very simple and happy woman who lives in a rented house with her 4 minor children who are still in school. What she wants most is to succeed in life. Every morning, very early, she starts selling vegetables and alfalfa. Her post is located in the city wholesale market. She is a very charismatic and persuasive sales person, and that's why she has many customers who always buy most of these products from her. What she likes most about her work is conversing with her fellow sales people, which makes her work days more pleasant. She has been in this business for 7 years and she considers the most difficult part having to remain all day in her sales post awaiting customers. In time, she wants to expand her post to be able to sell more vegetables and alfalfa. This is Ana's 3rd loan with MFP and she is certain that the credit will help greatly in developing her business. As a member of her communal bank, she is very committed to the development of her companions. The 800 New Sols she is soliciting will be used to buy more alfalfa in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MORE ALFALFA TO INCREASE HER MERCHANDISE

texts.es:
Dina tiene 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Américo de 43 años y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida.

El cultivo de papa, zanahoria y alverja es la actividad que realiza diariamente. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus productos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados por los comerciantes del mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, que es donde los vende.
Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta la ciudad, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. 
Para más adelante desea tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista, donde pueda vender ella misma sus productos.

Este es el quinto préstamo de Dina con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que este producto está teniendo gran demanda en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Dina, age 43, is an unassuming and sincere woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, 43 year old Américo, and their four children. She wants to give them a better live. The work she does everyday is cultivating potatoes, carrots, and peas. Through great effort her fields have become very productive. Her crops are very good quality, and they are greatly appreciated by the merchants at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. That is where she sells them. She has been doing this for 15 years. The most difficult part is taking the products to the city. The bags she takes them in are very heavy, and she gets very tired. Later she would like to have a stand in the wholesale market where she could sell her own products. This is Dina’s fifth loan with MFP. She expects to be very punctual making her payments. She does not want to cause problems with her communal bank. She is very happy with her communal bank. She will use the 1,000 PEN she has requested to buy pea seeds because there is a great demand for this product this season.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Irma es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Irma es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Irma tiene un puesto en el mercado central de la ciudad en donde vende carne, los animales los adquiere en las diferentes ferias de la región.
Irma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carne.
Los sueños de Irma son comprar una maquina cortadora y ahorrar para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the Nobleza Communal Bank. Irma is 33, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Irma has a stand in the central market in the city. She sells meat there. She gets the animals at the different fairs in the area. Irma needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy meat. Irma dreams of buying a cutting machine and saving for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 24 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida.

Su deseo es ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero y aportar para los gastos de su familia. Por ello, todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus chacras para lograr que sus papas, choclos y alverjas tengan los cuidados necesarios para que sean rápidamente comprados en el mercado.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar, ya que sabe que de esta actividad dependen sus ingresos. Lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de los cambios bruscos del clima, ya que eso afecta mucho su productividad. 
Para más adelante, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Javier con MFP y sabe que el dinero del crédito será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, abono e insecticidas, para tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Javier is 24 years old, and is an unassuming and hardworking youth. He lives in his parents' home, and what he most desires is to succeed in life. He wants to become independent and earn his own money and contribute to the household expenses. To do this, each morning from the early hours he works on his fields to cultivate his potatoes, corn and peas to give them the necessary care so they can be quickly brought to market. What he likes most about his job is to plant, since he knows that his income depends on this activity. He has been farming for 7 years, and what he considers most difficult is to care for his crops when there are abrupt changes in the weather that affect his productivity. In the future he hopes to buy more land to increase his production. This is Javier's 8th loan with MFP, and he knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial to the development of his business. In his communal bank he is a very responsible member, and as a result is well-respected. With the 1,500 Peruvian soles requested he will buy pea seeds, fertilizer and insecticides so that he can have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Elizabeth es soltera, tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, Elizabeth tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa y para la atención cuenta con la ayuda de su sobrino en la atención, Elizabeth trabaja en un centro de salud.
Elizabeth necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido para repotenciar las maquinas.
Los sueños de Elizabeth son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y ampliar su negocio con mas servicios.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the communal bank "Nobleza." She is single, 40 years old, and has a son. Elizabeth has an internet parlor in her home, and to attend to her customers she counts on the help of her nephew. Elizabeth works in a health center. Elizabeth needs a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to upgrade her computers. Elizabeth dreams of buying land where she can build a home, and expanding her business with more services.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
Jhonatan tiene 18 años, es un joven con muchas ganas de progresar en la vida; vive en la casa de sus padres y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para cumplir sus metas.

Su juventud no ha sido un impedimento para que trabaje en sus cultivos y tenga sus propios ingresos. Todas las mañanas cuida de las papas, choclos y alverjas que siembra para que crezcan adecuadamente, ya que serán estos productos los que llevará a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma después de la cosecha.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad; lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. 

Este es el primer préstamo de Jhonatan con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si quiere acceder a otro en el futuro. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja para sembrar, así como abono e insecticida.
texts.en:
Jhonatan is 18 years old; he is a young person who has a strong desire to progress in life. He lives in his parents' house and he is ready to work very hard to accomplish his goals. His youth has not been an impediment because he works on his own crops and has his own income. Each morning he cares for his potato, corn and pea crops which he sows so that they will grow properly, since he will take these products to sell in the wholesale market of Tarma after the harvest. What he likes most about his work is to take care of the crops to avoid the pests that can threaten his productivity. He has been carrying out this activity for 3 years, and what he considers most difficult is to transport his products, since the road is very long and tiring. This is Jhonatan's first loan with MFP, and he knows that he must make all of his payments on time if he wants to access credit in the future. In his communal bank he is a much loved member, as he is the youngest in the group. With the 1,000 Peruvian soles he requests he will buy pea seeds to plant, as well as fertilizer and insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 1 hijo, Eulalia tiene un puesto en el mercado D. Carmen alto en donD. venD. papa, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Eulalia se dedica a L. siembra D. papa que venD. en L. ciudad D. Lima.
Eulalia necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. fertilizantes.
Los sueños D. Eulalia son comprar una camioneta para transportar sus productos y que su hijo sea profesional.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Community Bank. She is married, 35-years old, and has a son. She has a stall in the Carmen Alto market where she goes daily to sell potatoes. She also grows potatoes which she sells in Lima. Eulalia needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy fertilizer. Her goals are to buy a truck to transport the produce, and to have her son get a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Bernardo es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo vende pasamanería como platos, ollas, en las diferentes ferias de la región, además vende ropa variada de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes por la campaña escolar.
Bernardo sueña con tener un taller de confecciones de ropa y tener su empresa.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Community Bank. He is married, 40-years old, and has two children. He sells a variety of goods such as dishes and saucepans in various markets in the area. He also sells clothing in the Nery García market. Bernardo needs a loan of 2,500 soles to buy school uniforms to sell at the beginning of the school year. His dreams are to run a workshop making clothes and have his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school uniforms to sell

texts.es:
Julio tiene 55 años, desde que enviudó tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus 5 menores hijos, con los que vive en su casa propia y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para brindarles una buena educación.

La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de papas, choclos, maíz y alverjas, Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que mientras mejor calidad tengan sus productos, mejores precios obtendrá por ellos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos le causen alguna enfermedad. Con el tiempo desea comprarse un auto, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos hasta el mercado con más tranquilidad.

Este es el primer préstamo de Julio con MFP y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y respetuoso con todos sus compañeros y compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de papa y alverja, ya que en esta temporada son los productos que mejor se venderán.
texts.en:
Ever since 55-year old Julio was widowed, he has had to take care of his five children. They live together in their own home, and Julio has to work very hard in order to provide them with a good education. He grows potatoes, corn, maize, and peas. He goes to work in his fields very early every morning as he knows that the better the quality of his produce, the better the prices he will get in the wholesale markets of the town. The best thing about his work is harvesting the produce as he then feels that the months of hard labour have borne fruit. He’s been doing this work for 25 years and considers that the most difficult part of the job is spraying the crops, given that there is a danger that the chemicals used might cause some illness. As time goes on, he would like to buy a vehicle so that he can transport the produce to market more conveniently. This is Julio’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he says that the money will help him a great deal in his work. In his community bank he is seen as a responsible and respected member by all his colleagues. With the 1,000 soles loan, he will buy potato and pea seeds as these are the crops that sell best at this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

Silvester is a 31 year old single man who has been running an electronic shop for eight years. He has one employee to assist him in the business. He also practices farming to increase his earnings. He hopes to expand his business by opening other business outlets in the near future. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to borrow one loan of KES 20,000. He has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy electronic equipment for his shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.es: Maria Elene tiene 28 años de edad, tiene 1 hijos de 3 años a su cargo. Maria tiene un negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 8 años, debido a que no tenía suficiente ingresos en su familia y necesitaba obtener un medio para trabajar. En los últimos días la señora ha tenido unos pequeños problemas en cuanto a la venta porque tiene que realizar la venta de manera ambulante. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  lápiz labial, pinturas de uñas, maquillaje, cremas y ropa en general. Su meta es crecer de una manera abundante y si es posible empezar a tener vendedores que viajen a los departamentos a dejar su producto.
texts.en:
Maria Elene is 28 years old and she takes care of her three year old son. She began her business 8 years ago because her family did not have sufficient income and she needed to find a way to work. Recently, she has had a few small problems with her sales because she has to travel door-to-door.

She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of lip pencils, nail polish, make-up, cremes, and clothes. Her goal is to grow her business and if possible, hire vendors to travel to the other areas to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es:
Silvio B. de 38 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua como servicio básico. Su esposa en ocasiones le ayuda a preparar los dulces.

Desde muy pequeño sus padres lo llevaban a vender caramelos en las calles de Guayaquil, debido a la falta de oportunidades y los pocos ingresos que tenía con familia. Continuó como vendedor abundante de dulces, pero ahora el mismo los prepara.  

Ahora el trabaja los martes hasta los domingos, vendiendo cocos en fundas, panela, cocadas en las calles de Guayaquil. Su trabajo lo realiza en los buses les vende a los pasajeros los dulces que el mismo elabora. Las lluvias le han sido de dificultad en las ventas. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar coco, panela, maní para tener más variedad en las ventas. En el futuro quiere tener en su casa su negocio y poder construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Silvio B. is 38, and he lives in the outskirts of the city on Guayaquil's Perimetral highway. His house is concrete, and he only has the basic services of electricity and water. At times his wife helps him prepare the sweets. Since he was very small his parents took him to sell candy on the streets of Guayaquil. They did this because of the lack of opportunities and the small amount of income the family had. He continued as a street vendor selling sweets, except now he makes them himself. Now he works from Tuesdays through Sundays. He sells bags of coconut, “panela” (an unrefined food product, which is basically a solid piece of sucrose and fructose), and “cocadas” (sweetened meat candy) on the streets of Guayaquil. He works on the busses and sells the sweets he made to the passengers. The rains have made sales difficult. With the loan he wants to buy coconut, panela, and peanuts to have a greater variety in his sales. In the future he wants to have a business in his house and be able to better construct his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy coconut, "panela" (solid piece of sugar), and peanuts

texts.en: Joyce is a 34 year old lady who is married and blessed with five children. She has been selling cereals in retail since 2006. Previously, she sold second hand clothes, before she ventured into this business. She has been trained in business management skills by Faulu Kenya. This training has allowed her business  grow. She dreams of starting a food production company and of stabilizing her income in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 86,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of cereals to her business. She describes herself as honest, hardworking and focused.

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
El señor Orlando Jose M. Z. tiene la edad de 70 años vive en el Barrio La Borgoña, es casado y su esposa es agricultora ella le apoya en los gastos y trabajos de la casa, ellos son una familia con 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.

Ellos se han dedicado desde hace 6 años a la siembra de la piña, uno de los principales problemas que tienen es la escases del vital liquido, que les abastece cada 8 días, el padre del Sr. M., le heredo esas tierras que hoy en día son el sustento económico de la familia, ellos solicitan un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos vegetativos, que garanticen una mejor producción a corto plazo, esto les brindara mejores condiciones económicas para el desarrollo a nuevos fuentes de negocio e inversión.
texts.en:
Orlando Jose M. Z. is 70 years old and lives in the La Borgoña neighborhood. He is married and his wife is a farmer. She supports the family with the expenses and housework. They are a family of four grown children who are independent.

They have worked planting pineapples for the last six years. One of the principal problems that they face is the scarcity of vital liquid, which they have to re-stock every 8 days. Mr. M.'s father inherited these lands that today are the economic sustenance of the family.

They seek this loan to purchase fertilizers and plant materials, which will guarantee a better production in the short term. This will bring better economic conditions for the development of new sources of business and investment.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and plant materials

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en: Evaline is an ambitious single lady who has been selling video tapes and DVDs in Machakos, Kenya. She also provides typesetting and photocopy services. She has one employee to assist her in the business.  She hopes to grow her business and buy a plot where she can put up her business in the future.  She has requested a loan of Kes 70,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy blank video tapes, CDs, cartridges and printing paper.  She dreams of becoming the main supplier of stationery in Machakos and offering the best quality services.  She hopes to create employment for more people.

loans.use: To purchase blank video tapes, CDs, catridges and printing paper

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hardworking married man who operates a retail shop.  He also runs a series of businesses including farming, selling water, distributing bread and renting houses.  He was previously operating a bar before he opened his retail shop.  His wife is employed as a teacher. He wants to add to his stock of cereals in his shop. Therefore, he has requested a loan of Kes.40,000 from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to own many plots and a car in the future.  In a few years time, he wants to be a well-established businessman.  He also dreams of becoming a pastor in the future.

loans.use: To add to his stock of cereals

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: Urbanus is a 35-year-old hardworking father of three.  He has a motorcycle transport business located in a busy environment.  Besides, he is employed, has semi-permanent rental houses and he does livestock farming together with his wife.  He wants a loan of Kes.70,000 from Faulu Kenya to purchase a motorbike.  He hopes to upgrade his rental houses to become permanent houses.  He sees himself becoming a stable businessman in the future.

loans.name: Santos Bernabe

texts.es:
el señor Santos Bernabe R. V. tiene 40 años de edad, trabaja como guardia de seguridad, tiene mas de 11 años de trabajar en esa empresa. esta solicitando el credito para construir un baño sanitario y una pila para almacenar agua en su casa de habitacion, con el salario que percibe de su trabajo pagara el credito. gracias a su trabajo a logrado ir construyendo poco a poco su casa de habitacion.
Santos es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales los tres estan estudiando. Su esposa le ayuda a cubrir con los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja en el area de limpieza en diferentes lugares.
su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Bernabe R. V. is 40, and he works as a security guard. He has worked for this company for over 11 years. He is asking for the loan to build a sanitary bathroom and to get a large recipient to store water at his house. He will pay the loan with the salary he is paid for his work. Thanks to his work he has been slowly building his house. Santos is married and has three children who go to school. His wife helps him cover the household expenses. She works cleaning in different places. His dream is to be able to finish building his house and to give his children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a sanitary bathroom and a large recipient to store water

texts.es:
María tiene 58 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Grimaldo D. 65 años, quien es su compañero D. toda su vida y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila.

El salón D. belleza que con tanto esfuerzo puso en su juventud le ha dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Ahora su negocio ha crecido bastante y se ha convertido en uno D. los más importantes D. la ciudad, donD. cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales son fieles a sus cortes y cambios D. imagen.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es atender a sus clientes y lo hace con mucho cariño y profesionalismo; lleva 30 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que soportar el olor D. los químicos D. los tintes D. cabello, ya que muchas veces le causan mareos. Para el futuro, desea convertir su salón D. belleza en un spa, donD. pueda brindar un servicio más completo a sus clientes.

Este es el primer préstamo D. María con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente si desea obtener otro crédito posteriormente. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos D. belleza para su salón, ya que desea implementarlo mejor.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old. She is a happy and kind woman. She lives with her husband Grimaldo (65), who has been her partner all of her live, and she hopes to lead a calm life in her twilight years. The beauty salon that with so much effort she started as a young woman has provided her with the necessary income to support her family. Now her business has grown a lot and has become one of the most important salons in the city. They have many loyal clients who visit the salon for their hair cuts and styling. What she likes most about her job is taking care of her clients with care and professionalism. She has worked in this business for 30 years and she thinks the most difficult part is dealing with the chemical smell of the hair dyes, which sometimes make her dizzy. In the future she hopes to turn her beauty salon into a spa where she could offer a broader range of services to her clients. This will be Maria's first loan with MFP. She understands that she has to make her payments on time if she wants to receive another loan in the future. With the 2,000 new soles from the loan she will buy beauty products for the salon.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
El Sr. Osvaldo Salvador C. cliente nuevo para la fundación, es casado y padre de 5 hijos de los cuales 4 se hallan trabajando en España, decisión que se vieron obligados a tomar debido a la situación de aquel momento en que partieron.
El mismo se dedica  a la fabricación y reparación de sillones y sillas de caño de hierro y cable, el cliente manifiesta que este negocio surgió como consecuencia de la partida de sus hijos en busca de mejores horizontes en otro país, en sus inicios el mismo solo recorría casa por casa para reparar sillones de cable y luego se un tiempo como el negocio le resulto muy bien y sus clientes le solicitaban la fabricación de los sillones y realizaban pedidos el mismo decidió probar la fabricación de los mismos de eso ya data mas de 1 año y hoy  el y sus 5 nietos trabajan en forma conjunta en la fabricación y venta de los juegos de sillones, como el Sr. Osvaldo carecía de dinero para la compra de la maquinaria dobladora de los caños el mismo fabrico un mecanismo casero para realizar el doblado de los caños que hasta la fecha venia utilizando.
Hoy gracias a la Fundación Paraguaya y al crédito otorgado el Sr. Osvaldo cuenta ya con la primera Maquina Dobladora de Caños que le facilita y agiliza la fabricación de los armajes de los productos que comercializa.
texts.en:
Mr. Osvaldo Salvador C. is a new client with the foundation. He is married with five children, four of whom are working in Spain. They made this decision due to the situation at home when they left. He works making and repairing chairs from iron pipe and cable. He started this business when his children left the country. At first, he went from house to house repairing chairs and later as the business grew clients asked him to make chairs and placed orders. He has been making his own chairs for one year and his five grandchildren work with him making and selling sets of chairs. Since Osvaldo did not have enough money to buy the machine that bent the iron pipes he built a homemade device that does the bending. Today thanks to the Fundacion Paraguaya and the loan he received Osvalda has been able to purchase the machine to bend iron pipes. This makes it easier and faster to make the chairs that he sells.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es: El  señora Vicsia Maria posee un negocio de venta de comida, desde hace 15 años, la señora trabaja junto a su marido, la señora realiza sus compras en León y en Managua de contado pues le resulta mucho más favorable ya que es así le resulta mucho más favorable obtener cada uno de los productos que solicita. Es una persona muy responsable que disfruta mucho su trabajo pues la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a su vivienda a disfrutar de sus deliciosos platillos. Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio ya que en estos momentos las ventas han mejorado considerablemente. Sueña con transformar su negocio en un restaurante.
texts.en:
For 15 years Vicsia Maria has run a business selling food with her husband. She goes to Leon and Managua to buy their supplies because she can get all the products for a better price. She is a a responsible person who enjoys her work. Most of her customers come to her house to enjoy the delicious dishes she makes. She is applying for a loan to invest in her business because her sales have increased considerably. She hopes to transform her business into a restaurant someday.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

Regina is a 33-year-old active lady, married and blessed with one child who attends school.  She has been running a retail shop where she sells cereals and household items.
