It also brings her a good income which allows her to help her children get ahead. She is a hard working woman who constantly looks for ways to make money honestly. For this reason she also sells a well-known brand of beauty products to her friends through a catalog. She earns commissions from these sales. She tells us that it isn’t much, but it helps pay the bills. In the future she plans to expand her snack business and offer a greater variety of items. This will be her third loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible, which has allowed her to continue running her business. Claudia will use the money from this loan to large quantities of items to stock her business. She will also buy a few beauty products on sale in order to be able to resell them for slightly more than her cost.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

texts.es:
Guillerma, de 41 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo, Julio (44), que es panadero y de sus 2 menores hijos que aún están en edad escolar.

Desde hace dos años, esta empeñosa mujer, se dedica a la preparación de queques, desde que era muy joven aprendió cómo hacerlos y además le gusta mezclar los ingredientes exactos para obtener una excelente preparación. Con el transcurrir del tiempo compró todos los utensilios necesarios para la preparación de sus famosos postres. En la actualidad, los vende durante las mañanas a sus diferentes compradores (amigos y conocidos), quienes le compran toda su producción ni bien está terminada, sobretodo por los buenos precios y por el dulce sabor de cada uno. Guillerma está muy satisfecha con el negocio porque le genera buenas ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro planea ampliar el negocio y su producción para obtener mayores ganancias.

Es el 14ava vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando, además dice estar muy satisfecha con su grupo de trabajo, porque son muy puntuales y responsables en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas.

Guillerma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes, al por mayor, para abastecerse y continuar elaborando sus queques, pero en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Guillerma is 41 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband, Julio (44) who is a baker, and her two school-aged children. For the past two years, this enterprising woman has been making cakes. She learned how to make them when she was very young and she enjoys mixing the ingredients together to create excellent results. Over time she has bought all of the utensils she needs to prepare her famous desserts. She sells them to her customers (friends and acquaintances) who buy her entire batch before it’s completed, because of the good price and sweet flavor of each. Guillerma is satisfied with her business because it generates a good income which allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Because she is such an enterprising woman, she plans to expand her business in the future in order to increase her income. This will be her 14th loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible, which has allowed her to continue running her business. She tells us that she is happy with her workgroup because its members are very responsible with each of their payments. Guillerma will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients in bulk, in order to continue making her cakes in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Luis Ricardo

texts.es:
Luis es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Chochope del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola de la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado desde muy joven al transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi. Cuando empezó a trabajar en este rubro solía alquilar algún vehículo de este tipo para ganarse el sustento, pero luego empezó a ahorrar y hace cuatro años pudo adquirir su propio vehículo. Actualmente se vale de el para cubrir rutas dentro de su caserío y con las zonas aledañas.

El continuo uso brindado a su unidad movil y el estado accidentado de las carreteras de la zona han hecho que su mototaxi empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, por ello Luis se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luis es una persona honrada y muy trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es bridarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old and a father. He lives with his wife and children in the Chochope neighborhood, in the Motupe district. This is an agricultural zone within the province of Lambayeque, located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. He has been transporting freight and passengers via “mototaxi” since he was very young. When he began working in this field, he used have to rent his vehicle, but he later began saving his money and was able to buy his own vehicle four years ago. He now uses it to work within his neighborhood and within the neighboring zones. He has continued to use his vehicle, but the conditions of the roads in the zone have caused some damage to his mototaxi, which is in urgent need of repair. Because of this, Luis has seen fit to request this first loan of 2000 PEN ($725) through Edpyme Alternativa. This will allow him to meet his objective. Luis is an honest, hard working man. His greatest desire is to give his children the opportunity to study and have a better career.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for repairs to his mototaxi

texts.es:
La señora Erika T. tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la colocación de unas postizas de acrílico.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de materia prima, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión. Solicita el préstamo y así poder comprar el material, y así atender mejor a sus clientas.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Erika has been in the business of applying acrylic fingernails for more than one year. The business could use a greater variety of materials, but at the moment [Erika] doesn’t have the money to buy the materials. She is asking for this loan in order to buy materials and better serve her customers. She will repay the loan with the revenue from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El señor Abraham R. y su esposa la señora Perfecta Alemán tiene dos hijos de pequeña edad, les preocupa su seguridad en la casa ya que le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de la casa. 
 Pero por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material, ya que el señor Abraham se dedica a la construcción y el mismo elaborar la barda. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtienen de su trabaja como albañil, ya su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso de su trabajo de limpieza de una casa particular.
texts.en:
Abraham and his wife, Perfecta, have two young children. They worry about their home’s security because it does not have a wall (fence) in the front. At the moment they do not have the money to buy the building materials. Abraham works in construction and will build the wall himself, so he is asking for this loan. He will repay the loan with his income from his work as a mason. His wife takes care of the household expenses from her income as a cleaning woman in a private home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a fence.

texts.es:
El señor Carlos H. ya ha tenido dos créditos con FVP los cuales le han ayudado ha mejorar su vivienda. 
El y su esposa acaban de recibirse de maestros de primaria ha si que el ingreso de es bajo y quieren mejorar la calidad de vida de ellos y sus dos hijos.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder elaborar la barda alrededor de la casa y colocar el piso de concreto, ya que por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora lo mas pronto posible ya trabaja todo el día el y su esposa. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Argelia Ángeles González esposa del señor Carlos ya que el se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Carlos has had two prior loans through FVP which have helped him improve his home. He and his wife have recently graduated as elementary school teaches. They want to improve the quality of life for themselves and their two children. Since he doesn’t have the money at this time, he is requesting this loan in order to be able to build a wall around his house and add a concrete floor. He would like to make these improvements as soon as possible, as he and his wife work all day. The woman in the photograph is his wife, Argelia. Carlos was at work on the day of our visit.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

Mrs. Leng O. is a 30-year-old fish seller and has been operating her own business in a market located in Siem Reap province. By doing this, she is able to earn a profit of at least $3 a day which she uses to support her family.

Leng O. is a good mother who takes care of two teenage children who attend the local public school. The family’s other contributor, Leng O.’s husband, age 32, earns money by fishing.

Leng O. needs the Kiva loan in order to enlarge her fish-selling trade because she hopes this will allow her to increase her income to ensure that her family attains a better standard of living.

loans.name: Juana Ivania

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana Ivania Pérez es comerciante del municipio de Condega  y se dedica a la elaboración de tamales de maíz rellenos con frijoles.

Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima como maíz, cal, leña, frijoles, etc. Ella quiere comprar mas materia prima y aumentar su negocio y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.

Ella se ha dedicado a la elaboración de artesanía y con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos empezó con la elaboración de tamales de maíz rellenos con frijoles en pequeñas cantidades y al tener muy buena demanda este alimento ella empezó a elaborar en más cantidad y así  satisfacer la demanda. Ella ha tenido este negocio por mas de 5 años y trabaja cada día de 6 de la mañana y hasta las tres de la tarde en la elaboración y o por la tarde el esposo le ayuda a la venta de los tamales.

Ella espera que con este financiamiento aumente sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda que existe de este producto y así sus ingresos familiares y su calidad de vida mejoren. Ella dice que con los créditos que Ceprodel le ha otorgada ella ha tenido un impacto positivo en el crecimientos de su negocio e ir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Ivania Pérez is a merchant in the town of Condega who prepares corn tamales filled with beans. She is requesting a loan in order to buy materials such as corn, lime, firewood, beans, and other items. Juana wants to buy more of these materials so that she can increase her business and her earnings.

She also engages in making handicrafts in order to improve her income. Juana started making corn tamales filled with beans in small quantities. Since demand for this food was very good, she began preparing larger quantities in order to meet that demand. Juana has had her business for more than five years and works each day preparing food from 6am until 3pm. In the evenings, her husband helps with selling the tamales.

She hopes that this loan will increase her sales, satisfy the existing demand for her products, and improve her family’s income and quality of life. Juana says that the loans from CEPRODEL have had a positive impact in increasing her business and improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, lime, firewood, beans, and other items

texts.es:
La joven Seyli Carolina M. B. trabaja como administradora en una fabrica de artesanías en el municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de mercadería como   abarrotería, ropa y cosméticos para venderle al resto de los empleados de esa empresa.

Ella empezó este negocio vendiéndole mercadería a sus compañeros de trabajo en pequeñas cantidades y como hay buena demanda el negocio ha ido creciendo, este negocio tiene aproximadamente unos dos años de tenerlo. Ella realiza las labores días de lunes a viernes desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. Cabe señalar que esta joven tiene 6 años de trabajar en esta empresa, desde que finalizo los estudios de secundaria.

Seyli M. es joven soltera y con dos hijos uno de ellos en edad escolar y esta en primer grado de primaria y cuyos gastos escolares son asumidos por ella. Ella vive en la casa de su tío junto a dos de sus hermanas.

Este es el crédito número siete que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de cinco años,  el impacto de estos ha sido muy positivo y satisfactorio ya que le han ayudado a ir creciendo es su negocio y a la compra de muebles para el hogar mejorando sus condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Seyli Carolina M. B. is a young woman who works as an administrator for a crafts factory in the town of Condega. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy merchandise such as groceries, clothing, and cosmetics to sell to the other employees at her workplace.

She began selling merchandise to her co-workers in small quantities, but demand was so good that her business kept growing. Seyli has had this business for approximately 1½ years. She engages in her work Monday through Friday from 8am until 4pm. It should be noted that this young woman has been employed six years at this company. She started working there after she graduated from high school.

Seyli M. is a single young woman with two school age children. They are in first grade and she covers their school expenses. Seyli lives in the home of her uncle with two of her sisters.

This is the seventh loan she has taken with CEPRODEL over a period of five years. The impact of these loans has been very positive and satisfactory since they have helped to grow her business. She has also purchased furniture for her home, thus improving the living conditions for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

Laura runs a small restaurant & eatery business. Although her husband has a job, he sometimes helps in running the business. They have 3 children between the ages of 7 to 19 years old and are currently going to school. The children also helping their parents in the business during their free time as part of their daily chores.

Laura joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 of August in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in restaurant & eatery business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 70,000 from her business activities.

Laura is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 was used to fund operations of her restaurant/eatery, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 14th cycle loan, an amount of PHP 10,000, which she intends to use for her restaurant/eatery business. Laura is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Mr. S., 26, is a boatman. He owns a boat that he uses to deliver anything across the river for a fee and typically makes around $5 per day. He has a partner in his wife who stays at home and invests in a small job as a grocery seller. Also, she takes care of their two kids and cooks meals for the family.

S. is very busy at his business activities due to there being many clients who need his service. Presently he can’t completely satisfy the needs of his customers because he has not enough space to perform his service. Therefore, he decided to seek a loan of $500 to be used to purchase a better boat for his service.

loans.name: Toem's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in the province of Siem Reap in Cambodia. They will use their loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. S. is a humble villager who earns her daily income by selling ice blocks in the village. She is married and has five kids who attend the local school. She has a life partner in her husband who is a motorcycle taxi driver. He operates his service around the community. S. has been trying to build her new house for a long time, but the construction is never completed. Because she doesn’t have enough money, she decided to ask for a loan from Kiva through HKL’s project. She will use her loan to buy supplies to help her finish building her new house. 

S. has three other borrowers in her loan group. S. will use her loan to enlarge her ice-selling trade. P. needs a loan to repair her old house. N. is a temporary worker who would like a loan to decorate her home.

loans.use: To buy supplies to finish building a home

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia R. runs a sari sari store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Brgy. Narawis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She is married and has four school-age children. Lucia has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2004, Lucia joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from NWTF. Lucia is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF. Lucia plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life which can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

texts.en:
Abundia M. is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family with her buy and sell rice business. She lives in Brgy Tagbino Vallahermoso, Negros Occidental with her 49-year-old husband, Gregorio, who works as a farmer and habal-habal driver (a single motorcycle used for transportation especially in a mountainous area).  They have four children who are between 18-29 years old. Two of them work, one is still a student and one has a family.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buy and sell of rice business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Abundia is now borrowing PHP 26,000 so that she can expand her buy and sell rice business. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Abundia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Clemencia S. is a 48-year-old married woman who supports her family with her restaurant/eatery business, livestock and play station machine. She lives in Brgy Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Occidental with her 49-year-old husband, Benjamin, who works as a foreman in a construction firm.  They have three children who are between 5-21 years old.  One of them is already married.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her restaurant/eatery, livestock and play station business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Clemencia is now borrowing PHP 16,000 as additional working capital for her restaurant/eatery. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Clemencia aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Erlinda A. is a 65-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Pook Hillside, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store, farming, food vending and being a videoke operator.

Erlinda’s husband, Tomasito, helps her run her businesses.  They have 10 children. Six of the children have their own families and the other four are still single and help their parents with household needs.

Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store, farming, food vending and being a videoke operator. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000 from her business activities.

Erlinda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, farming, food vending and being a videoke operator, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use on her general store and food vending.  Erlinda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Salvacion A. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family with peanut processing (salted, coated, boiled peanuts) and a vegetable garden. She lives in Brgy Asia Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental with her husband, Artemio, and their three children who are between 24 and 29 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her peanut processing (salted, coated, boiled peanuts) and vegetable garden businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Salvacion is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can expand her peanut processing (salted, coated, boiled peanuts) and vegetable garden. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Salvacion aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle A. is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of La Carlota, Negros Occidental.  She is married and has four school-aged children.  To make a living, Annabelle operates a sari-sari store selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Annabelle has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately PHP 7,000 a month from these activities.

In 2002, Annabelle joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP 13,000 from NWTF. Annabelle is now requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Annabelle from NWTF.  Annabelle plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the tuition fees for her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon."

loans.use: To purchase additional product to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Siem Chor Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight members, all of whom live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Siem C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. Each of tH. will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Vuth Neang, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family. Their rice field has problems in that its soil is infertile and it is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Siem C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to increase their rice yield. The couple has five children. One of tH. is a policeman, another is a seamstress in a garment factory, and the others are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to increase rice yield

texts.en: Mrs. Navy T. is 44 years old and a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable and baby clam seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband is a government worker receiving a small salary to help his family. This couple does not earn enough income from their different businesses to support their family; thus, Mrs. Navy T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has four children: one is a government worker while the other three are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

texts.ru: Сафарова Хатичамо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 38 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Хатичамо более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. В этом ей помогают дети. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Хатичамо хочет купить дойную корову, чтобы обеспечить свою семью молоком.
texts.en:
Hatichamo S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 38 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband works in Russia. Hatichamo has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. She raises and sells livestock. Her children help her with this business. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle. Hatichamo wants to buy a dairy cow in order to provide her family with milk.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Kuylang

texts.en: Mrs. Kuylang B. is 44 years old and a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this farming, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her crops; thus, she decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and rice seed. Aside from farming, she is also a vegetable seller. Her husband is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children: one of them is a construction worker, while two others are students at the local school, and the youngest one is 4 years old. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Mrs. Kunthea Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people make up this loan group.They live in Prek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kunthea H. is the group's leader, selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow vegetables to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Thuch Seng, sells recycled goods. Their field is ready to plant so Mrs. Kunthea H. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seed to grow. She has three children, two of whom attend the local public school, and the other is too small to go school.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed to grow

texts.en: Mrs. Mech S. is a 36 year-old married woman who lives in Kor village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She faces a problem because her field has infertile soil and is a long way from the irrigation system. Mrs. Mech S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to get to the water she needs for her farm. Mrs. Mech S. is a widow with three children, a student in the local school and three-year twins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Savina Jepchirchir

texts.en: Savina is thirty five years old, married  and the mother of three children. She lives in Kapkuto village in Eldoret, Kenya. Savina buys materials and makes clothes for sale. Most of her customers are in Kapkuto. She has been in this business for three years. With the loan she intends to buy more materials to make clothes and also to buy school uniforms for resale. Savina hopes that with this loan she will be able to make more profit, increase her capital, and expand her business. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also in KADET.

loans.use: To buy material to make clothes.

loans.name: Mr. Mao Un Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mr. Mao U. is the leader of a twelve-person group in Prek P. village in Kandal province. He was selected by all the members. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family; his wife, Mrs. Bong Lis, sells recycled goods. But their field has infertile soil and is far from the irrigation system so Mr. Mao U. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline so he can get to the water he needs. He is the father of five children — two do farming and the others are enrolled in the local public school.

texts.ru: Рахматова Мохпари проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 39 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки и она занялась бизнесом. Торгует у себя дома. Занимается этим делом уже 4 года. Она в основном продает одежду. На полученный кредит хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en:
Mohpari R. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband left to go to Russia for work, and she started a business. She sells at home. Mohpari has been involved in this business for 4 years now. She mainly sells clothing. She wants to use this loan to expand the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.ru: Гадоев Чамахон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Чамахон более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник, где разводит крупно- рогатый скот. Одновременно он занимается растениеводством. Кредит берет для закупа скота. Чамахон хочет купить телят и продать их по выгодной ему цене.
texts.en:
Chamahon lives in the city of Kulob. He is 57 years old, married and has 6 children. His wife is a homemaker. Chamahon has been involved in animal husbandry for over 15 years. He has a small cowshed where he breeds cattle. At the same time, he is involved in agriculture. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock. Chamahon wants to buy calves and resell them at a more profitable price.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Merlabel

texts.en:
Merlabel C. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Merlabel is married and has 6 school-aged children. Merlabel owns & operates a store where she sells seafood such as fish and shrimp. Merlabel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Merlabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlabel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma B. is from the village of  Daan Lungsod, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old, married and has 1 infant. Wilma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells food & daily-use products. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Mutungo South Namutebi Resty Group

texts.en:
N. Resty is a happy business lady. She is twenty-four, married and has one child who goes to school. She has another dependent who also goes to school. 

She owns a fridge and sells soft drinks such as sodas, passion fruit drinks and mineral water. She has been running her business for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase soft drinks to sell. She is a determined, hardworking business lady whose future plan is to open a shop.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly P. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 51 years old, is widowed, and has five school-aged children. Merly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merly is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine V. is a 43-year-old married woman from South Cotabato. She has four children and the oldest is aged 15.

Lalaine raises hogs for a living. She said that she is currently having a difficulty because of the increasing price of the feeds. She joined CEVI to have financial support for her business.

Lalaine currently has five hogs and she wants to increase this. She applied for a loan of Php 8,000, which she would use to buy feed for her hogs. She also hopes to buy another piglet to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and a piglet

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn, 50 years old, is a rice farmer. She is married to Antonio, who is also a farmer. She currently owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) rice field.

Marilyn said that right now, her income from the farm is too small because farm inputs are too expensive and during harvest, the price of the rice decreases. But she is determined to earn from her farm so she does her best to make it productive.

Marilyn would like to request a loan of Php 8,000 which she will use to buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mutungo South Nabuuma Marriam Group

texts.en:
N. Marriam is a businesswoman, thirty-one years old, who is married with three children schooling. She deals with a restaurant business which she has been operating so far for four years.

Marriam is using the loan to add capital to her business by buying more restaurant items like food (bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes, rice, maize flour, Irish potatoes, and so forth), sauces (beef, chicken, vegetables, and so on), drinks (sodas, Splash, milk, water, and so forth), and so forth to meet her customers’ demands.

Marriam is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To add capital to her restaurant business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy currently tills 3.75 hectares (9+ acres) of rice field in her town in South Cotabato. She is 37 years old, married and has no children yet.

Mercy has been farming since 2004 and the farm is the only source of income she and her husband have. She wants to maintain this business of hers because she wants to have a better income, especially now that they are planning to have kids.

Mercy is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said she would use this loan to acquire seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Carol

texts.en: Carol O. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Carol owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp with the help of her husband in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Carol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Carol is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Merian

texts.en:
30-year-old Merian is married to Richard and they have two children. Her oldest child is aged 6. She wants her children to have a proper education so she works hard to be able to save this early.

Merian is involved in rice farming and currently owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. She hopes to grow her business to earn more and also to improve her family’s living conditions.

Merian applied to CEVI for a loan of Php 8,000. This loan will be used to supply her farm inputs like seed, fertilizer and other supplies.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Orlan

texts.en:
Orlan is a hard-working farmer. He is 36 years old, married and the father to three children. His oldest child is aged 10.

Orlan has been involved in rice farming since 1999 and now he has 1.25 hectares (3+ acres) of rice field on which he hopes to grow more.

Like other farmers, financial support is what he currently lacks. He needs inputs for his farms so he applied to CEVI and is now requesting to loan Php 8,000. He will the loan to buy seed, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

This loan will truly help Orlan in his goal to grow his farm.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

texts.ru: Назаров Ризо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат, детей не имеет. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ризо имеет среднее образование. Более 15 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает топливо. Закупает топливо и продает в районах по выгодной ему цене. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
Rizo N. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 46 years, married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker. Rizo has a secondary education. He has been involved in retail sales for over 15 years. He mainly sells fuel. Rizo buys the fuel and sells it in the districts at more profitable prices. He is requesting the loan in order to increase product turnover. He wants to expand his business and improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Rhodeline

texts.en:
“My farm is not productive lately because I was financially short when I started”, shares Rhodeline about his business. He is a 39-year-old farmer who lives in a town in South Cotabato. He is married and has two children.

Rhodeline said that the reason he joined CEVI was to gain financial support for his farm. It is the only source of income his family currently has so he wants to make it productive.

Rhodeline applied for a loan of Php 6,000 which he will use to buy farm inputs like seed and fertilizer. This is the first time he has borrowed from CEVI and hopefully it will help his farm immensely.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kigo Nakijoba Alice Group

texts.en:
N. Alice is a businesswoman, thirty-three years old, who is a single woman with five children all going to school. She deals in stone quarrying and she has been in the business for over twenty years.

Alice is using the loan to pay wages in her stone-quarrying business. The loan is improving her business as well improving her family welfare. She is so encouraging and her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To pay wages in her stone-quarrying business

loans.name: Shamela Grace

texts.en:
Shamela, 29 years old, is a married woman with three children. She lives in a town in South Cotabato with her family.

Shamela currently owns 2.5 hectares (6.25 acres) of rice field which she and her husband till together. She helps him ensure the rice crops are growing healthy on their land.

Shamela also joined CEVI to gain access to its programs. She asked for a loan of Php 8,000 which she will use to acquire seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe A. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Felipe owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Felipe joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Felipe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of relatives and other family members. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

texts.ru: Рахмонов Абдували проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Абдували имеет средне- специальное образование. Он фармацевт. Имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. У него аптека, где он продает лекарства. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Abduvali R. lives in the city of Kulob. He is 49 years old, married and has 4 children. Abduvali has a secondary-specialized education. He is a pharmacist and has a lot of experience in this field. He has a pharmacy, where he sells medicines. He is requesting the loan in order to increase goods turnover. He wants to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine K. was born in 1974 and she is married to David K.. They have five children: Kipngetich (15 yrs), Kiprono (13 yrs), Chepking (11 yrs), Kiptoo (9 yrs) and Jelagat (7 yrs). All their children are in the primary school.

Josephine earns her living by practicing horticulture on her farm and has a secondary business running a retail kiosk. She started this business ten years ago and it gives a profit of Ksh 3,000 per month. Josephine also does dairy farming which gives her an additional income.

Josephine was introduced to KADET by her friends and since she started obtaining loans, she has only borrowed from KADET.  She has now borrowed Ksh 42,000 from KADET. She will use Kshs 20,000 to purchase stock for her kiosk and the balance she will use to purchase farm inputs.

If her business gives her extra profits due to the loan, Josephine plans to pay school fees for her children and expand her farming business.

Josephine hopes and dreams of purchasing a vehicle to ease the transportation of her goods from her farm to town.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her retail shop such as soap, cooking fat and other items

texts.en:
Mrs. Pha L. is 43 years old and is a villager who lives Roka village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sao Phon, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they cultivate rice. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

In order to support her rice farming, Mrs. Pha L. decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her growing crop. Aside from farming, Mrs. Pha L. is a pig breeder who is able to earn a small income to support her family living.

This couple has eight children, one of whom is a laborer, three others are seamstresses in the garment factory, three are students in the public school while the youngest one is 4 years old.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeurn S. is 37 years old and lives in Kor village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice.

In order to support her rice farming, Mrs. Khoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming.

Her husband, Mr. Phal Phoa, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to support his family living. He is shown on the right in the photo. Mrs. Khoeurn S. is the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the public school while the youngest one is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline for her farm

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kigo Nakyenjjwe Scovia Group

texts.en:
N. Scovia is a hardworking businesswoman of thirty-five years who is married with eight children of whom four are going to school.

Scovia has operated a stone-quarrying business since 2000 and she is using the loan in her business. The loan is boosting her business and encouraging her to work very hard to meet her target.

Scovia’s dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Yee

texts.en:
Mrs. Yee L. is a villager who lives in Preak Reussei village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows crops. In this farming, she decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and to pay for a farm laborer.

Mrs. Yee L. is 34 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a student in the local school while the youngest one is too young to study or work. Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Seangly, is a farm laborer and also a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family’s living. He is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 23-year-old engaged man who lives in the Bekaa. He owns a truck which allows him to transport merchandise, furniture or anything else in the Lebanese territory. He doesn’t have fixed working hours - he works whenever he can, knowing that he has to support his parents. Also, he plans on getting married soon so he has to save some money for his wedding expenses and for his house.

Mahmoud’s clients can be anyone, but mainly he works independently for either traders, or individuals. He decided on doing his job because, with this actuA. work, he has increased his income and is free and subject to his own timing. His clients like working with him because he is trustful and also because of his punctuality.

Mahmoud is capable of doing his work because of his self-confidence and his strong will. For the second time, Mahmoud plans on taking a loan in order to do some maintenance work on his truck.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his truck

texts.ru:
Представляем на ваше внимание нашу очередную группу солидарности с г. Кадамжай. Город расположен на пересечении  границ трех суверенных государств:Кыргызстан, Узбекистан и Таджикистан, и уникален очень широким этническим составом региона. Кадамжай знаменит своей черешней и абрикосами, которые пользуются огромным спросом далеко за пределами Кыргызстана. 
Начну представление группы, как обычно с лидера. 

Эргешова Багдагул, 34 года, разведена. Она воспитывает одного 14 летнего сына, который учится в школе. Клиентка занимается сдачей свадебных платьев напрокат, а также предоставляет разного предсвадебные услуги, такие как, макияж, прическа в собственном салоне красоты. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 2007 года. Это ремеслу она обучалась в соседней республике Узбекистан. Кредит будет использован для закупа новых платьев для последующей сдачи напрокат.

Кыямидину 42 года. Он женат и воспитывает 2 детей. Супруга работает поваром. Его оба детей учатся в школе. Кыямидин занимается разведением МРС, а также перепродажей скота. Кредит будет использован для закупа 10 голов МРС. 

Гулбара, 34, замужем. Мать 4 детей: 3 дочек и одного сына. Ее супруг работает мастером по ремонту бытовой техники, сама же является локальным дистрибьютером продукции "Орифлейм" и открыла фирменный магазин.  Кредит будет использован для закупа косметических изделий. 

Гулзаада занимается реализацией женской одежды. Этим делом она занимается уже на протяжении последних нескольких лет. До этого она работала продавщицей у своей матери, но потом открыла свой бизнес. Кредит будет использован для закуп недорогих женских кофточек для ассортимента. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Let us bring to your attention our next solidarity group from the city of Kadamjai. This city is situated at the border crossing of three independent countries: Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Tajikistan, making this region unique in its diverse ethnic composition. Kadamjai is famous for its sweet cherries and apricots, which are in great demand far beyond the borders of Kyrgyzstan. Let’s start the presentation of the group with its leader, as usual. Bagdagul E. is 34 years old and divorced. She is raising one 14-year-old son, who is attending school. The client is involved in renting wedding dresses and also offering various pre-wedding services, such as make-up and hair styling at her own beauty salon. She has been involved in this business since 2007. Bagdagul learned this trade in the neighboring republic of Uzbekistan. The loan will be used for the purchase of new dresses to be used for future rentals. Kyyamidin is 42 years old. He is married and is raising 2 children. His wife works as a cook. Both of their children go to school. Kyyamidin is involved in breeding small livestock and also livestock sales. The loan will be used for the purchase of 10 heads of small livestock. Gulbara is 34 years old and married. She is a mother of 4 children: 3 daughters and one son. Her husband works as repairman of household appliances. Gulbara is the local distributor of “Oriflame” products and opened the brand-name store. The loan will be used for the purchase of cosmetics. Gulzaada is involved in sales of women’s clothing. She has been in this business for the last several years. Previously, she worked as a salesperson at her mother’s, but then opened her own business. The loan will be used for the purchase of affordable women’s blouses to add to the merchandise variety.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Safari Indah Group

texts.en:
"NI NYOMAN S. (0) is a 35 year-old female living in the town of MELAYA-BALI.  NI NYOMAN is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is SAFARI INDAH (MUK-0012).


NI NYOMAN is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, NI NYOMAN owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  NI NYOMAN has been engaged in this business for over 1 years and earns approximately 500000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2010, NI NYOMAN joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  NI NYOMAN is requesting for the first time a loan from MUK.    She is now requesting a new loan of 1500000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from MUK.  NI NYOMAN plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children.


About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





NI NYOMAN S. (0) merupakan 35 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota MELAYA-BALI.  NI NYOMAN adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah SAFARI INDAH (MUK-0012).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak sapi untuk dijual.  NI NYOMAN sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, NI NYOMAN menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, NI NYOMAN bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  NI NYOMAN meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.


  "

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Nadina

texts.en: Nadina M. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog city. She is 29 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Nadina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nadina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Nadina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 62 years old, married, and has five children aged 9, 9, 14, 16 and 18 years accordingly. He lives with his family in Benin City.
John is a businessman who sells motor spare parts in one of the leading spare parts markets in Benin City. He has been in the business for over 18 years and makes his living from it. He uses his income to take care of his family, reinvest into his business, and improve his business.
As a hardworking man, John wants to expand his business further, and is therefore requesting a loan of 170,000 NGN to purchase more motor spare parts to sell. He says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthy L. is the village bank president of a group loan for 21 people offered by Kiva partner, AMK. The group is located in Kampong Tuol village in Kandal province. The members of the group will use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Chanthy L. is 36 years old and the mother of three children – one is a construction worker, one is a student in the local school, while the youngest is three years old. She owns a store that sells soup, but faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her business. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to bU. tables, chairs and other items for supporting her business. Her husband, Mr. Boramy Khut, is a teacher who receives a small salary to support his family.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and other items

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie L. is from the village of Magsaysay, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old and single. To make a living, Lorie owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Lorie has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Lorie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lorie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Hoem's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Hoem B. is a 40-year-old married man who lives in Boueng Kroam village in Kandal province. He is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, AMK.
Mr. Hoem B. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field to grow crops. His wife, Mrs. Savorn Cheng, is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support the family. In order to support his wife's business, Mr. Hoem B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetables for resale and a bicycle for transportation. The couple has six children, two of whom are farmers who help their father, and the other four of whom are students in the public school and also help in their parent's business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for resale and a bicycle for transportation

texts.en:
Mrs. Soen P. is the village bank president for a 13-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, AMK. The group members are located in Chey Chumneah village in Kandal province and will use their loans to purchase equipment, supplies and other items for different purposes.
Mrs. Soen P. and her husband, Kol Phon, are farmers who rent a 1.5-hectare field for farming. They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm. Therefore, Mrs. Soen P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her crops. The couple has four children – two are seamstresses in a garment factory, one is a farmer, while the other is a student and helps in the family's farming business.

Mrs. Basilia T. manages a store located at her house in Trinidad, Bohol. Already a widow, she still wants to provide for her family. She also tailors for additional income. She has been a member of Kiva partner CEVI for quite a while now and she say that her previous loans have really helped her business in a big way. Now she is requesting a loan of Php 10, 000, which she will use to add inventory to her store.

Josefina is an unmarried woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She doesn’t have children so has focused her attention on her two nieces. She sends them to school and finds joy in doing it. She has been running her store for years now and she said that out of her income from it, she was able to acquire home appliances.  Josefina is requesting a loan of Php15, 000. She will use this loan to acquire additional supplies for her store.

Cresencio, a married man, has twelve children. He fishes for a living. His wife sells everything he catches from the sea. He said that having a big family bring a lot of challenges in their life.  However, Cresencio is eager to work hard so he can meet his family needs and also improve their living condition. He has requested a loan of Php 11, 000 from Kiva partner CEVI. He will use it to buy fishing equipment. This loan will really help Cresencio have more fish to sell.

Gideon is a 50 year-old married man. He has been selling livestock to the residents of Masii and its outskirts for ten years.  He also farms to earn additional income. He has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya to add more stock of cattle for sale.  He hopes that this loan will improve his business thereby increasing his sales and profit margins.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: M.. Seangheng C. is 46 years-old. She is the village bank president for a group loan for 12 persons offered by Kiva partner AMK and located in Sampan Kraom village in Kandal province. With the loan, all the members hope to increase their income in order to improve the famiL. lifestyles. M.. Seangheng C. is a laborer who receives a small salary to support her famiL.. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns a small income to support the famiL..  M.. Seangheng is requesting a loan of 800,000 Riels to fix up her home. M.. Seangheng is the mother of five children, two of whom stay at home while the other three attend the local school.

“By God’s grace, I can still bear harvesting coconuts at my age,” says 70-year-old Cresencia, who makes vinegar out of coconuts and sells them at her store. She also raises pigs to have additional income. Her businesses have helped her family a great deal, and she also wants her grandchildren to benefit from them. Cresencia has been a member of CEVI for quite a while now, and previous loans have helped sustain her enterprises. She is now requesting a loan of Php7,000 to help increase her working capital.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam M., a 25-year-old married mother of an infant, is from the village of Gingoog City where she owns and operates a retail store selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Meriam has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Meriam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first from HSPFI, to purchase additional products to sell, Meriam plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the needs of her relatives.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

texts.en: Mrs. Poch S. is 37 years old and the leader of a 4-member group loan offered by AMK, located in Chey Chumneah village in Kandal province. Mrs. Poch S. is a grocery seller who owns a small store to resell the groceries (white sugars, peppers, mono sodium glutamate, garlic, and so on). Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell. With this business, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living situation. Her husband, Mr. Pou Hai, is a police officer who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has six children, one of whom is staying at home, while another four are students in the local school, and the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.name: Kigo Namatovu Jesica Group

texts.en: Jesica N. is a hardworking 31-year-old businesswoman, married with four children attending school and taking care of two additional dependents also attending school. She has operated her retail shop for over four years and will use the loan to purchase retail shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, cooking oil, etc. Jessica's dream is to improve upon the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, rice, cooking oil, and so forth.

texts.en:
Cheryl C., from the village of Gingoog City, is 38 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Cheryl owns and operates a business whose main income derives from making and selling specialty food such as tocino, longganiza and more processed food products in the local community. Cheryl has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cheryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first from HSPFI, to invest in expanding the business, Cheryl plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Mrs. Kheng D., a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Preaek Ruessei village, Kandal Province, is a tailor earning a small income to improve her family's living standards. Her husband, Mr. Vong Noun, is an iron welder who also makes a small income to help support the family. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Kheng D. is requesting a loan to buy more metals to make doors to sell. She hopes this loan will help to increase her family's income.

This couple has one child who is too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 70-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has nine children, most of whom already have their own families. Erlinda manages a sari-sari (general) store located at her house. She sells oil, vinegar and other basic necessities that her neighbors look for daily. This business has been the source of her income for more than a few years now.
Erlinda joined Kiva partner, CEVI, in 2003 and is still happy to be a member. She says that her previous loan really helped her business and her family in a big way. She is now applying for a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to acquire additional supplies for her store.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

texts.fr:
Jeanne L. est présidente du groupe de crédit Tujikaze, qui lève la main droite sur la photo, cliente de l’IMF Hekima au 13e cycle, âgée de 38 ans, mère d’un  enfant  qui va à l’école et  son mari est Enseignant. 
Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente de Ciment avec son fond propre appuyé par le crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle loue avec 30$ un petit  dépôt sur la boulevard Terminus Katindo où elle vend le ciment et la chaux. Elle vend également de Fanta  à  domicile pour augmenter ses revenus.  
Jeanne L. souhaite obtenir plus des crédits pour accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et  construire une maison en matériaux durable pour sa famille. 
Le groupe Tujikaze est composé de 20 membres.  Il sied d’indiquer que sur la photo  le visage de la cliente maria B.  n’est pas visible.
texts.en:
Jeanne L. is president of the Tujikaze credit loan group (she’s the one raising her right hand on the picture), which has been a client of the Hekima IMF through 13 loan cycles. She is 38 years old, mother of one child attending school, and is married to a teacher. She started her small business selling cement with her own funds, supplemented by the loan from Hekima IMF. For $30/month, she rents a small warehouse on the Terminus Katingo Boulevard, where she sells cement and lime. She also sells soft drinks from her home to increase her income. Jeanne L. would like to have a larger credit loan so that she can expand her business and build a house made of durable materials for her family. The Tujikaze group has 20 members. It should be noted that the picture does not show the face of group member Maria B..

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie B. is from Gingoog City. She is 26 years old and married. To make a living, Jessie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jessie has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Jessie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 34-year-old married woman with four children. She manages a general store, which is situated at her house in Trinidad, Bohol. She does her best to earn enough income to provide for her family’s needs, especially her children’s education.
