She says that one of the challenges she and her husband face is the increasing school fees they have to pay.
Marivic would like to request a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use this loan to add inventory to her store. Her dream is for her business to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 34 years old, married, and the father of two school-aged children. He has been running a restaurant for four years and he has six employees to assist him in the business. He also runs a construction company, a taxi business, and a cereals shop in rural areas. Before he ventured into these businesses, he was employed in a stationery supermarket.
Since Anthony joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by saving his money and taking out loans to grow his business. He hopes to open further branches and increase his investments in the future. He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES to renovate his premises, add stock to his business, and buy a cooker to cook chips and mandazi (Kenyan doughnuts). He describes himself as ambitious, hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To renovate his restaurant, add stock and buy a cooker

texts.en: Firas is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents and 3 siblings. He has studied computers in an academy in his town and he has working at the same time in this occupation to gain experience. And since 2 months ago, he opened a computer shop where he sells computers, and laptops accessories in addition to repair service. He opened his shop with a limited work operation due to his savings and today, he wants to make his business operation bigger, that's why he is asking for a loan of $500 to buy additional merchandise needed to expand his business.

K. is a 32-year-old God-fearing man. He runs a cafeteria where he sells food and drinks to his neighbors.  He has two employees to assist him in the business.  He also keeps animals to earn extra profits. He dreams of building his own hotel in the future. He has requested a loan of kes 30,000 to purchase flour, sugar, soda and other food stuff in the cafeteria.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim U. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. PhU. Morm, have been married for over twenty years and have two daughters. All of them work in a garment factory. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sim and her husband are fishermen. They catch fish from the Tonle Sap River and sell the fish in their village. Besides of fishing, Sim is a fishing nets repairer as well, she repairs fishing nets and gets the fees. 
Sim used to ask for Kiva loan to level up her house foundation. By the way, the house where she lives breaks down in some part, it’s difficult for family members to live. That’s why she is requesting another loan in the amount of US$400 to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives.

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old and married with three children who attend school.   She sells fruits, onions, tomatoes and potatoes in an open air market. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to offer her children better education.   She hopes to increase her finances and have high standards of living in the future.   She has requested a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock and expand her business.  She describes herself as hardworking, faithful, and self reliant.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

texts.en: Violet is a 27 year old married lady. She is a mother of one child who is in school.   Her husband works for a transport company.    She has been buying clothes and re-selling them to earn some profit for five years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business profits have increased.  She plans to expand her business to a wholesale in the future.  She has requested a loan of kes 90,000 to add stock of clothes. She describes herself as hardworking and honest.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en:
Mrs. Orn Sann, age 35, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Tit, age 32, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have no children yet. She also has her sister, who is a rice farmer, living with her. 

Orn has been selling fruit (banana and mango) for five years. She buys fruits under contract from her village and transports to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a wooden-house builder for fifteen years, a skill he learned from his uncle. 
Orn doesn’t have enough capital to purchase mango for resale, so she is requesting her first loan of 200USD to help her capital.

loans.use: To purchase mango under contract for resale.

texts.en: Peter is a 33-year-old, hardworking and determined married man. He runs a general shop where he sells cereals, green vegetables, fruit and drinks to his neighbours. He previously sold electronics, before he ventured into this business. Since he joined Faulu Kenya his capital has increased and he has been able to diversify from selling electronics to having a general store. He plans to grow his business and to buy household assets in the future. He has requested a loan of KES 80,000 to add stock of flour, juice, soda, detergent and other products. He has previously taken a loan of KES 140,000 and demonstrated responsibility and punctuality when completing his payments.

John is a 36-year-old married man with three children. He is a hardworking man who sells DVDs and CDs as well as videocassettes.  He has been in this business for fifteen years. For more profit, he also sells spare parts and provides transport services. He has been able to improve his business through Faulu Kenya. This is because he was previously hawking radio cassettes and videotapes. He has requested for a loan of KES 80,000 to add stock of tyres, windscreens, suspension and paint.  He hopes to get a better market for his products and to open a music shop. He sees himself buying a plot and building a family house in the future.

Rabih, a 22-year-old single man, worked for five years designing furniture with his uncle. In 2006, he started working on his own, taking private orders and building  a good business reputation.  Now Rabih is asking to borrow $1,000 so he can continue to expand his business and purchase woods to make a variety of products and meet the demands of his clients. He is certain that the loan will be very useful in improving both his business volume and his  family's economic status.

Simon, a 55-year-old man, is married and has three children in school.  He is a self-motivated man who has been running a pharmacy for fifteen years.  Besides the pharmacy, he also does farming for extra income. His wife is also a business lady. He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, his living standard has improved. He has requested for a loan of KES 80,000 to add stock of medicine. He hopes to open other business outlets in the future. He sees himself expanding his business into a wholesale shop.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a diligent man who has been operating a butcher shop for five years in Dandora, Nairobi. He has also been able to open up a cafeteria next to his butcher shop through Faulu Kenya, which is a partner of Kiva.  He hopes to improve the standards of his cafeteria, hence he has requested for a KES 80,000 loan.  He also wants to use part of this loan to buy meat to stock his butcher shop. He has employed one person in his butcher and he dreams of employing more people in the future.  David is married and has three children.

loans.use: Improve cafe and add stock of meat.

loans.name: Manith

texts.en:
Mrs. Manith K. (pictured above), 45, and her husband, Mr. Senghorn Toun, 41, live in a small village across Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1985 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of the daughters weaves silk at home and the other two attend school.     

Manith has been a silk weaver for 10 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has been a security guard for five months.
Manith is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim M., age 31, (in the picture) and her husband, Mr. Het Hun, age 35, live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1997 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of them are in school. Besides her children, she also has her mother living with her. 

Sim and her husband have been farming for ten years. They grow vegetables and rice on the farmland in the village. Sim is asking for her first loan of US$600 in order to purchase pipe and a water pumping machine to irrigate the vegetables and rice on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase pipe and a water pumping machine.

texts.en: Phylles is a 31-year-old lady, married and blessed with three children. Two of the children go to school. She has been running a retail shop for five years, where she sells household items to the local residents. She was previously vending water but the need to obtain a stable income made her open a retail shop. She has two employees to assist her in the business. She hopes to grow her business and to start her own school in the future. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to add stock of sugar, rice and other products. She describes herself as active and hardworking.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 19 year old single woman living with her parents and 6 brothers and sisters. In 2007, she started a tailoring business from her home. She makes all types of tailored dresses, robes, pants, etc., upon request by her customers, in addition to also offering repair services. With her business income she helps her father with the family's expenses. 

Today, Khadija is requesting a $1,000 loan to buy an additional sewing machine and thread to be able to satisfy her customers' demands and increase her business productivity. And, with the new sewing machine, she will be able to deliver her services faster.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a business-man; he sells electronics in one of the popular markets in Benin City. He sells all kinds of electronics in his shop, e.g. automatic voltage regulator, DVD player, TV cable and more. He has been in the business for over 30 years. From this business he makes his living and takes good care of his family.
 
John wants to stock up his shop with more electronics. He is requesting for loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more electronics to sell and to increase his income. 

He is 60 years old, married, and has 3 children who are doing well. He says thank you to all kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell.

texts.en: Tom is 40 and married and has three children who attend school. He has been running a cafeteria for two years. He also operates a retail shop to earn more income. He was previously employed as a salesman. He renovated his cafeteria with his first loan of KES 20,000 from Faulu Kenya, hence increasing his profits. He wants a loan of KES 50,000 to buy outside catering equipment. He hopes to open other chains of businesses in the country. He describes himself as ambitious, hardworking and focused.

Olmas is a 63-year-old woman. She lives in Nookat with her family. She is married with 9 children, although only one daughter lives with her. The other 8 live separately. Her husband is a pensioner. Three of her children have a common business cultivating sunflowers. This loan will be used to buy seeds and to rent agricultural land. Her seasonal income is about 3,000 dollars. She has more than 2 hectares of land. 

Gulzada, 46, is a widow with 8 children. Five young children live with our client. She is involved in a livestock trade business. She began this business with just 2 sheep. At the present time she has 20 sheep, 1 horse, 2 cows and 1 calf. This loan will be used to buy a few sheep to sell later. 

Mayranhon is 63 years old. She is married and has 7 children. Most of her children are working in Russia. Her husband is a pensioner. They cultivate wheat. This year they are planning to sow wheat in 7 hectares of land. Loan will be used for fertilizers and seeds. 

Inoyat is a widow. She is a mother of 8 children: 4 daughters and 4 sons. All daughters are married. She has land where she cultivates wheat. This loan will be used to buy seeds. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Agnes is a 46-year-old married lady.  In the last ten years, she has been running a tailoring shop where she has employed one person. She was formerly employed as a receptionist. She also earns a living from her mobile money transfer business. She wants a loan of KES 60,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock of fabric. She hopes to market her business so as to get more profits. She also dreams of opening other business outlets in the future. Agnes has two children in school. She describes herself as a focused, a visionary and a hardworking lady.

loans.name: Almada Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son de la Compañía Almada de la Ciudad de Caacupe. 

Son señoras  que trabajan en su mayoría como artesanas en sus propios hogares, realizan todo tipo de artículos  en goma como ser planteras, alfombras y muchos otros artículos, en temporadas anteriores al programa comité de mujeres ya trabajaban comercialmente pero en menor escala, por eso es que en estos días, al formar parte del programa de Comité de mujeres emprendedoras,  existe una actitud de sentido de pertenencia de las mismas para mantenerse al tanto de los requerimientos que les exige la fundación a modo  de que sigan siendo beneficiadas recibiendo un capital para satisfacer sus necesidades, invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios que les generara más ingresos a la unidad familiar.Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la fundación, y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.

Una de las socias es la señora Eliana V. quien posee un negocio en su domicilio ella se dedica a la atención de su negocio y a labores de la casa, comenta que la ganancia del su negocio ayuda para la alimentación de su familia, por ello quiere seguir trabajando y mantenerlo para continuar con esa ayuda tan importante para la familia.
El crédito que ella solicitó ló destino en la compra de artículos que ella vende en su negocio, en general todo lo referente a la canasta básica familiar.
texts.en:
These ladies are from the “Compañía Almada” in the city of Caacupe. Most of these women are artisans who work out of their homes. They make many types of rubber articles, such as planters, rugs, and many other things. Prior to their involvement with the women’s committee, they had been working at smaller scales. This is why, since they became part of the “Committee for Entrepreneurial Women,” there exists a sense of belonging and a desire to continue to fulfill the foundation’s requirements which allow them to receive capital to satisfy their needs and invest in their small businesses. The businesses brings income into their families. They are grateful for the wonderful opportunity that the foundation gives them and each day they hope to further themselves and acquire experience within the program and meet their obligations as associates. One of the associates, Eliana, runs her business out of her home and also attends to the household tasks. She tells us that the revenue from her business helps feed her family, so she wants to continue working and maintaining her business, in order to continue providing this important help to her family. She requested this loan to buy the items she sells in her business, namely all the basic foods a family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, flour, pasta, baked goods, oils and dairy products

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
47-year-old Agnatha lives in Benin City. She is married and has 5 children. Her children are between the ages of 13 and 23 years. She sells tailoring materials to customers at retail prices and has been in the trade for some years. She assists her husband in responding to some family needs like food, buying the children’s schoolbooks, clothing, etc. 

Her last Kiva loan was used to boost her business and she is happy about the improvement her business has experienced. Agnatha hopes to expand her business; she is requesting for loan amount of NGN 150, 000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She hopes to repay back her loan at the due date. She expresses her huge gratitude to Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for their initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Ko'e Pyahu Kuñakuerape Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son del Barrio San Blas de la Ciudad de Caacupe. 

Son señoras que en su mayoría trabajan como comerciantes en venta de todo tipo de productos como ser ropas, artículos de mercería, joyas, comestibles y pequeñas despensa. Todas trabajan con mucho esfuerzo y salir adelante de manera digno con toda la familia.

Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la Fundación, y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.
Entre las integrantes encuentra la señora Maria A. quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, ella ofrece sus productos de forma ambulante recorriendo las casa  y negocios de sus cliente, el trabajo de la señora es muy sacrificado.
Ella se muy temprano a la mañana para ir al mercado y abastecerse de sus productos, actualmente quiere abrir un puesto de venta  frente a casa   , el crédito fue utilizado para la compra de frutas y verduras para vender.
texts.en:
The women listed are from the San Blas neighborhood of the city of Caacupe. Most of the women work as merchants selling all types of products such as clothing, dry goods, jewelry, or food. Some operate small convenience stores. They all put a lot of effort into their work so that they and their families can get ahead in a dignified fashion.

They are all thankful for the valuable opportunity offered to them by la Fundación Paraguaya and hope that each day they are able to acquire experience in the program and fulfill their obligations as members.

Among the members is Señora Maria A. who is engaged in the sale of fruits and vegetables. She offers her products on an itinerant basis going to the houses and businesses of her customers. Her work is very difficult.

She gets up very early in the morning in order to go to the market and supply herself with her products. Currently she wants to open a sales stand in front of her house. The loan is for the purchase of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables such as apples, pears, oranges, tomatoes, carrots, onions, and peppers.

loans.name: God Is In Control Group

texts.en:
Helena G. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Is In Control. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children, aged 5 and 11 years old. She did not continue her education through 11th grade.
For 5 years, Helena has been selling cosmetics such as soap and body cream at the Smell No Taste Market in Harbel, Liberia. She sells good quality products, which keeps customers returning. 
She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 20,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more body cream and soaps. Her goal is to grow her business to a bigger store and to give her children a higher education.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Helena is the one holding the sign.  Mamie C. is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more body cream and soaps.

loans.name: Mataeva Bahrinisa`s Group

texts.en:
Bahrinisa is 52 years old. She is married with 4 children: 3 sons and 1 daughter. Her elder son is 21 years old and he is a builder. The other go to school. Her husband is a pensioner. For more than 20 years her family has been involved in the animal breeding business. Now she has a milk cow and 1 calf. This loan will be used to buy 2 sheep. Also, she makes national house textiles. 

Nurgul, 30, is a married lady. She has 4 children. The two elder children go to school; the other two are still too young. Her husband works in the local post office. This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and seed potatoes. They are planning to sow the potatoes in the upcoming weeks. 

Usan is 59 years old. He is married and has 2 sons. His wife is a pensioner. Both of his sons work in Russia. Usan is a doctor in a village medical center. Beyond this, they have some livestock and a farming business. This loan will be used to buy 2 sheep and to sow corn. 

Umirhon, 39, is a mother of 4 sons. Her husband works as an accountant in the water users association. This loan will be used to buy 2 bulls. She also sells milk and milk products as well as fattens the livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135


If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy livestock for farming businesses, seeds for farming.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, age 53, is married with six children and lives in Benin City with her family. She sells girls' clothing, such as skirts, shirts, belts, and underwear. She has been in the business for more than 20 years. She is a responsible and dedicated member of LAPO. She pays her loan payments on the due dates.

Paulina hopes to expand the size of her business by buying more girls' clothing to sell, as this will improve her income. She is requesting a loan of 170,000 NGN in order to purchase more girls' clothing to sell.

Paulina believes in women playing a vital role in the home, such as providing food and clothing. With the proceeds from her business, she has been able to do this successfully. Her husband is also a trader; he sells electronics. They hope to give their children the best life. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more girls' clothing to sell

loans.name: Mahawa

texts.en:
Mahawa B. is happily married with three children. She is 37 years old, and she has been in business for 20 years. She owns a big shop, where she sells herbal medicine, native soaps, cooking pots, insecticides, melons, cosmetics, dyes, and honey. She has been a member of LAPOSL credit group for two years. She has reinvested the profits from a previous loan back into the business in order to achieve her dream of having a large retail shop. With this loan of 4,000,000 SLL, she will purchase herbal medicine, native soaps, cooking pots, insecticides, sewing materials, honey, melons, and dyes.

Mahawa B. has determined that through adequate access to credit, she will break out of the grip of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase herbal medicine, native soaps, cooking pots, insecticides, sewing materials, honey, melons, and dyes

texts.ru: Хамидов Аскаршох проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. У него небольшой коровник, где он разводит скот. В этой деятельности ему помогает жена. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Он откармливает и продает скот.
texts.en:
Askarshoh H. lives in the Kulob district. He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He has a small cowshed, where he breeds livestock. His wife helps him with this business. Askarshoh is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. He raises and sells livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
Haidar is a 26 year old single man living with his mother and brothers. When he has only 11 years old, he started in the field of working as a mechanic to earn an income to help with the many expenses of his family. And then, in 2003, when he was older and had more experience, he opened his own car repair shop to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He helps, along with his brothers, to improve the family's living situation. 

Today, Haidar is requesting a loan of $1,000 to renew his mechanic equipment and acquire newer tools in order to develop and expand his business.

loans.use: To renew his mechanic equipment and add more advanced tools.

texts.en:
David S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called The Fullness of Time. He is 53 years old, married, and has eight children who range in age from 3 to 23 years old. He was able to graduate from high school but could not continue to college due to poverty.

For two years, David has been selling charcoal at the Thinker Village in Paynesville, Liberia. He sells good charcoal in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.

David plans to use his 6,000-LRD portion of this 30,000-LRD group loan to buy more charcoal. His goals are to grow his business and to have a good life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, David is the person holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socioeconomic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and LEAP puts emphasis on lending to women.

texts.ru: Забирова Хосиятмо проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 40 лет. Замужем, не имеет детей. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупно- рогатого скота. Имеет небольшой коровник. Покупает молодых бычков, откармливает и продает на рынке. В этом ей помогает муж. Она одновременно занимается растениеводством. У нее земельный участок. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота. Она хочет купить дойную корову и продавать молоко.
texts.en:
Hosiyatmo Z. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 40 years old, married and has no children. She earns a living by breeding cattle and has a small cowshed. Hosiyatmo buys young bulls, raises and sells them at the market. Her husband helps her with this business. She is also involved in agriculture and has a plot of land. Hosiyatmo is requesting the loan for the purchase of cattle. She wants to buy a dairy cow and sell milk.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

Ali is a 30 year old married man and father of 3 school-aged children. He has owned a car repair shop for the past 14 years. He is a specialist in repairing the bodies of cars. He repairs all types of cars. His purpose in life is to provide a better life for his children and to educate them through university. That’s the reason why he works hard to earn income and realize this purpose. 

Today, Ali is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools to replaced the old ones in order to expand his business and pursue more work as a freelance mechanic.

loans.name: San Isidro-(Cabañas) Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son de la compañía Cabañas de la cuidad de Caacupé.
Son señoras que en su mayoría trabajan como comerciantes en venta de todo tipo de productos como ser ropas, artículos de mercería, dulces, plantas, y pequeñas despensas.
Cada una posee una actividad independiente, así la señora Sonia quien se dedica  a la venta de plantas, ella con su marido trabaja en un vivero donde producen las plantas para la venta. Producen todo tipo de plantas , con flores y plantas perennes, y forestales.
Comenta doña Sonia que temporadas con mucha venta y otras con pocas  pero es el trabajo a que nos dedicamos y siempre encontramos la forma de salir adelante, el crédito nos ayuda mucho por que mediante ella pudimos comprar las bolsas para las macetas y otras materias primas que se utilizan para la producción de un vivero.

Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la Fundación, y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.
texts.en:
The women above are from the group "Cabañas" in the city of Caacupé. The majority of these women work as traders, some sell various products such as clothing, notions, sweets, plants, and others have small grocery stores. Each one has their own independent business, such as Sonia, who sells plants. She and her husband work in a nursery where they produce plants for sale. They grow all types of plants, including flowers, perennials and trees. Sonia comments that, "in some seasons the sales are high and in others they are low, but this is the work that we do and we always find a way to get ahead. The loan helps us very much because we are able to buy disposable pots for seedlings and other raw materials that are used in production in the nursery." These women are grateful for the valuable opportunity provided to them by the Fundación, and they hope each day to take advantage of the training and experiences that they acquire within the program so that they can fulfill their obligations as members.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy disposable pots for seedlings

texts.en:
Kamel is 28 years old, single, and lives with his two parents. He has been working as an electrician for seven years. He works on construction projects as well as undertaking freelance work offering domestic electrical services on customer request. Like the majority of Lebanese young men, Kamel tries to work hard to help his parents with the family income.
Today, Kamel is requesting to borrow $500 USD to purchase more tools needed for his business. This will enable him to take on more projects and earn a good income.

loans.name: Eladia

texts.es:
Eladia  tiene 58 años, es madre soltera de dos hijas. Es modista desde hace más de 30 años, su taller lo tiene en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija, quienes constantemente acuden a ella para solicitarle algún tipo de ropa que está a la moda. Según relata la señora este oficio también requiere estar actualizada en las nuevas tendencias, esto le permite interpretar los nuevos gustos de su clientela.
Eladia confecciona ropas para uniformes de empresas, colegios y algunos pedidos especiales como ropa para fiestas, quince años, entre otros. Esta sabiduría y el arte de transformar las telas la señora Eladia lo está transmitiendo a sus hijas y sobrinas, quienes en algunas ocasiones la suelen ayudar según la cantidad de trabajo y  pedido que recibe.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar, telas, hilos, botones, entre otros productos para poder hacer frente a los numerosos pedidos que tenia.
texts.en:
Eladia is 58 years old and is a single mother of two daughters. She has been a dressmaker for more than 30 years. Her workshop is in her home and she has regular customers who always return to ask for the latest style in clothing. For this reason, she has to stay informed about the newest trends in fashion. Eladia makes uniforms for businesses, schools, and some special orders for parties, quinceañeras (15th birthday celebrations for girls), and others. She is passing this knowledge and art of transforming cloth to her daughters and nieces, who help out when there are a lot of orders. With the loans she obtained from Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to buy cloth, thread, buttons and other supplies to keep up with her many orders.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies such as cloth, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Abdel-Salam

texts.en:
Abdel-Salam is a married man of 44 years and father of 2 young children. He has owned a barber shop in his town for the past 20 years. He caters to a wide range of clientele from the village and its neighborhoods. He is well known in the whole region and he always tries to be up to date will all the new cuts. 

Today, Abdel-Salam wants to improve the decor of his barber shop by buying specially designed barber chairs and new haircutting equipment. In order to do so, Abdel-Salam is requesting $1,000.

loans.use: To improve the decor of his barbershop by buying specially designed barber chairs and new equipment.

loans.name: Germán

texts.es: El Sr. Germán tiene 53 años casado con la Sra. María Eduvigis Lesme de 52 años, el matrimonio tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad, el cliente se dedica a la fabricación y ventas de muebles en general, aberturas y puertas. Con una antigüedad  de más de 15 años en el mercado de la zona, cuenta con clientela bien formada, solicita apoyo de la fundación paraguaya y Kiva con un crédito, para la compra de maderas, materia prima fundamental para su producción, y así cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Sr. Germán, age 53, is married to Sra. María Eduvigis Lesme, age 52. They have three grown children. He is engaged in making and selling furniture, windows and doors. With more than 15 years of experience in his local market he can count on a loyal clientele.

He is applying for help from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva with a loan for the purchase of wood, the raw material for his production, in order to fulfill the demand from his customers and increase his family income.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood for making furniture.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas has worked as a van driver for the past 15 years. He is 26 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. He offers his transportation services in his town and its surroundings. He also works on a private basis upon request of his clients, such as for picnics, private travels, etc., to make extra money for his family. He has consistently paid on time and he has even repaid the full loan amount earlier than his scheduled end date. 

And today, Abbas is requesting a new loan of $1,500 to carry out maintenance work on his van to increase its safety features.

loans.use: To carry out maintenance work on his van.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 39 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos varones. Posee  un taller y lavadero de motos instalada en una propiedad que adquirió hace como 5 años de un pariente y hace 2 años que monto su taller, un sobrino suyo esta como ayudante en el taller.  Cuenta con una clientela fija ya que sus servicios tiene  muy buena aceptación por los clientes.
Con este  préstamo de la Fundación Paraguaya podrá comprar los repuestos para motos y hacer frente a la numerosa demanda que tiene en su taller.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, married, and has 2 sons. He has a motorcycle workshop and motorcycle washer set up on property that he acquired 5 years ago from a relative. He started up his workshop two years ago, and his nephew works there as his assistant. He has a regular clientele, since his services have been well-received by his customers. With this loan from the Fundación Paraguaya he will be able to buy spare parts for the motorcycles and meet the many demands of his customers in his workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for motorcycles (covers, carburetors, accelerator cables, signal lights, etc.)

loans.name: Trust Development Group, Mukono

texts.en:
B. Vincent (pictured inset top left as well as in the group photo) is the leader of his lending group in Mukono, a group that meets in a church. He is 33 years old and married with four children, the eldest of whom is eight years old. He also takes care of four siblings.
Vincent is from Terere village. For the past six years, he has worked as a boda-boda (bicycle taxi) driver and a builder. His main business challenge is the scarcity of clients for both businesses, but despite this, he is able to make 70,000 UGX profits every week. He works very hard to ensure that he earns enough to pay school fees for his children so that they can have a better future. Vincent is requesting a loan to buy more equipment for his building business so that he can provide better services. He hopes to buy, among other things, a wheelbarrow and a ladder.

loans.use: To buy a wheelbarrow and a ladder, plus other items

texts.en: Badiha is a 44 year old married woman and mother of 3 young children. Since 1990, she has run a tailoring business from her home. She makes different products, in addition to repairing clothes. During this period, her work has increased and she needs to borrow $1,200 to purchase 2 sewing machines to be able to expand her work and to deliver her tailoring services more quickly to her clients. And with this loan, she is certain that her business productivity will increase and also her client base.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramón González Cáceres es casado y vive en el barrio Virgen del Rosario 2 de la ciudad de Caacupe.

 El  señor Juan Ramón  es muy trabajador y se dedica a la venta de  polietileno y también fabrica y vende Cuadros, Botiquín  y espejos. Comenzó con un pequeño capital y gracias al buen trato con sus clientes  el negocio va creciendo día a día.   

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas láminas de paisaje para cuadros y espejos, para cubrir los pedidos con que cuenta y por ende aumentar el ingreso a su unidad familiar.

 Don Juan agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo, brindando sus servicios y productos de buena calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Ramón is married and lives in the Virgen del Rosario 2 neighborhood of Caacupe city. He is very hard working and dedicates his time to selling polyethylene and also, to making and selling picture frames, mirrors, and medicine cabinets. He began with little capital and, thanks to his good treatment of his customers, the business has been growing day by day. Juan requests a loan to buy local laminated wood for frames and mirrors to fill the orders he has and, in sum, to increase the income of his family unit. Juan thanks the Paraguayan Foundation for its help with his activities, making it possible for his business to grow and to offer his services and high quality products to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOOD, LAMINATES, AND MIRRORS FOR HIS CABINET SHOP

loans.name: Ladislao

texts.es:
Ladislao tiene 49 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 varones y 1 mujer. Se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas, en su domicilio tiene montado su horno a leña el cual es utilizado para hornear su chipa, sus 2 hijos varones heredaron la misma profesión quienes lo ayudan para fabricar en mayor cantidad su producto, sus ventas lo realiza en las calles de asunción y los fines de semana en las canchas de futbol. Comenta que los días y horas de oficina tiene una clientela formada que lo espera de las distintas empresas públicas y privadas de la capital.
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar, queso y almidón en cantidad ya que en estas épocas tiende a subir de precios.
texts.en:
Ladislao is 49 years old, is married and has 3 children, 2 sons and 1 daughter. He makes and sells "chipas," Paraguayan cheesy buns. He has set up his wood oven for baking the chipas at his home. His 2 sons inherited the same profession and help him to make his products in greater quantity. He makes his sales on the streets of Asunción and on weekends at the soccer fields. He says that on business days he has a customer base in the different public and private sector companies in the capitol. With the loans he obtained from Fundación Paraguaya, he was able to buy cheese and manioc starch in bulk since prices tend to rise these days.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for preparation of chipas (manioc starch, cheese, milk, fat)

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of her group Fuente de Luz (Source of Light), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.

Maria is excited to be receiving her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of selling underwear by purchasing more merchandise in Santo Domingo, the capital, and then selling it in her community. She will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing a new bed, as well as building a dining area. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 31 year old married man and father of 2 young children. In 2006, he opened a mini-market in his town after seeing a need for such services in the region. His wife also works as a teacher and together they pay for their family's expenses, school expenses, hospitality etc. He offers food products, dairy products, breads, cereals, drinks, and other products to his clients. 

Today, Tarek is requesting a loan of $1,000 to fill his shop with the needed merchandise to increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To fill his shop with needed merchandise.

loans.name: Bavubuka Twekembe Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Sulaiman is the leader of his group in Mukono. He is 35 years old and married with five children. His eldest child is 23 years old. Sulaiman has been in the business of fishing from Namusenyi Landing site for fifteen years, and, although his business is faced by poor fishing methods, he is able to make 280,000 UGX in weekly profits. Sulaiman would like to increase his income, and, with this loan, he hopes to restock and develop a retail shop, which will enable him to get income for school fees. It is for this reason that he needs a loan to boost his retail shop by increasing his capital. Sulaiman is a hardworking and devoted man.

N. Sulaiman is featured in the small photo at the bottom right of the group photo as the group leader although he does not appear in the big group photo.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Watfa

texts.en:
Watfa is a 49 year old married woman with 2 children. When she got married 30 years ago, she started running a tailoring business from her home to earn more income for the family, in addition to being independent with her own business activity. She is well-known in the whole region due to the amount of experience she has in tailoring. She creates many different products, and also offers repairing services. 

Today, Watfa is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a new sewing machine to replace the used one, so that she can faster serve her clients and maintain her good reputation.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Gelva

texts.en:
Gelva is a 31-year-old civil servant living in a two-roomed house with his wife and child. He operates a restaurant in Karuguuza, Uganda, managed by his wife.

Having been in the business for nine months, Gelva dreams of establishing more branches and upgrading the current one to better standards to make it a hotel (bigger restaurant) which he believes is a possibility with the help of credit facilities from HOFOKAM.

Gelva applied for this loan so as to buy a refrigerator and more drinks to sell in his restaurant.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and more drinks to sell

loans.name: God's Power Group, Mukono

texts.en:
N. Hamiati, shown at the top left of the photo, also appears in the group photo and is the leader of her lending group in Mukono. She is 50 years old and a widow with one child who is already grown up. She also takes care of three orphans.

Hamiati has had a dairy and poultry business in Terere for five years and, although she is able to make 50,000/= as weekly profits, this is because her diary business is faced with low productivity.

Hamiati has been successful because of her friendly nature and determination. Her business goal is to ensure that she develops her businesses to ensure that she earns enough to pay school fees for her orphans.

Hamiati needs a loan to be able to buy more chicks for her poultry farm so that her business is boosted.

loans.use: To buy more chicks for her poultry farm

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
Lisandro M. Ocampos, es taxista, la ubicación de su parada está en una zona estratégica del centro de la ciudad.
El crédito que solicita es para inversiones de mantenimiento y mejoramiento de sus unidades de vehículo, que utiliza para el servicio de Taxi.
Lisandro M. Ocampos, es cliente de Fundación Paraguaya desde hace tiempo y se siente muy satisfecho por la atención que le brinda la institución, por la rapidez, la calidez y el buen trato de los empleados.
texts.en:
Lisandro M. Ocampos is a taxi driver. His stand is located in a strategic part of the city's downtown area. The loan he is asking for is for investment in the maintenance and improvement of the vehicle which he uses for his taxi service. Lisandro M. Ocampos has been a customer of Fundación Paraguaya for some time and is very satisfied with the service he receives from the institution, thanks to the promptness, warmth and politeness of its employees

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for vehicle

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is the wife of a banker. At 39 years old, she owns a bar in Karuguuza, Uganda, which she has operated for the last fifteen years.

Though Christine encounters a challenge of retiring late from work, she hopes to see her business grow into a bigger bar and finally into an established hotel (restaurant) because, through the profits from her bar, she has been able to construct a commercial building to increase her family’s income.

Christine plans to use the HOFOKAM loan to purchase more alcohol to sell in the bar and to add take-away food services, too.

loans.use: To purchase more alcohol to sell and to add take-away food services

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a produce dealer, operating his business from Karuguuza, Uganda. Besides selling produce, he also sells local brew which he makes.

A breadwinner for his family of seven people, Joseph is married to a peasant farmer and has been dealing in produce and local brew for the last ten years. He wishes to educate his children up to university level and intends to buy a motor vehicle in the future so as to market his produce and local brew easily.

The purpose of this loan is to buy maize to sell and for making local brew.

loans.use: To buy maize to sell and for making local brew

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis Antonio Páez es casado y vive en el barrio San Antonio  de la ciudad de Caacupe.

 El señor Luis es muy trabajador y se dedica a la artesanía de cuero hace 10 años trabajo que heredo de su padre y gracias a su buen trabajo cuenta con muchos pedidos.

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de cueros y accesorios para la fabricación de su producto y así poder satisfacer la demanda del mercado y por ende aumentar el ingreso a su unidad familiar.

 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo y brindando sus productos con buena calidad.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio Páez is married and lives in the San Antonio neighborhood of the city of Caacupe. Luis is very hard-working and has been working in leather craftsmanship for 10 years. It is a job he inherited from his father, and thanks to his good work, he receives many orders. He is asking for this loan in order to buy leather and accessories for making his products, so he can satisfy market demand and increase his family's income. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for supporting his work, and with this support his business is growing and he is offering good-quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather and accessories for making leather shoes and leather-covered thermoses

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 43-year-old man married to peasant farmer with eight children. He is the family’s income earner and his dream is to have his children go to school up to university level. He owns a house in which his family resides.

Fred has a mobile disco as his business and has been in the business for eighteen years. He started as a tailor then rode a motorcycle for hire. With the help of loans and savings, he bought the disco machines though he dreams of getting modern machines to have an ultra-modern mobile disco.

The purpose of this loan is to buy a generator to enable him easily to operate in areas where there is no electricity.

loans.use: To buy a generator for his mobile disco business

loans.name: Kasenge Women's Group, Mukono

texts.en:
At the top left of the photo of her lending group is N. Justine. She is a determined and hardworking lady aged 58 and a single mother with six children, some of them grown up, and grandchildren to take care of.

Justine is into the business of secondhand clothes and also has had a canteen in Mbalala, Mukono, for fifteen years. Although she has inadequate business capital, she is able to make some profits that have helped her in taking care of her family.

Justine ensures that she attends to her customers well and this will enable her to expand her businesses further. She has a goal of constructing a house for her family with her savings and she needs a loan to be able to restock her clothing and canteen businesses with more goods.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and produce to sell

loans.name: Maria Dora

texts.es:
La señora María Dora V. es casada y vive en el barrio San Miguel de la ciudad de Caacupe.

 La  señora María  es muy trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de productos de librería hace 10 años. Comenzó con un pequeño capital y gracias al buen trato con sus clientes  el negocio está en constante crecimiento.   

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de útiles y uniformes  escolares y así poder satisfacer la demanda del mercado en la temporada de inicio de clases y por ende aumentar el ingreso a su unidad familiar.

 Agradece a la fundación paraguaya el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo y brindando sus servicios a la comunidad.
texts.en:
María Dora V. is married and lives in Caacupe's San Miguel neighborhood. She is very hard-working and has sold stationery supplies for 10 years. She started out with a small capital investment and, thanks to her good customer service, her business is constantly growing. She is asking for funds to buy school supplies and school uniforms to meet customer demand during the start of the new school term thereby increasing her family income. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support it has given to her activity; through it, her business is growing and she is offering her services to the community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies and uniforms for the new school term.

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group D, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Bernald, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is 37 years old and married with nine children, the oldest being at the University and the others being in primary and secondary schools. He also takes care of four dependents.

Bernald is a businessman who has sold produce from Kyabiyorwa Upper Cell for thirty years. Some of his business challenges are the price fluctuations of agricultural products. He ensures that his produce is of good quality and hence wins more customers. His goal is to ensure that he gets his business to grow as well as have a good family.

With Bernald, once he does not have enough produce from his farm, he buys from other farmers to ensure that his customers remain with him. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

loans.name: Ángel

texts.es:
Ángel, tiene 47 años, es casado y vive en la ciudad de Pucyura de la provincia de Anta. Ángel y su esposa Paulina tienen 5 hijos de los cuales la mayor Karen de 26 años es independiente y es profesora, los que depende todavía de los ellos son: Karla tiene 22 años, Katia tiene 18 años, Luz Ángela tiene 10 años y Paula tiene 07 años, ellas viven al lado de sus padres. Los socios desean sacar profesionales a sus hijas menores. Ángel es chofer y transporta materiales de construcción de una ciudad a otra. Ángel requiere el crédito para aumentar el capital del negocio una parte invertirá para comprar llantas nuevas para su camión y la otra parte para invertir en el negocio de fabricaron de bloquetas de su hija karla como por ejemplo comprará cemento.   
 
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Angel is 47 years old, married, and lives in the city of Pucyura, in Anta province. Angel and his wife Paulina have 5 daughters, of which the eldest, Karen, 26, is independent and a teacher. Those who still depend on the parents are: Karla who is 22, Katia 18, Luz Angela 10, and Paula 7. They still live with their parents. Angel and Paulina wish to make professionals of their minor daughters. Angel is a truck driver who transports construction materials from one city to another. He needs the loan to increase his business capital. A part will be used to buy new tires for his truck and another part to invest in his daughter Karla's business of making blocks; for example, to buy cement. Angel is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and, at the same time, he is committed to complying with the designated payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING NEW TIRES AND CEMENT FOR THE FAMILY BUSINESS

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Paulina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 45 años, es casada y vive en la ciudad de Pucyura de la provincia de Anta. Paulina y su esposo Ángel tienen 5 hijas de los cuales la mayor Karen de 26 años es independiente y es profesora, los que depende todavía de los ellos son: Karla que tiene 22 años, Katia que tiene 18 años, Luz Ángela que  tiene 10 años y Paula que tiene 07 años, ellas viven al lado de sus padres. Los socios desean sacar profesionales a sus hijas menores.  Paulina es una mujer trabajadora, honesta, responsable que desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron el valor de trabajo. La socia tiene un negocio familiar con sus hermanos es un grifo donde vende combustible. La socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes. El sueño de la socia es abrir en su domicilió un restaurante donde pueda vender cuy al horno. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de fabricación de bloquetas de cemento de su hija Karla y desea comprar más cemento. 
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Pucyura es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Paulina, 45, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Qory Orcco" communal bank. She is married and lives in the city of Pucyura, Anta province. She and her husband, Ángel, have five daughters. Their eldest, Karen, 26, is a teacher and lives independently. Those still dependent on their parents are: Karla, 22, Katia, 18, Luz Ángela, 10 and Paula, 7. The members would like to see their younger daughters become professionals, too. Paulina is a hard-working, honest, responsible woman who, from a very early age, learned to value work from her parents. She and her siblings have a family gas station. She also raises small farm animals like guinea pigs. Her dream is to open a restaurant in her home serving roasted guinea pig. She needs funds to invest in her daughter Karla's brick-making business; she needs to buy cement. Paulina is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district of the city of Anta, Cusco department. Pucyura is 40 minutes away from Cusco).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group C, Kihihi

texts.en:
T. Violet, shown at the top left and also in the group photo, is the leader of her group in Kihihi. At the top right is B. James who came late for the group photo but is also a member of the same group.

Violet is 37 years old and married with four children, all in secondary school. She also takes care of two dependents. She is a business lady who has been involved in the sale of produce from Kyabiyorwa Upper Cell for three years. Her business is characterized by challenges like the poor seasons and price changes.

Violet ensures that her prices are fair to her customers so as not to scare them away and she hopes to expand her business further for increased profits as well as to have a happier family. She needs a loan to be able to buy more produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more produce to sell

texts.es: La Sra Norma  es viuda con hijos mayores, domiciliado en la ciudad de Caacupe en el Barrio Virgen del Rosario, doña Norma posee una pequeña cantina en su domicilio y en la Escuela de su barrio donde diariamente atiende, solicita el apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, para aumentar mas de mercaderías su negocios y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientelas y así obtener mas ingreso en su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Norma is a widow and has five adult children. She lives in Caacupe's Virgen del Rosario neighborhood. She has a small eatery in her home and in the local neighborhood school. She tends to them daily. She is asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for funding to increase stock items in her businesses so that she can meet customer demand and earn increased family income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Ntungamo Tukore Group B, Kihihi

texts.en:
K. Alice is shown at the top left and also in the group photo of her lending group in Kihihi. She is 52 years old and married with eight children. She also takes care of an orphan. Some of them are at the University, while others are in secondary and primary schools.

Alice has a grocery store where she sells mostly fruit and vegetables and, although she is faced with price fluctuations and poor seasons, she is in a better position to take care of her family. She ensures that she has attractive produce on display and this has helped her increase her profitability. She ensures that her family is happy and together.

Alice will need a loan to be able to increase her stock for business expansion.

loans.use: To increase her stock for business expansion

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Martha is the coordinator of her group “Mata D. Palma en Desarrollo 1,2 Group” (Palm Tree in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children.

Martha is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling clothing and Avon beauty products by purchasing creams, deodorants, makeup and blouses to sell.

Martha will use the profits to invest in repairing her rented home as well as purchasing a computer for her children to learn on. Her long-term goal is to purchase her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products and clothes to sell
